Text

THERE was [a boy called [Eustace Clarence Scrubb]73-eustace]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb , and [he]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb almost deserved it . [[His]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb parents]194-his parents called [him]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb [Eustace Clarence]73-eustace and [masters]195-masters called [him]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb [Scrubb]73-eustace . [I]0-i ca n’t tell [you]196-you how [[his]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb friends]197-his friends spoke to [him]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb , for [he]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb had none . [He]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb did n’t call [[his]193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb Father]198-his father and [Mother]74-mother “ [Father]1821-father ”[193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb] and “ [Mother]1822-mother ”[193-a boy called eustace clarence scrubb] , but [Harold]75-harold and [Alberta]76-alberta . [They]199-they were very up - to - date and [advanced people]200-advanced people . [They]199-they were vegetarians , [non - smokers and teetotallers]201-non - smokers and teetotallers and wore a special kind of underclothes . In [[their]199-they house]202-their house there was very little furniture and very few clothes on beds and the windows were always open .

[Eustace Clarence]73-eustace liked animals , especially beetles , if they were dead and pinned on a card . [He]73-eustace liked books if they were books of information and had pictures of grain elevators or of [fat foreign children]203-fat foreign children doing exercises in [model schools]204-model schools .

[Eustace Clarence]73-eustace disliked [[his]73-eustace cousins]205-his cousins the four Pevensies , [Peter]77-peter , [Susan]78-susan , [Edmund]79-edmund and [Lucy]80-lucy . But [he]73-eustace was quite glad when [he]73-eustace heard that [Edmund]79-edmund and [Lucy]80-lucy were coming to stay . For deep down inside [him]73-eustace [he]73-eustace liked bossing and bullying ; and , though [he]73-eustace was [a puny little person who could n’t have stood up even to [Lucy]80-lucy]206-a puny little person who could n’t have stood up even to lucy , let alone [Edmund]79-edmund , in a fight , [he]73-eustace knew that there are dozens of ways to give [people]207-people a bad time if [you]208-you are in [[your]208-you own home]209-your own home and [they]207-people are only [visitors]210-visitors .

[Edmund]79-edmund and [Lucy]80-lucy did not at all want to come and stay with [Uncle Harold]75-harold and [Aunt Alberta]76-alberta . But it really could n’t be helped . [Father]81-father had got a job lecturing in [America]1-america for sixteen weeks that summer , and [Mother]74-mother was to go with [him]81-father because [she]74-mother had n’t had a real holiday for ten years . [Peter]77-peter was working very hard for an exam and [he]77-peter was to spend the holidays being coached by [old Professor Kirke]82-old professor kirke in whose house [these four children]211-these four children had had wonderful adventures long ago in the war years . If [he]81-father had still been in [that house]212-that house [he]81-father would have had [them]211-these four children all to stay . But [he]81-father had somehow become poor since the old days and was living in [a small cottage]213-a small cottage with only [one bedroom to spare]214-one bedroom to spare . It would have cost too much money to take the other three all to [America]1-america , and [Susan]78-susan had gone .

[Grown - ups]215-grown - ups thought [her]78-susan [the pretty one of [the family]217-the family]216-the pretty one of the family and [she]78-susan was no good at school work ( though otherwise very old for [her]78-susan age ) and [Mother]74-mother said [she]78-susan “ would get far more out of a trip to [America]1-america than [the youngsters]1823-the youngsters ”[78-susan] . [Edmund]79-edmund and [Lucy]80-lucy tried not to grudge [Susan]78-susan [her]78-susan luck , but it was dreadful having to spend the summer holidays at [[their]211-these four children Aunt]218-their aunt ’s . “ But it ’s far worse for [me]79-edmund , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund , “ because [you]80-lucy ’ll at least have [a room of [your]80-lucy own]1824-a room of your own and [I]79-edmund shall have to share [a bedroom]1825-a bedroom with [that record stinker]1826-that record stinker , [Eustace]73-eustace . ”[79-edmund]

The story begins on an afternoon when [Edmund]79-edmund and [Lucy]80-lucy were stealing a few precious minutes alone together . And of course [they]211-these four children were talking about [Narnia]2-narnia , which was the name of [[their]211-these four children own private and secret country]219-their own private and secret country . [Most of [us]221-us]220-most of us , [I]0-i suppose , have [a secret country]222-a secret country but for most of [us]221-us it is only [an imaginary country]223-an imaginary country . [Edmund]79-edmund and [Lucy]80-lucy were luckier than [other people]224-other people in that respect . [[Their]211-these four children secret country]225-their secret country was real . [They]211-these four children had already visited [it]225-their secret country twice ; not in a game or a dream but in reality . [They]211-these four children had got [there]226-there of course by Magic , which is the only way of getting to [Narnia]2-narnia . And a promise , or very nearly a promise , had been made [them]211-these four children in [Narnia]2-narnia itself that [they]211-these four children would some day get back . [You]227-you may imagine that [they]211-these four children talked about it a good deal , when [they]211-these four children got the chance .

[They]211-these four children were in [[Lucy]80-lucy ’s room]228-lucy ’s room , sitting on the edge of [her]80-lucy bed and looking at a picture on the opposite wall . It was the only picture in [the house]229-the house that [they]211-these four children liked . [Aunt Alberta]76-alberta did n’t like it at all ( that was why it was put away in [a little back room upstairs]230-a little back room upstairs ) , but [she]76-alberta could n’t get rid of it because it had been a wedding present from [someone [she]76-alberta did not want to offend]231-someone she did not want to offend .

It was a picture of [a ship]232-a ship — [a ship sailing straight towards [you]227-you]233-a ship sailing straight towards you . [Her]76-alberta prow was gilded and shaped like the head of a dragon with wide - open mouth . [She]76-alberta had only one mast and one large , square sail which was a rich purple . The sides of [the ship]234-the ship — what [you]227-you could see of them where the gilded wings of the dragon ended - were green . [She]76-alberta had just run up to the top of one glorious blue wave , and the nearer slope of that wave came down towards [you]227-you , with streaks and bubbles on it . [She]76-alberta was obviously running fast before a gay wind , listing over a little on [her]76-alberta port side . ( By the way , if [you]227-you are going to read this story at all , and if [you]227-you do n’t know already , [you]227-you had better get it into [your]227-you head that the left of [a ship]232-a ship when [you]227-you are looking ahead , is port , and the right is starboard . ) All the sunlight fell on [her]76-alberta from that side , and the water on that side was full of greens and purples . On the other , it was darker blue from the shadow of [the ship]234-the ship .

“ The question is , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund , “ whether it does n’t make things worse , looking at [a Narnian ship]1827-a narnian ship when [you]227-you ca n’t get [there]226-there . ”[79-edmund]

“ Even looking is better than nothing , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ And [she]1827-a narnian ship is such [a very Narnian ship]1829-a very narnian ship . ”[80-lucy]

“ Still playing [your]73-eustace old game ? ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace Clarence]73-eustace , who had been listening outside the door and now came grinning into [the room]237-the room . Last year , when [he]73-eustace had been staying with [the Pevensies]83-the pevensies , [he]73-eustace had managed to hear [them]83-the pevensies all talking of [Narnia]2-narnia and [he]73-eustace loved teasing [them]83-the pevensies about it . [He]73-eustace thought of course that [they]83-the pevensies were making it all up ; and as [he]73-eustace was far too stupid to make anything up [himself]73-eustace , [he]73-eustace did not approve of that .

“ [You]80-lucy ’re not wanted [here]1830-here , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund curtly .

“ [I]73-eustace ’m trying to think of a limerick , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace . “ Something like this :[73-eustace]

“ [Some kids]1831-some kids who played games about [Narnia]2-narnia Got [gradually balmier]84-gradually balmier and balmier — ”[73-eustace]

“ Well [Narnia]2-narnia and balmier do n’t rhyme , to begin with , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ It ’s an assonance , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ Do n’t ask [him]73-eustace what [an assy - thingummy]1832-an assy - thingummy is , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [He]73-eustace ’s only longing to be asked . Say nothing and perhaps [he]73-eustace ’ll go away . ”[79-edmund]

[Most boys]238-most boys , on meeting a reception like this , would either have cleared out or flared up . [Eustace]73-eustace did neither . [He]73-eustace just hung about grinning , and presently began talking again .

“ Do [you]80-lucy like that picture ? ”[73-eustace] [he]73-eustace asked .

“ For heaven ’s sake do n’t let [him]73-eustace get started about Art and all that , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund hurriedly , but [Lucy]80-lucy , who was very truthful , had already said , “ Yes , [I]80-lucy do . [I]80-lucy like it very much . ”[80-lucy]

“ It ’s a rotten picture , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ [You]80-lucy wo n’t see it if [you]80-lucy step outside , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Why do [you]80-lucy like it ? ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace to [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ Well , for one thing , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , “ [I]80-lucy like it because [the ship]234-the ship looks as if it was really moving . And [the water]1834-the water looks as if it was really wet . And the waves look as if they were really going up and down . ”[80-lucy]

Of course [Eustace]73-eustace knew lots of answers to this , but [he]73-eustace did n’t say anything . The reason was that at that very moment [he]73-eustace looked at the waves and saw that they did look very much indeed as if they were going up and down . [He]73-eustace had only once been in [a ship]232-a ship ( and then only as far as [the Isle of Wight]3-the isle of wight ) and had been horribly seasick . The look of the waves in the picture made [him]73-eustace feel sick again . [He]73-eustace turned rather green and tried another look . And then [all three children]240-all three children were staring with open mouths .

What [they]240-all three children were seeing may be hard to believe when [you]241-you read it in print , but it was almost as hard to believe when [you]241-you saw it happening . The things in the picture were moving . It did n’t look at all like a cinema either ; the colours were too real and clean and out - of - doors for that . Down went the prow of [the ship]234-the ship into the wave and up went a great shock of spray . And then up went the wave behind [her]243-her , and [her]243-her stern and [[her]243-her deck]244-her deck became visible for the first time , and then disappeared as the next wave came to meet [her]243-her and [her]243-her bows went up again . At the same moment an exercise book which had been lying beside [Edmund]79-edmund on the bed flapped , rose and sailed through the air to the wall behind [him]79-edmund , and [Lucy]80-lucy felt all [her]80-lucy hair whipping round [her]80-lucy face as it does on a windy day . And this was a windy day ; but the wind was blowing out of the picture towards [them]240-all three children . And suddenly with the wind came the noises - the swishing of waves and the slap of water against [the ship]234-the ship ’s sides and the creaking and the overall high steady roar of air and water . But it was the smell , the wild , briny smell , which really convinced [Lucy]80-lucy that [she]80-lucy was not dreaming .

“ Stop it , ”[73-eustace] came [Eustace]73-eustace ’s voice , squeaky with fright and bad temper . “ It ’s some silly trick [you]240-all three children two are playing . Stop it . [I]73-eustace ’ll tell [Alberta]76-alberta — Ow ! ”[73-eustace]

[The other two]246-the other two were much more accustomed to adventures , but , just exactly as [Eustace Clarence]73-eustace said “ Ow , ”[246-the other two] [they]246-the other two both said “ Ow ”[246-the other two] too . The reason was that a great cold , salt splash had broken right out of the frame and [they]240-all three children were breathless from the smack of it , besides being wet through .

“ [I]73-eustace ’ll smash the rotten thing , ”[73-eustace] cried [Eustace]73-eustace ; and then several things happened at the same time . [Eustace]73-eustace rushed towards the picture . [Edmund]79-edmund , who knew something about magic , sprang after [him]73-eustace , warning [him]73-eustace to look out and not to be [a fool]247-a fool . [Lucy]80-lucy grabbed at [him]73-eustace from the other side and was dragged forward . And by this time either [they]240-all three children had grown much smaller or the picture had grown bigger . [Eustace]73-eustace jumped to try to pull it off the wall and found [himself]73-eustace standing on the frame ; in front of [him]73-eustace was not glass but [real sea]248-real sea , and wind and waves rushing up to the frame as [they]240-all three children might to a rock . [He]73-eustace lost [his]73-eustace head and clutched at [the other two who had jumped up beside [him]73-eustace]249-the other two who had jumped up beside him . There was a second of struggling and shouting , and just as [they]240-all three children thought [they]240-all three children had got [their]240-all three children balance a great blue roller surged up round [them]240-all three children , swept [them]240-all three children off [their]240-all three children feet , and drew [them]240-all three children down into [the sea]250-the sea . [Eustace]73-eustace ’s despairing cry suddenly ended as the water got into [his]73-eustace mouth .

[Lucy]80-lucy thanked [her]80-lucy stars that [she]80-lucy had worked hard at [her]80-lucy swimming last summer term . It is true that [she]80-lucy would have got on much better if [she]80-lucy had used a slower stroke , and also that the water felt a great deal colder than it had looked while it was only a picture . Still , [she]80-lucy kept [her]80-lucy head and kicked [her]80-lucy shoes off , as [everyone]251-everyone ought to do who falls into deep water in [their]251-everyone clothes . [She]80-lucy even kept [her]80-lucy mouth shut and [her]80-lucy eyes open . [They]252-they were still quite near [the ship]234-the ship ; [she]80-lucy saw [its]234-the ship green side towering high above [them]252-they , and [people]207-people looking at [her]80-lucy from [the deck]255-the deck . Then , as [one]256-one might have expected , [Eustace]73-eustace clutched at [her]80-lucy in a panic and down [they]252-they both went .

When [they]252-they came up again [she]80-lucy saw [a white figure diving off the ship]257-a white figure diving off the ship ’s side . [Edmund]79-edmund was close beside [her]80-lucy now , treading water , and had caught the arms of [the howling Eustace]258-the howling eustace . Then [someone else]259-someone else , whose face was vaguely familiar , slipped an arm under [her]80-lucy from the other side . There was a lot of shouting going on from [the ship]234-the ship , heads crowding together above the bulwarks , ropes being thrown . [Edmund]79-edmund and [the stranger]261-the stranger were fastening ropes round [her]80-lucy . After that followed what seemed a very long delay during which [her]80-lucy face got blue and [her]80-lucy teeth began chattering . In reality the delay was not very long ; [they]252-they were waiting till the moment when [she]80-lucy could be got on board [the ship]234-the ship without being dashed against [its]234-the ship side . Even with all [their]252-they best endeavours [she]80-lucy had a bruised knee when [she]80-lucy finally stood , dripping and shivering , on [the deck]255-the deck . After [her]80-lucy [Edmund]79-edmund was heaved up , and then [the miserable Eustace]73-eustace . Last of all came [the stranger]261-the stranger — [a golden - headed boy some years older than [herself]80-lucy]265-a golden - headed boy some years older than herself .

“ Ca — Ca — [Caspian]85-caspian ! ”[80-lucy] gasped [Lucy]80-lucy as soon as [she]80-lucy had breath enough . For [Caspian]85-caspian it was ; [Caspian]85-caspian , [the boy king of [Narnia]2-narnia whom [they]252-they had helped to set on the throne during [their]252-they last visit]266-the boy king of narnia whom they had helped to set on the throne during their last visit . Immediately [Edmund]79-edmund recognized [him]261-the stranger too . [All three]267-all three shook hands and clapped [one another on the back]268-one another on the back with great delight .

“ But who is [[your]73-eustace friend]1835-your friend ? ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian almost at once , turning to [Eustace]73-eustace with [his]85-caspian cheerful smile . But [Eustace]73-eustace was crying much harder than [any boy of [his]73-eustace age]269-any boy of his age has a right to cry when nothing worse than a wetting has happened to [him]73-eustace , and would only yell out , “ Let [me]85-caspian go . Let [me]85-caspian go back . [I]85-caspian do n’t like it . ”[85-caspian]

“ Let [you]73-eustace go ? ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ But where ? ”[85-caspian]

[Eustace]73-eustace rushed to [the ship]234-the ship ’s side , as if [he]73-eustace expected to see the picture frame hanging above [the sea]250-the sea , and perhaps a glimpse of [[Lucy]80-lucy ’s bedroom]272-lucy ’s bedroom . What [he]73-eustace saw was blue waves flecked with foam , and paler blue sky , both spreading without a break to the horizon . Perhaps [we]273-we can hardly blame [him]73-eustace if [his]73-eustace heart sank . [He]73-eustace was promptly sick .

“ Hey ! [Rynelf]86-rynelf , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian to [one of [the sailors]275-the sailors]274-one of the sailors . “ Bring spiced wine for [their]276-their Majesties . [You]86-rynelf ’ll need something to warm [you]86-rynelf after that dip . ”[85-caspian] [He]85-caspian called [Edmund]79-edmund and [Lucy]80-lucy [their]276-their Majesties because [they]276-their and [Peter]77-peter and [Susan]78-susan had all been [Kings]277-kings and [Queens of [Narnia]2-narnia]278-queens of narnia long before [his]73-eustace time . [Narnian]4-narnian time flows differently from [ours]279-ours . If [you]280-you spent a hundred years in [Narnia]2-narnia , [you]280-you would still come back to [[our]279-ours world]281-our world at the very same hour of the very same day on which [you]280-you left . And then , if [you]280-you went back to [Narnia]2-narnia after spending a week here , [you]280-you might find that a thousand Narnian years had passed , or only a day , or no time at all . [You]280-you never know till [you]280-you get [there]226-there . Consequently , when [the Pevensie children]283-the pevensie children had returned to [Narnia]2-narnia last time for [their]283-the pevensie children second visit , it was ( for [the Narnians]87-the narnians ) as if [King Arthur]88-king arthur came back to [Britain]5-britain , as [some people]284-some people say [he]88-king arthur will . And [I]0-i say the sooner the better .

[Rynelf]86-rynelf returned with the spiced wine steaming in a flagon and four silver cups . It was just what [one]256-one wanted , and as [Lucy]80-lucy and [Edmund]79-edmund sipped it [they]283-the pevensie children could feel the warmth going right down to [their]283-the pevensie children toes . But [Eustace]73-eustace made faces and spluttered and spat it out and was sick again and began to cry again and asked if [they]283-the pevensie children had n’t any Plumptree ’s Vitaminized Nerve Food and could it be made with distilled water and anyway [he]73-eustace insisted on being put ashore at [the next station]286-the next station .

“ This is [a merry shipmate [you]79-edmund ’ve brought [us]283-the pevensie children]1836-a merry shipmate you ’ve brought us , [Brother]1837-brother , ”[85-caspian] whispered [Caspian]85-caspian to [Edmund]79-edmund with a chuckle ; but before [he]79-edmund could say anything more [Eustace]73-eustace burst out again .

“ Oh ! Ugh ! What on earth ’s that ! Take it away , the horrid thing . ”[73-eustace]

[He]73-eustace really had some excuse this time for feeling a little surprised . Something very curious indeed had come out of [the cabin]287-the cabin in the poop and was slowly approaching [them]283-the pevensie children . [You]288-you might call it — and indeed it was — [a Mouse]289-a mouse . But then it was a Mouse on its hind legs and stood about two feet high . A thin band of gold passed round its head under one ear and over the other and in this was stuck a long crimson feather . ( As [the Mouse]89-reepicheep ’s fur was very dark , almost black , the effect was bold and striking . ) [Its]89-reepicheep left paw rested on the hilt of a sword very nearly as long as its tail . [Its]89-reepicheep balance , as it paced gravely along [the swaying deck]290-the swaying deck , was perfect , and its manners courtly . [Lucy]80-lucy and [Edmund]79-edmund recognized [it]89-reepicheep at once [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , [the most valiant of [all the Talking Beasts of [Narnia]2-narnia]292-all the talking beasts of narnia]291-the most valiant of all the talking beasts of narnia , and [the Chief Mouse]293-the chief mouse . [It]89-reepicheep had won undying glory in the second Battle of [Beruna]6-beruna . [Lucy]80-lucy longed , as [she]80-lucy had always done , to take [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep up in [her]80-lucy arms and cuddle [him]89-reepicheep . But this , as [she]80-lucy well knew , was a pleasure [she]80-lucy could never have : it would have offended [him]89-reepicheep deeply . Instead , [she]80-lucy went down on one knee to talk to [him]89-reepicheep .

[Reepicheep]89-reepicheep put forward [his]89-reepicheep left leg , drew back [his]89-reepicheep right , bowed , kissed [her]80-lucy hand , straightened [himself]89-reepicheep , twirled [his]89-reepicheep whiskers , and said in [his]89-reepicheep shrill , piping voice :

“ [My]89-reepicheep humble duty to [[your]80-lucy Majesty]1838-your majesty . And to [King Edmund]79-edmund , too . ”[89-reepicheep] ( Here [he]89-reepicheep bowed again . ) “ Nothing except [[your]80-lucy Majesties]1839-your majesties ’ presence was lacking to this glorious venture . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ Ugh , take it away , ”[73-eustace] wailed [Eustace]73-eustace . “ [I]73-eustace hate mice . And [I]73-eustace never could bear performing animals . [They]1840-they ’re silly and vulgar and - and sentimental . ”[73-eustace]

“ Am [I]89-reepicheep to understand , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep to [Lucy]80-lucy after a long stare at [Eustace]73-eustace , “ that [this singularly discourteous person]1841-this singularly discourteous person is under [[your]80-lucy Majesty]1838-your majesty ’s protection ? Because , if not — ”[89-reepicheep]

At this moment [Lucy]80-lucy and [Edmund]79-edmund both sneezed .

“ What [a fool]247-a fool [I]85-caspian am to keep [you]80-lucy all standing here in [your]80-lucy wet things , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ Come on below and get changed . [I]85-caspian ’ll give [you]80-lucy [[my]85-caspian cabin]1844-my cabin of course , [Lucy]80-lucy , but [I]85-caspian ’m afraid [we]1845-we have [no women]1846-no women ’s clothes on board . [You]80-lucy ’ll have to make do with some of [mine]85-caspian . Lead the way , [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , like [a good fellow]1847-a good fellow . ”[85-caspian]

“ To the convenience of [a lady]1848-a lady , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ even a question of honour must give way — at least for the moment — ”[89-reepicheep] and here [he]89-reepicheep looked very hard at [Eustace]73-eustace . But [Caspian]85-caspian hustled [them]294-them on and in a few minutes [Lucy]80-lucy found [herself]80-lucy passing through the door into [the stern cabin]295-the stern cabin . [She]80-lucy fell in love with it at once — the three square windows that looked out on the blue , swirling water astern , the low cushioned benches round three sides of the table , the swinging silver lamp overhead ( [Dwarfs]90-dwarfs ’ work , [she]80-lucy knew at once by its exquisite delicacy ) and the flat gold image of [Aslan]91-aslan the Lion on the forward wall above the door . All this [she]80-lucy took in in a flash , for [Caspian]85-caspian immediately opened a door on the starboard side , and said , “ This ’ll be [[your]80-lucy room]1849-your room , [Lucy]80-lucy . [I]85-caspian ’ll just get some dry things for [myself]85-caspian — ”[85-caspian] [he]85-caspian was rummaging in one of the lockers while [he]85-caspian spoke—“and then leave [you]80-lucy to change . If [you]80-lucy ’ll fling [your]80-lucy wet things outside the door [I]85-caspian ’ll get them taken to [the galley]1850-the galley to be dried . ”[85-caspian]

[Lucy]80-lucy found [herself]80-lucy as much at [home]296-home as if [she]80-lucy had been in [[Caspian]85-caspian ’s cabin]297-caspian ’s cabin for weeks , and the motion of [the ship]234-the ship did not worry [her]80-lucy , for in the old days when [she]80-lucy had been [a queen in [Narnia]2-narnia]299-a queen in narnia [she]80-lucy had done a good deal of voyaging . [The cabin]287-the cabin was very tiny but bright with painted panels ( all birds and beasts and crimson dragons and vines ) and spotlessly clean . [Caspian]85-caspian ’s clothes were too big for [her]80-lucy , but [she]80-lucy could manage . [His]85-caspian shoes , sandals and sea - boots were hopelessly big but [she]80-lucy did not mind going barefoot on [board ship]301-board ship . When [she]80-lucy had finished dressing [she]80-lucy looked out of [her]80-lucy window at the water rushing past and took a long deep breath . [She]80-lucy felt quite sure [they]302-we were in for a lovely time .

“ AH , there [you]80-lucy are , [Lucy]80-lucy , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [We]302-we were just waiting for [you]80-lucy . This is [[my]85-caspian captain]1851-my captain , [the Lord Drinian]1852-the lord drinian . ”[85-caspian]

[A dark - haired man]303-a dark - haired man went down on one knee and kissed [her]80-lucy hand . [The only others present]304-the only others present were [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep and [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Where is [Eustace]73-eustace ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ In bed , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund , “ and [I]79-edmund do n’t think [we]302-we can do anything for [him]73-eustace . It only makes [him]73-eustace worse if [you]80-lucy try to be nice to [him]73-eustace . ”[79-edmund]

“ Meanwhile , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ [we]302-we want to talk . ”[85-caspian]

“ Exactly three years , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ All going well ? ”[79-edmund] asked [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ [You]80-lucy do n’t suppose [I]305-the king ’d have left [[my]305-the king kingdom]1853-my kingdom and put to [sea]1854-sea unless all was well , ”[305-the king] answered [the King]305-the king . “ It could n’t be better . And [I]305-the king had [an excellent person]1859-an excellent person to leave as [Regent]1860-regent while [I]305-the king ’m away [Trumpkin]96-trumpkin , [the Dwarf]1861-the dwarf . [You]1862-you remember [him]96-trumpkin ? ”[305-the king]

“ [Dear Trumpkin]96-trumpkin , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , “ of course [I]80-lucy do . [You]96-trumpkin could n’t have made a better choice . ”[80-lucy]

“ Loyal as a badger , [Ma’am]97-ma’am , and [valiant as — as a Mouse]1863-valiant as — as a mouse , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian . [He]98-drinian had been going to say “ as a lion ”[98-drinian] but had noticed [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep ’s eyes fixed on [him]98-drinian .

“ And where are [we]1864-we heading for ? ”[79-edmund] asked [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Well , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ that ’s rather a long story . Perhaps [you]1862-you remember that when [I]85-caspian was [a child]1865-a child [my]85-caspian usurping uncle [Miraz]99-miraz got rid of [seven friends of [[my]85-caspian father]1867-my father ’s ( who might have taken [my]85-caspian part ) by sending [them]1868-them off to explore [the unknown , Eastern Seas]1869-the unknown , eastern seas beyond [the Lone Islands]7-the lone islands]1866-seven friends of my father ’s ( who might have taken my part ) by sending them off to explore the unknown , eastern seas beyond the lone islands . ”[85-caspian]

“ Yes , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , “ and [none of [them]1868-them]1870-none of them ever came back . ”[80-lucy]

“ Right . Well , on , [my]85-caspian coronation day , with [Aslan]91-aslan ’s approval , [I]85-caspian swore an oath that , if once [I]85-caspian established peace in [Narnia]2-narnia , [I]85-caspian would sail east [myself]85-caspian for a year and a day to find [[my]85-caspian father ’s friends]1871-my father ’s friends or to learn of [their]1871-my father ’s friends deaths and avenge [them]1871-my father ’s friends if [I]85-caspian could . “ [The Lord Rhoop]105-rhoop , [Sire]1874-sire , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ [Rhoop]105-rhoop , [Rhoop]105-rhoop , of course , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ That is [my]85-caspian main intention . But Reepicheep here has an even higher hope . ”[85-caspian] [Everyone]251-everyone ’s eyes turned to [the Mouse]89-reepicheep .

“ As high as [my]85-caspian spirit , ”[85-caspian] it said . “ Though perhaps as small as [my]85-caspian stature . Why should [we]1875-we not come to [the very eastern end of [the world]1877-the world]1876-the very eastern end of the world ? And what might [we]1875-we find there ? “ [I]79-edmund say , that is an idea , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund in an awed voice .

“ But do [you]85-caspian think , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , “ [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s country]1882-aslan ’s country would be [that sort of country]1883-that sort of country — [I]80-lucy mean , the sort [you]85-caspian could ever sail to ? ”[80-lucy]

“ [I]89-reepicheep do not know , [Madam]1884-madam , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . “ But there is this . “ Where sky and water meet , Where the waves grow sweet , Doubt not , Reepicheep , To find all [you]85-caspian seek , There is [the utter East]9-the utter east .[80-lucy]

“ [I]89-reepicheep do not know what it means . But the spell of it has been on [me]89-reepicheep all [my]89-reepicheep life . ”[89-reepicheep]

After a short silence [Lucy]80-lucy asked , “ And where are [we]1888-we now , [Caspian]85-caspian ? ”[80-lucy]

“ [The Captain]1889-the captain can tell [you]80-lucy better than [I]85-caspian , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , so [Drinian]98-drinian got out [his]98-drinian chart and spread it on the table .

“ That ’s [our]1888-we position , ”[98-drinian] [he]98-drinian said , laying [his]98-drinian finger on it . “ Or was at noon today . [We]1888-we had a fair wind from [Cair Paravel]28-cair paravel and stood a little north for [Galma]11-galma , which [we]1888-we made on the next day . “ And got a few nasty falls [myself]85-caspian , [Drinian]98-drinian . Some of the bruises are there still , ”[85-caspian] put in [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Squints , and has freckles , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Oh , [poor girl]1897-poor girl , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ And [we]1888-we sailed from [Galma]11-galma , ”[98-drinian] continued [Drinian]98-drinian , “ and ran into a calm for the best part of two days and had to row , and then had wind again and did not make [Terebinthia]12-terebinthia till the fourth day from [Galma]11-galma . And there [[their]1888-we King]1898-their king sent out a warning not to land for there was sickness in [Terebinthia]12-terebinthia , but [we]1888-we doubled the cape and put in at [a little creek far from [the city]1900-the city and watered]1899-a little creek far from the city and watered . The third day out [a pirate]1901-a pirate ( [Terebinthian]14-terebinthian by [her]1901-a pirate rig ) overhauled [us]1888-we , but when [she]1901-a pirate saw [us]1888-we well armed [she]1901-a pirate stood off after some shooting of arrows on either part — ”[98-drinian]

“ And [we]1888-we ought to have given [her]1901-a pirate chase and boarded [her]1901-a pirate and hanged [[every mother]1902-every mother ’s son of [them]13-seven isles]1903-every mother ’s son of them , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep .

“ — And in five days more [we]1888-we were insight of [Muil]15-muil , which , as [you]1904-you know , is [the westernmost of [the Seven Isles]13-seven isles]1905-the westernmost of the seven isles . Then [we]1888-we rowed through [the straits]1906-the straits and came about sundown into Redhaven on [the isle of [Brenn]17-brenn]1907-the isle of brenn , where [we]1888-we were very lovingly feasted and had victuals and water at will . [We]1888-we left [Redhaven]18-redhaven six days ago and have made marvellously good speed , so that [I]98-drinian hope to see [the Lone Islands]1908-the lone islands the day after tomorrow . The sum is , [we]1888-we are now nearly thirty days at sea and have sailed more than four hundred leagues from [Narnia]2-narnia . ”[98-drinian]

“ And after [the Lone Islands]7-the lone islands ? ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ [No one]1909-no one knows , [[your]1904-you Majesty]1838-your majesty , ”[98-drinian] answered [Drinian]98-drinian . “ Unless [the Lone Islanders]107-the lone islanders [themselves]107-the lone islanders can tell [us]1888-we . ”[98-drinian]

“ [They]307-they could n’t in [our]1888-we days , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Then , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ it is after [the Lone Islands]7-the lone islands that the adventure really begins . ”[89-reepicheep]

[Caspian]85-caspian now suggested that [they]307-they might like to be shown over [the ship]234-the ship before supper , but [Lucy]80-lucy ’s conscience smote [her]80-lucy and [she]80-lucy said , “ [I]80-lucy think [I]80-lucy really must go and see [Eustace]73-eustace . Seasickness is horrid , [you]85-caspian know . If [I]80-lucy had [my]80-lucy old cordial with [me]80-lucy [I]80-lucy could cure [him]73-eustace . ”[80-lucy]

“ But [you]80-lucy have , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [I]85-caspian ’d quite forgotten about it . As [you]80-lucy left it behind [I]85-caspian thought it might be regarded as one of the royal treasures and so [I]85-caspian brought it — if [you]80-lucy think it ought to be wasted on a thing like seasickness . ”[85-caspian]

“ It ’ll only take a drop , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

[Caspian]85-caspian opened one of the lockers beneath the bench and brought out the beautiful little diamond flask which [Lucy]80-lucy remembered so well . “ Take back [your]80-lucy own , [Queen]1911-queen , ”[85-caspian] [he]85-caspian said . [They]309-they then left [the cabin]287-the cabin and went out into the sunshine .

In [the deck]255-the deck there were two large , long hatches , fore and aft of the mast , and both open , as they always were in fair weather , to let light and air into the belly of [the ship]234-the ship . [Caspian]85-caspian led [them]309-they down a ladder into the after hatch . Here [they]309-they found [themselves]309-they in a place where benches for rowing ran from side to side and the light came in through the oarholes and danced on the roof . Of course [[Caspian]85-caspian ’s ship]313-caspian ’s ship was not that horrible thing , [a galley rowed by [slaves]315-slaves]314-a galley rowed by slaves . Oars were used only when wind failed or for getting in and out of [harbour]316-harbour and [everyone]251-everyone ( except Reepicheep whose legs were too short ) had often taken a turn . At each side of [the ship]234-the ship the space under the benches was left clear for [the rowers]319-the rowers ’ feet , but all down the centre there was a kind of pit which went down to the very keel and this was filled with all kinds of things — sacks of flour , casks of water and beer , barrels of pork , jars of honey , skin bottles of wine , apples , nuts , cheeses , biscuits , turnips , sides of bacon . From the roof — that is , from the under side of [the deck]255-the deck — hung hams and strings of onions , and also [the men of the watch offduty]321-the men of the watch offduty in [their]321-the men of the watch offduty hammocks . [Caspian]85-caspian led [them]309-they aft , stepping from bench to bench ; at least , it was stepping for [him]85-caspian , and something between a step and a jump for [Lucy]80-lucy , and a real long jump for [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . In this way [they]309-they came to a partition with a door in it . [Caspian]85-caspian opened the door and led [them]309-they into [a cabin which filled the stern underneath [the deck cabins in the poop]323-the deck cabins in the poop]322-a cabin which filled the stern underneath the deck cabins in the poop . [It]322-a cabin which filled the stern underneath the deck cabins in the poop was of course not so nice . [It]322-a cabin which filled the stern underneath the deck cabins in the poop was very low and the sides sloped together as they went down so that there was hardly any floor ; and though [it]322-a cabin which filled the stern underneath the deck cabins in the poop had windows of thick glass , they were not made to open because they were under water . In fact at this very moment , as [the ship]234-the ship pitched [they]309-they were alternately golden with sunlight and dim green with [the sea]250-the sea .

“ [You]85-caspian and [I]85-caspian must lodge [here]1830-here , [Edmund]79-edmund , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [We]309-they ’ll leave [[your]85-caspian kinsman]1913-your kinsman the bunk and sling hammocks for [ourselves]309-they . ”[85-caspian]

“ [I]98-drinian beseech [[your]85-caspian Majesty]1838-your majesty — ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ No , [no shipmate]1915-no shipmate , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ [we]309-they have argued all that out already . [You]85-caspian and [Rhince]108-rhince ”[85-caspian] ( [Rhince]108-rhince was [the mate]326-the mate ) “ are sailing [the ship]234-the ship and will have cares and labours many a night when [we]309-they are singing catches or telling stories , so [you]85-caspian and [he]1913-your kinsman must have [the port cabin]1917-the port cabin above . [King Edmund]79-edmund and [I]85-caspian can lie very snug here below . But how is [the stranger]261-the stranger ? ”[85-caspian]

[Eustace]73-eustace , very green in the face , scowled and asked whether there was any sign of the storm getting less . But [Caspian]85-caspian said , “ What storm ? ”[85-caspian] and [Drinian]98-drinian burst out laughing .

“ Storm , [young master]1919-young master ! ”[98-drinian] [he]98-drinian roared . “ This is as fair weather as [a man]1920-a man could ask for . ”[98-drinian]

“ Who ’s that ? ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace irritably . “ Send [him]1913-your kinsman away . [His]1913-your kinsman voice goes through [my]73-eustace head . ”[73-eustace]

“ [I]80-lucy ’ve brought [you]73-eustace something that will make [you]73-eustace feel better , [Eustace]73-eustace , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ Oh , go away and leave [me]73-eustace alone , ”[73-eustace] growled [Eustace]73-eustace . But [he]73-eustace took a drop from [her]80-lucy flask , and though [he]73-eustace said it was beastly stuff ( the smell in [the cabin]287-the cabin when [she]80-lucy opened it was delicious ) it is certain that [his]73-eustace face came the right colour a few moments after [he]73-eustace had swallowed it , and [he]73-eustace must have felt better because , instead of wailing about the storm and [his]73-eustace head , [he]73-eustace began demanding to be put ashore and said that at [the first port]328-the first port [he]73-eustace would “ lodge a disposition ”[73-eustace] against [them]329-they all with [the British Consul]330-the british consul . But when [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep asked what a disposition was and how [you]331-you lodged it ( [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep thought it was some new way of arranging a single combat ) [Eustace]73-eustace could only reply , “ Fancy not knowing that . ”[73-eustace] In the end [they]329-they succeeded in convincing [Eustace]73-eustace that [they]329-they were already sailing as fast as [they]329-they could towards [the nearest land [they]329-they knew]332-the nearest land they knew , and that [they]329-they had no more power of sending [him]73-eustace back to [Cambridge]19-cambridge — which was where [Uncle Harold]75-harold lived — than of sending [him]73-eustace to [the moon]333-the moon . After that [he]73-eustace sulkily agreed to put on the fresh clothes which had been put out for [him]73-eustace and come on [deck]334-deck .

[Caspian]85-caspian now showed [them]329-they over [the ship]234-the ship , though indeed [they]329-they had seen most it already . [They]329-they went up on [the forecastle]336-the forecastle and saw [the look - out man]337-the look - out man standing on a little shelf inside the gilded dragon ’s neck and peering through its open mouth . Inside the forecastle was [the galley]1850-the galley ( or [[ship]339-ship ’s kitchen]340-ship ’s kitchen ) and quarters for such people as [the boatswain]341-the boatswain , [the carpenter]342-the carpenter , [the cook]343-the cook and [the master - archer]344-the master - archer . If [you]345-you think it odd to have [the galley]1850-the galley in the bows and imagine the smoke from [its]1850-the galley chimney streaming back over [the ship]234-the ship , that is because [you]345-you are thinking of steamships where there is always a headwind . On [a sailing ship]348-a sailing ship the wind is coming from behind , and anything smelly is put as far forward as possible . [They]329-they were taken up to the fighting top , and at first it was rather alarming to rock to and fro there and see [the deck]255-the deck looking small and far away beneath . [You]345-you realized that if [you]345-you fell there was no particular reason why [you]345-you should fall on board rather than in [the sea]250-the sea . Then [they]329-they were taken to [the poop]351-the poop , where [Rhince]108-rhince was on duty with [another man at [the great tiller]353-the great tiller]352-another man at the great tiller , and behind that the dragon ’s tail rose up , covered with gilding , and round inside it ran a little bench . The name of [the ship]234-the ship was [Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader . [She]234-the ship was only a little bit of a thing compared with one of [[our]355-our I ships]356-our i ships , or even with the cogs , dromonds , carracks and galleons which [Narnia]2-narnia had owned when [Lucy]80-lucy and [Edmund]79-edmund had reigned [there]226-there under [Peter]77-peter as [the High King]358-the high king , for nearly all navigation had died out in the reigns of [[Caspian]85-caspian ’s ancestors]359-caspian ’s ancestors . When [[his]85-caspian uncle]360-his uncle , [Miraz]99-miraz [the usurper]361-the usurper , had sent [the seven lords]362-the seven lords to [sea]1854-sea , [they]362-the seven lords had had to buy [a Galmian ship]364-a galmian ship and man [it]364-a galmian ship with [hired Galmian sailors]365-hired galmian sailors . But now [Caspian]85-caspian had begun to teach [the Narnians]87-the narnians to be [sea - faring folk]366-sea - faring folk once more , and [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader was [the finest ship [he]85-caspian had built yet]367-the finest ship he had built yet . [She]109-the dawn treader was so small that , forward of the mast , there was hardly any deck room between the central hatch and [[the ship]234-the ship ’s boat]369-the ship ’s boat on one side and [the hen - coop]370-the hen - coop ( [Lucy]80-lucy fed the hens ) on the other . But [she]109-the dawn treader was a beauty of [her]109-the dawn treader kind , [a “ lady ”]1921-a “ lady ”[1921-a “ lady ”] as [sailors]371-sailors say , [her]109-the dawn treader lines perfect , [her]109-the dawn treader colours pure , and every spar and rope and pin lovingly made . [Eustace]73-eustace of course would be pleased with nothing , and kept on boasting about [liners]372-liners and [motor - boats]373-motor - boats and [aeroplanes]374-aeroplanes and [submarines]375-submarines ( “ As if [he]73-eustace knew anything about [them]246-the other two , ”[79-edmund] muttered [Edmund]79-edmund ) , but [the other two]246-the other two were delighted with [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader , and when [they]246-the other two returned aft to [the cabin]287-the cabin and supper , and saw the whole western sky lit up with an immense crimson sunset , and felt the quiver of [the ship]234-the ship , and tasted the salt on [their]246-the other two lips , and thought of [unknown lands on [the Eastern rim of the world]380-the eastern rim of the world]379-unknown lands on the eastern rim of the world , [Lucy]80-lucy felt that [she]80-lucy was almost too happy to speak .

What [Eustace]73-eustace thought had best be told in [his]73-eustace own words , for when [they]246-the other two all got [their]246-the other two clothes back , dried , next morning , [he]73-eustace at once got out a little black notebook and a pencil and started to keep a diary . [He]73-eustace always had this notebook with [him]73-eustace and kept a record of [his]73-eustace marks in it , for though [he]73-eustace did n’t care much about any subject for its own sake , [he]73-eustace cared a great deal about marks and would even go to [people]207-people and say , “ [I]73-eustace got so much . What did [you]207-people get ? ”[73-eustace] But as [he]73-eustace did n’t seem likely to get many marks on [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader [he]73-eustace now started a diary . This was the first entry .

“ 7 August . Have now been twenty - four hours on [this ghastly boat]1922-this ghastly boat if it is n’t a dream . All the time a frightful storm has been raging ( it ’s a good thing [I]89-reepicheep ’m not seasick ) . Huge waves keep coming in over the front and [I]89-reepicheep have seen [the boat]1923-the boat nearly go under any number of times . [All the others]1924-all the others pretend to take no notice of this , either from swank or because [Harold]75-harold says one of the most cowardly things [ordinary people]1925-ordinary people do is to shut [their]1925-ordinary people eyes to [Facts]110-facts . It ’s madness to come out into [the sea]250-the sea in a rotten little thing like this . Not much bigger than [a lifeboat]1927-a lifeboat . And , of course , absolutely primitive indoors . [No proper saloon , no radio]1928-no proper saloon , no radio , [no bathrooms]1929-no bathrooms , no deck - chairs . [I]89-reepicheep was dragged all over [it]1922-this ghastly boat yesterday evening and it would make [anyone]1930-anyone sick to hear [Caspian]85-caspian showing off [[his]85-caspian funny little toy boat]1931-his funny little toy boat as if it was [the Queen Mary]111-the queen mary . [I]89-reepicheep tried to tell [him]85-caspian what [real ships]1932-real ships are like , but [he]85-caspian ’s too dense . E. and [L.]112-l. , o f course , did n’t back [me]89-reepicheep up . [I]89-reepicheep suppose [a kid like [L.]112-l.]1933-a kid like l. does n’t realize the danger and [E.]113-e. is buttering up C. as [everyone]251-everyone does [here]1830-here . [They]251-everyone call [him]113-e. [a King]1936-a king . [I]89-reepicheep said [I]89-reepicheep was [a Republican]1937-a republican but [he]113-e. had to ask [me]89-reepicheep what that meant ! [He]113-e. does n’t seem to know anything at all . Needless to say [I]89-reepicheep ’ve been put in [the worst cabin of [the boat]1923-the boat]1938-the worst cabin of the boat , [a perfect dungeon]1940-a perfect dungeon , and [Lucy]80-lucy has been given [a whole room on [deck]334-deck to [herself]80-lucy]1941-a whole room on deck to herself , almost [a nice room compared with the rest of [this place]1944-this place]1943-a nice room compared with the rest of this place . [C.]114-c. says that ’s because [she]80-lucy ’s [a girl]1945-a girl . [I]89-reepicheep tried to make [him]113-e. see what [Alberta]76-alberta says , that all that sort of thing is really [lowering girls]1946-lowering girls but [he]113-e. was too dense . Still , [he]113-e. might see that [I]89-reepicheep shall be ill if [I]89-reepicheep ’m kept in that hole any longer . [E.]113-e. says [we]1947-we must n’t grumble because [C.]114-c. is sharing it with [us]1947-we [himself]113-e. to make room for [L.]112-l. As if that did n’t make it more crowded and far worse . Nearly forgot to say that there is also a kind of Mouse thing that gives [everyone the most frightful cheek]1948-everyone the most frightful cheek . [The others]1949-the others can put up with it if [they]1949-the others like but [I]89-reepicheep shall twist [his]113-e. tail pretty soon if [he]113-e. tries it on [me]89-reepicheep . The food is frightful too . ”[89-reepicheep]

The trouble between [Eustace]73-eustace and [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep arrived even sooner than might have been expected . Before dinner next day , when [the others]1949-the others were sitting round the table , waiting ( being at [sea]1854-sea gives [one]256-one a magnificent appetite ) , [Eustace]73-eustace came rushing in , wringing [his]73-eustace hand and shouting out :

“ [That little brute]1950-that little brute has half killed [me]73-eustace . [I]73-eustace insist on it being kept under control . [I]73-eustace could bring an action against [you]73-eustace , [Caspian]85-caspian . [i]73-eustace could order [you]73-eustace to have it destroyed . ”[73-eustace]

At the same moment [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep appeared . [His]89-reepicheep sword was drawn and [his]89-reepicheep whiskers looked very fierce but [he]89-reepicheep was as polite as ever .

“ [I]89-reepicheep ask [your]73-eustace pardons all , ”[89-reepicheep] [he]89-reepicheep said , “ and especially [[her]1951-her Majesty]1952-her majesty ’s . If [I]89-reepicheep had known that [he]1952-her majesty would take refuge [here]1830-here [I]89-reepicheep would have awaited a more reasonable time for [his]1952-her majesty correction . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ What on [earth]1954-earth ’s up ? ”[79-edmund] asked [Edmund]79-edmund .

What had really happened was this . [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , who never felt that [the ship]234-the ship was getting on fast enough , loved to sit on the bulwarks far forward just beside the dragon ’s head , gazing out at the eastern horizon and singing softly in [his]89-reepicheep little chirruping voice the song [the Dryad]387-the dryad had made for [him]89-reepicheep . [He]89-reepicheep never held on to anything , however [the ship]234-the ship pitched , and kept [his]89-reepicheep balance with perfect ease ; perhaps [his]89-reepicheep long tail , hanging down to the deck inside [the bulwarks]389-the bulwarks , made this easier . [Everyone on board]390-everyone on board was familiar with this habit , and [the sailors]275-the sailors liked it because when [one]256-one was on look - out duty it gave [one somebody to talk to]393-one somebody to talk to . Why exactly [Eustace]73-eustace had slipped and reeled and stumbled all the way forward to [the forecastle]336-the forecastle ( [he]73-eustace had not yet got [his]73-eustace sea - legs ) [I]0-i never heard . Perhaps [he]73-eustace hoped [he]73-eustace would see [land]395-land , or perhaps [he]73-eustace wanted to hang about [the galley]1850-the galley and scrounge something . Anyway , as soon as [he]73-eustace saw that long tail hanging down — and perhaps it was rather tempting — [he]73-eustace thought it would be delightful to catch hold of it , swing [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep round by it once or twice upside - down , then run away and laugh , At first the plan seemed to work beautifully . [The Mouse]89-reepicheep was not much heavier than a very large cat . [Eustace]73-eustace had [him]89-reepicheep off the rail in a trice and very silly [he]89-reepicheep looked ( thought [Eustace]73-eustace ) with [his]89-reepicheep little limbs all splayed out and [his]89-reepicheep mouth open . But unfortunately [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , who had fought for [his]89-reepicheep life many a time , never lost [his]89-reepicheep head even for a moment . Nor [his]89-reepicheep skill . It is not very easy to draw [one]256-one ’s sword when one is swinging round in the air by one ’s tail , but [he]73-eustace did . And the next thing [Eustace]73-eustace knew was two agonizing jabs in [his]73-eustace hand which made [him]73-eustace let go of the tail ; and the next thing after that was that the Mouse had picked itself up again as if it were a ball bouncing off [the deck]255-the deck , and there it was facing [him]73-eustace , and a horrid long , bright , sharp thing like a skewer was waving to and fro within an inch of [his]73-eustace stomach . ( This does n’t count as below the belt for mice in [Narnia]2-narnia because [they]399-they can hardly be expected to reach higher . )

“ Stop it , ”[73-eustace] spluttered [Eustace]73-eustace , “ go away . Put that thing away . It ’s not safe . Stop it , [I]73-eustace say . [I]73-eustace ’ll tell [Caspian]85-caspian .[73-eustace]

[I]0-i ’ll have [you]73-eustace muzzled and tied up . ”[0-i]

“ Why do [you]73-eustace not draw [your]73-eustace own sword , [poltroon]1955-poltroon ! ”[89-reepicheep] cheeped [the Mouse]89-reepicheep . “ Draw and fight or [I]89-reepicheep ’ll beat [you]73-eustace black and blue with the flat . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ [I]73-eustace have n’t got one , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace . “ [I]73-eustace ’m [a pacifist]1956-a pacifist . [I]73-eustace do n’t believe in fighting . ”[73-eustace]

“ Do [I]89-reepicheep understand , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , withdrawing [his]89-reepicheep sword for a moment and speaking very sternly , “ that [you]73-eustace do not intend to give [me]89-reepicheep satisfaction ? ”[89-reepicheep]

“ [I]73-eustace do n’t know what [you]89-reepicheep mean , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace , nursing [his]73-eustace hand . “ If [you]89-reepicheep do n’t know how to take a joke [I]73-eustace sha n’t bother [my]73-eustace head about [you]89-reepicheep . ”[73-eustace]

“ Then take that , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ and that — to teach [you]73-eustace manners — and the respect due to [a knight]1957-a knight — and a Mouse — and a [Mouse]89-reepicheep ’s tail — ”[89-reepicheep] and at each word [he]89-reepicheep gave [Eustace]73-eustace a blow with the side of [his]89-reepicheep rapier , which was thin , fine dwarf - tempered steel and as supple and effective as a birch rod . [Eustace]73-eustace ( of course ) was at [a school where [they]401-they did n’t have corporal punishment]400-a school where they did n’t have corporal punishment , so the sensation was quite new to [him]73-eustace . That was why , in spite of having no sealegs , it took [him]73-eustace less than a minute to get off [that forecastle]402-that forecastle and cover the whole length of [the deck]255-the deck and burst in at [the cabin]287-the cabin door — still hotly pursued by [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . Indeed it seemed to [Eustace]73-eustace that the rapier as well as the pursuit was hot . It might have been red - hot by the feel .

There was not much difficulty in settling the matter once [Eustace]73-eustace realized that [everyone]251-everyone took the idea of a duel seriously and heard [Caspian]85-caspian offering to lend [him]73-eustace a sword , and [Drinian]98-drinian and [Edmund]79-edmund discussing whether [he]73-eustace ought to be handicapped in some way to make up for [his]73-eustace being so much bigger than [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . [He]73-eustace apologized sulkily and went off with [Lucy]80-lucy to have [his]73-eustace hand bathed and bandaged and then went to [[his]73-eustace bunk]406-his bunk . [He]73-eustace was careful to lie on [his]73-eustace side .

“ LAND in sight , ”[407-the man in the bows] shouted [the man in the bows]407-the man in the bows .

[Lucy]80-lucy , who had been talking to [Rhince]108-rhince on the poop , came pattering down the ladder and raced forward . As [she]80-lucy went [she]80-lucy was joined by [Edmund]79-edmund , and [they]408-they found [Caspian]85-caspian , [Drinian]98-drinian and [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep already on [the forecastle]336-the forecastle . It was a coldish morning , the sky very pale and [the sea]250-the sea very dark blue with little white caps of foam , and there , a little way off on the starboard bow , was the nearest of [the Lone Islands]1908-the lone islands , [Felimath]21-felimath , like [a low green hill in [the sea]250-the sea]412-a low green hill in the sea , and behind [it]21-felimath , further off , the grey slopes of [[its]21-felimath sister Doorn]414-its sister doorn .

“ [Same old Felimath]1958-same old felimath ! [Same old Doorn]24-doorn , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , clapping [her]80-lucy hands . “ Oh — [Edmund]79-edmund , how long it is since [you]79-edmund and [I]80-lucy saw [them]1908-the lone islands last ! ”[80-lucy]

“ [I]85-caspian ’ve never understood why they belong to [Narnia]2-narnia , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ Did [Peter the High King]77-peter conquer [them]1908-the lone islands ? ”[85-caspian]

“ Oh no , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [They]1908-the lone islands were [Narnian]4-narnian before [our]1959-we time — in the days of [the White Witch]115-the white witch . ”[79-edmund]

( By the way , [I]0-i have never yet heard how [these remote islands]415-these remote islands became attached to [the crown of [Narnia]2-narnia]416-the crown of narnia ; if [I]0-i ever do , and if the story is at all interesting , [I]0-i may put it in some other book . )

“ Are [we]1959-we to put in [here]1830-here , [Sire]116-sire ? ”[98-drinian] asked [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ 1 should n’t think it would be much good landing on [Felimath]21-felimath , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [It]21-felimath was almost uninhabited in [our]1959-we days and it looks as if it was the same still . [The people]1961-the people lived mostly on [Doorn]24-doorn and a little on [Avra]23-avra — that ’s [the third one]1962-the third one ; [you]80-lucy ca n’t see it yet . [They]1961-the people only kept sheep on [Felimath]21-felimath . ”[79-edmund]

“ Then [we]1959-we ’ll have to double that cape , [I]98-drinian suppose , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian , “ and land on [Doorn]24-doorn . That ’ll mean rowing . ”[98-drinian]

“ [I]80-lucy ’m sorry [we]1959-we ’re not landing on [Felimath]21-felimath , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [I]80-lucy ’d like to walk there again . [It]21-felimath was so lonely — a nice kind of loneliness , and all grass and clover and soft sea air . ”[80-lucy]

“ [I]85-caspian ’d love to stretch [my]85-caspian legs now too , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [I]85-caspian tell [you]80-lucy what . Why should n’t [we]1959-we go ashore in [the boat]1923-the boat and send it back , and then [we]1959-we could walk across [Felimath]21-felimath and let [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader pick [us]1959-we up on the other side ? ”[85-caspian]

If [Caspian]85-caspian had been as experienced then as [he]85-caspian became later on in this voyage [he]85-caspian would not have made this suggestion ; but at the moment it seemed an excellent one . “ Oh do let ’s , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ [You]73-eustace ’ll come , will [you]73-eustace ? ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian to [Eustace]73-eustace , who had come on [deck]334-deck with [his]73-eustace hand bandaged .

“ Anything to get off [this blasted boat]1964-this blasted boat , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ Blasted ? ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian . “ How do [you]98-drinian mean ? ”[98-drinian]

“ In [a civilized country]1965-a civilized country like where [I]73-eustace come from , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace , “ [the ships]1966-the ships are so big that when [you]73-eustace ’re inside [you]73-eustace would n’t know [you]73-eustace were at [sea]1854-sea at all . ”[73-eustace]

“ In that case [you]73-eustace might just as well stay ashore , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ Will [you]73-eustace tell [them]419-the two pevensies to lower [the boat]1923-the boat , [Drinian]98-drinian . ”[85-caspian]

[The King]305-the king , [the Mouse]89-reepicheep , [the two Pevensies]419-the two pevensies , and [Eustace]73-eustace all got into [the boat]1923-the boat and were pulled to [the beach of [Felimath]21-felimath]421-the beach of felimath . When [the boat]1923-the boat had left [them]423-they and was being rowed back [they]423-they all turned and looked round . [They]423-they were surprised at how small [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader looked .

[Lucy]80-lucy was of course barefoot , having kicked off [her]80-lucy shoes while swimming , but that is no hardship if [one]256-one is going to walk on downy turf . It was delightful to be ashore again and to smell the earth and grass , even if at first the ground seemed to be pitching up and down like [a ship]232-a ship , as it usually does for a while if [one]256-one has been at [sea]1854-sea . It was much warmer here than it had been on board and [Lucy]80-lucy found the sand pleasant to [her]80-lucy feet as [they]423-they crossed [it]428-it . There was a lark singing .

[They]423-they struck inland and up [a fairly steep , though low , hill]429-a fairly steep , though low , hill . At the top of course [they]423-they looked back , and there was the [Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader shining like a great bright insect and crawling slowly north - westward with [her]109-the dawn treader oars . Then [they]423-they went over [the ridge]430-the ridge and could see [her]109-the dawn treader no longer .

[Doom]25-doom now lay before [them]423-they , divided from [Felimath]21-felimath by [a channel about a mile wide]431-a channel about a mile wide ; behind [it]25-doom and to the left lay [Avra]23-avra . [The little white town of Narrowhaven on [Doorn]24-doorn]432-the little white town of narrowhaven on doorn was easily seen .

“ [Hullo]119-hullo ! What ’s this ? ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund suddenly .

In [the green valley]433-the green valley to which [they]423-they were descending [six or seven rough - looking men , all armed]434-six or seven rough - looking men , all armed , were sitting by a tree .

“ Do n’t tell [them]434-six or seven rough - looking men , all armed who [we]423-they are , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ And pray , [[your]1969-your Majesty]1838-your majesty , why not ? ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep who had consented to ride on [Lucy]80-lucy ’s shoulder .

“ It just occurred to [me]85-caspian , ”[85-caspian] replied [Caspian]85-caspian , “ that [no one here]1971-no one here can have heard from [Narnia]2-narnia for a long time . It ’s just possible [they]434-six or seven rough - looking men , all armed may not still acknowledge [our]423-they over - lordship . In which case it might not be quite safe to be known as [the King]305-the king . ”[85-caspian]

“ [We]423-they have [our]423-they swords , [Sire]116-sire , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep .

“ Yes , [Reep]120-reep , [I]85-caspian know [we]423-they have , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ But if it is a question of re - conquering [the three islands]1973-the three islands , [I]85-caspian ’d prefer to come back with [a rather larger army]1974-a rather larger army . ”[85-caspian]

By this time [they]435-they were quite close to [the strangers]436-the strangers , one of whom — [a big black - haired fellow]437-a big black - haired fellow — shouted out , “ A good morning to [you]85-caspian . ”[437-a big black - haired fellow]

“ And a good morning to [you]438-the man , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ Is there still [a Governor of [the Lone Islands]7-the lone islands]1975-a governor of the lone islands ? ”[85-caspian]

“ To be sure there is , ”[438-the man] said [the man]438-the man , “ [Governor Gumpas]121-gumpas . [His]121-gumpas Sufficiency is at [Narrowhaven]26-narrowhaven . But [you]85-caspian ’ll stay and drink with [us]435-they . ”[438-the man]

[Caspian]85-caspian thanked [him]438-the man , though neither [he]85-caspian nor [the others]1949-the others much liked the look of [[their]435-they new acquaintance]440-their new acquaintance , and [all of [them]441-all of them]441-all of them sat down . But hardly had [they]441-all of them raised [their]441-all of them cups to [their]441-all of them lips when [the black - haired man]442-the black - haired man nodded to [[his]442-the black - haired man companions]443-his companions and , as quick as lightning , [all the five visitors]444-all the five visitors found [themselves]441-all of them wrapped in strong arms . There was a moment ’s struggle but all the advantages were on one side , and soon [everyone]251-everyone was disarmed and had [their]251-everyone hands tied behind [their]251-everyone backs except [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , writhing in [[his]89-reepicheep captor]446-his captor ’s grip and biting furiously .

“ Careful with that beast , [Tacks]122-tacks , ”[447-the leader] said [the Leader]447-the leader . “ Do n’t damage [him]89-reepicheep . [He]89-reepicheep ’ll fetch the best price of the lot , [I]447-the leader should n’t wonder . ”[447-the leader]

“ [Coward]123-coward ! [Poltroon]27-poltroon ! ”[89-reepicheep] squeaked [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . “ Give [me]89-reepicheep [my]89-reepicheep sword and free [my]89-reepicheep paws if [you]448-the slave merchant dare . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ Whew ! ”[448-the slave merchant] whistled [the slave merchant]448-the slave merchant ( for that is what [he]448-the slave merchant was ) . “ It can talk ! Well [I]448-the slave merchant never did . Blowed if [I]448-the slave merchant take less than two hundred crescents for [him]89-reepicheep . ”[448-the slave merchant] The Calormen crescent , which is the chief coin in [those parts]449-those parts , is worth about a third of a pound .

“ So that ’s what [you]448-the slave merchant are , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [A kidnapper]1976-a kidnapper and [slaver]1977-slaver . [I]85-caspian hope [you]448-the slave merchant ’re proud of it . ”[85-caspian]

“ Where will [you]450-the slaver take [us]1979-us ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy , getting the words out with some difficulty .

“ Is there a British Consul [there]226-there ? ”[73-eustace] asked [Eustace]73-eustace .

Then [the four human prisoners]454-the four human prisoners were roped together , not cruelly but securely , and made to march down to [the shore]455-the shore . [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep was carried . [He]89-reepicheep had stopped biting on a threat of having [his]89-reepicheep mouth tied up , but [he]89-reepicheep had a great deal to say , and [Lucy]80-lucy really wondered how [any man]456-any man could bear to have the things said to [him]89-reepicheep which were said to [the slave dealer]457-the slave dealer by [the Mouse]458-the mouse . When [they]454-the four human prisoners got down to [the shore]455-the shore that looked towards [Doorn]24-doorn [they]454-the four human prisoners found [a little village]461-a little village and [a long - boat]462-a long - boat on [the beach]463-the beach and , lying a little further out , [a dirty bedraggled looking ship]464-a dirty bedraggled looking ship .

At that moment [a fine - looking bearded man]466-a fine - looking bearded man came out of [one of [the houses]468-the houses]467-one of the houses ( [an inn]469-an inn , [I]0-i think ) and said :

Then [they]476-they were rowed out to [the slave - ship]477-the slave - ship and taken below into a long , rather dark place , none too clean , where [they]476-they found [many other unfortunate prisoners]478-many other unfortunate prisoners ; for [Pug]125-pug was of course [a pirate]1901-a pirate and had just returned from cruising among [the islands]480-the islands and capturing what [he]125-pug could . Meanwhile [Caspian]85-caspian was having a much more interesting time . “ There is [[my]85-caspian ship]2052-my ship just rounding the point , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [We]2053-we are about thirty swords if it came to fighting . After a little more conversation [Caspian]85-caspian and [Bern]101-bern walked down to [the coast]495-the coast [a little west of [the village]490-the village]496-a little west of the village and there [Caspian]85-caspian winded [his]85-caspian horn . ( This was not the great magic horn of [Narnia]2-narnia , [[Queen Susan]78-susan ’s Horn]30-queen susan ’s horn : [he]85-caspian had left that at [home]296-home for [[his]85-caspian regent]499-his regent [Trumpkin]96-trumpkin to use if any great need fell upon [the land]500-the land in [the King]305-the king ’s absence . ) [Drinian]98-drinian , who was on the look - out for a signal , recognized the royal horn at once and [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader began standing in to [shore]503-shore . Then [the boat]1923-the boat put off again and in a few moments [Caspian]85-caspian and [the Lord Bern]101-bern were on [deck]334-deck explaining the situation to [Drinian]98-drinian . [He]98-drinian , just like [Caspian]85-caspian , wanted to lay the [Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader alongside [the slave - ship]477-the slave - ship at once and board [her]477-the slave - ship , but [Bern]101-bern made the same objection .

“ [Bernstead]129-bernstead , ”[101-bern] said [the Lord Bern]101-bern . “ That ’ll do excellently . [Their]1949-the others whole journey — if there were [any ships What [Caspian]85-caspian]2068-any ships what caspian did there would be out of sight from [Narrowhaven]26-narrowhaven . ”[101-bern]

[Caspian]85-caspian was sorry for [the others]1949-the others languishing in the hold of [[Pug]125-pug ’s slave - ship]508-pug ’s slave - ship , but [he]85-caspian could not help finding the rest of that day enjoyable . Late in the afternoon ( for [they]1949-the others had to do all by oar ) , having turned to starboard round [the northeast end of [Doorn]24-doorn]509-the northeast end of doorn and port again round [the point of [Avra]23-avra]510-the point of avra , [they]1949-the others entered into [a good harbour on [[Avra]23-avra ’s southern shore]512-avra ’s southern shore where [[Bern]101-bern ’s pleasant lands]513-bern ’s pleasant lands]511-a good harbour on avra ’s southern shore where bern ’s pleasant lands sloped down to [the water ’s edge]514-the water ’s edge . [[Bern]101-bern ’s people]515-bern ’s people , [many of whom [they]1949-the others saw working in [the fields]517-the fields]516-many of whom they saw working in the fields , were [all freemen]518-all freemen and it was [a happy and prosperous fief]519-a happy and prosperous fief . Here [they]515-bern ’s people all went ashore and were royally feasted in [a low , pillared house overlooking [the bay]521-the bay]520-a low , pillared house overlooking the bay . But after dark [Bern]101-bern sent [a messenger over by [boat]526-boat to [Doorn]24-doorn]525-a messenger over by boat to doorn to order some preparations ( [he]522-he did not say exactly what ) for the following day .

[Nert]130-nert morning [the Lord Bern]101-bern called [[his]522-he guests]527-his guests early , and after breakfast [he]522-he asked [Caspian]85-caspian to order [every man [he]85-caspian had into full armour]528-every man he had into full armour . “ And above all , ”[522-he] [he]522-he added , “ let everything be as trim and scoured as if it were the morning of the first battle in a great war between [noble kings]2069-noble kings with all [the world]1877-the world looking on . ”[522-he] This was done ; and then in three boatloads [Caspian]85-caspian and [[his]85-caspian people]529-his people , and [Bern]101-bern with [a few of [his]85-caspian]530-a few of his , put out for [Narrowhaven]26-narrowhaven . When [they]534-they reached [the jetty at [Narrowhaven]26-narrowhaven]535-the jetty at narrowhaven , [Caspian]85-caspian found [a considerable crowd]536-a considerable crowd assembled to meet [them]534-they . “ This is what [I]101-bern sent word about last night , ”[101-bern] said [Bern]101-bern . “ [They]536-a considerable crowd are [all friends of [mine]101-bern and [honest people]2072-honest people]2071-all friends of mine and honest people . ”[101-bern] And as soon as [Caspian]85-caspian stepped [ashore]537-ashore [the crowd]538-the crowd broke out into hurrahs and shouts of , “ [Narnia]2-narnia ! [Narnia]2-narnia ! Long live [the King]305-the king . ”[538-the crowd] At the same moment — and this was also due to [[Bern]101-bern ’s messengers]539-bern ’s messengers — bells began ringing from [many parts of [the town]541-the town]540-many parts of the town . Then [Caspian]85-caspian caused [his]85-caspian banner to be advanced and [his]85-caspian trumpet to be blown and [every man]542-every man drew [his]542-every man sword and set [his]542-every man face into a joyful sternness , and [they]543-they marched up [the street]544-the street so that [the street]544-the street shook , and [their]543-they armour shone ( for it was a sunny morning ) so that [one]256-one could hardly look at it steadily .

At first [the only people who cheered]547-the only people who cheered were [those who had been warned by [[Bern]101-bern ’s messenger]549-bern ’s messenger]548-those who had been warned by bern ’s messenger and knew what was happening and wanted it to happen . But then [all the children]550-all the children joined in because [they]550-all the children liked a procession and had seen very [few]551-few . And then [all the schoolboys]552-all the schoolboys joined in because [they]552-all the schoolboys also liked processions and felt that the more noise and disturbance there was the less likely [they]552-all the schoolboys would be to have any school that morning . And then [all the old women]553-all the old women put [their]553-all the old women heads out of doors and windows and began chattering and cheering because it was [a king]1936-a king , and what is [a governor]555-a governor compared with that ? And [all the young women]556-all the young women joined in for the same reason and also because [Caspian]85-caspian and [Drinian]98-drinian and [the rest]1856-the rest were so handsome . And then [all the young men]558-all the young men came to see what [the young women]559-the young women were looking at , so that by the time [Caspian]85-caspian reached the castle gates , nearly [the whole town]560-the whole town was shouting ; and where [Gumpas]121-gumpas sat in [the castle]561-the castle , muddling and messing about with accounts and forms and rules and regulations , [he]85-caspian heard the noise .

At the castle gate [Caspian]85-caspian ’s trumpeter blew a blast and cried , “ Open for [the King of [Narnia]2-narnia]2044-the king of narnia , come to visit [[his]2044-the king of narnia trusty and wellbeloved servant [the governor of [the Lone Islands]7-the lone islands]2076-the governor of the lone islands]2075-his trusty and wellbeloved servant the governor of the lone islands . ”[85-caspian] In those days everything in [the islands]480-the islands was done in a slovenly , slouching manner . “ Uncover before [Narnia]2-narnia , [you]564-a tousled fellow with a dirty old hat on his head instead of a helmet , and a rusty old pike in his hand dog , ”[101-bern] thundered [the Lord Bern]101-bern , and dealt [him]564-a tousled fellow with a dirty old hat on his head instead of a helmet , and a rusty old pike in his hand a rap with [his]564-a tousled fellow with a dirty old hat on his head instead of a helmet , and a rusty old pike in his hand gauntleted hand which sent [his]564-a tousled fellow with a dirty old hat on his head instead of a helmet , and a rusty old pike in his hand hat flying from [his]564-a tousled fellow with a dirty old hat on his head instead of a helmet , and a rusty old pike in his hand head .

“ ’ Ere ? Wot ’s it all about ? ”[565-the doorkeeper] began [the doorkeeper]565-the doorkeeper , but [no one]1909-no one took any notice of [him]565-the doorkeeper . “ Where is [the captain]1889-the captain ? ”[85-caspian] [he]85-caspian asked .

“ And [we]436-the strangers are come to enquire into [your]121-gumpas Sufficiency ’s conduct of [[your]121-gumpas office]2090-your office , ”[85-caspian] continued [Caspian]85-caspian . “ There are two points especially on which [I]85-caspian require an explanation . “ [I]85-caspian also find it very clearly written in [our]436-the strangers laws , ”[85-caspian] [Caspian]85-caspian went on , “ that if the tribute is not delivered the whole debt has to be paid by [the Governor of [the Lone Islands]7-the lone islands]2076-the governor of the lone islands out of [his]2076-the governor of the lone islands private purse . ”[85-caspian]

At this [Gumpas]121-gumpas began to pay real attention . “ Oh , that ’s quite out of the question , ”[121-gumpas] [he]121-gumpas said . “ It is an economic impossibility — er — [[your]121-gumpas Majesty]1838-your majesty must be joking . ”[121-gumpas]

Inside , [he]121-gumpas was wondering if there were any way of getting rid of [these unwelcome visitors]590-these unwelcome visitors . Had [he]121-gumpas known that [Caspian]85-caspian had only [one ship]591-one ship and [one ship]591-one ship ’s company with [him]85-caspian , [he]85-caspian would have spoken soft words for the moment , and hoped to have [them]590-these unwelcome visitors all surrounded and killed during the night . But [he]85-caspian had seen [a ship of war]593-a ship of war sail down [the straits]1906-the straits yesterday and seen [it]593-a ship of war signalling , as [he]85-caspian supposed , to [its consorts]595-its consorts . Now [he]121-gumpas imagined that [Caspian]85-caspian had [a whole fleet at [Bernstead]129-bernstead]598-a whole fleet at bernstead . “ Secondly , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ [I]85-caspian want to know why [you]121-gumpas have permitted this abominable and unnatural traffic in [slaves]315-slaves to grow up here , contrary to the ancient custom and usage of [[our]2098-our dominions]2099-our dominions . ”[85-caspian]

“ What need have [you]85-caspian of [slaves]315-slaves ? ”[85-caspian]

“ For export , [[your]85-caspian Majesty]1838-your majesty . Sell ’em to [Calormen]32-calormen mostly ; and [we]2098-our have other markets . [We]2098-our are a great centre of the trade . ”[85-caspian]

“ [[Your]85-caspian Majesty]1838-your majesty ’s tender years , ”[121-gumpas] said [Gumpas]121-gumpas , with what was meant to be a fatherly smile , “ hardly make it possible that [you]121-gumpas should understand the economic problem involved .
