And there was [I]0-i as smooth and soft as a peeled switch and smaller than [I]0-i had been . Then [he]0-i caught hold of [me]0-i — [I]0-i did n’t like that much for [I]0-i was very tender underneath now that [I]0-i ’d no skin on — and threw [me]0-i into [the water]1834-the water . It smarted like anything but only for a moment . After that it became perfectly delicious and as soon as [I]0-i started swimming and splashing [I]0-i found that all the pain had gone from [my]0-i arm . And then [I]0-i saw why . [I]0-i ’d turned into [a boy]838-a boy again . [You]2274-you ’d think [me]0-i simply phoney if [I]0-i told [you]2274-you how [I]0-i felt about [my]0-i own arms . [I]0-i know they ’ve no muscle and are pretty mouldy compared with [Caspian]85-caspian ’s , but [I]0-i was so glad to see them .[0-i]

“ After a bit the lion took [me]0-i out and dressed [me]0-i — ”[0-i]

“ Dressed [you]0-i . With [his]85-caspian paws ? ”[0-i]

“ Well , [I]0-i do n’t exactly remember that bit . But [he]85-caspian did somehow or other : in new clothes — the same [I]0-i ’ve got on now , as a matter of fact . And then suddenly [I]0-i was back here . Which is what makes [me]0-i think it must have been a dream . ”[0-i]

“ No . It was n’t a dream , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Why not ? ”[0-i]

“ Well , there are the clothes , for one thing . And [you]0-i have been — well , un - dragoned , for another . ”[0-i]

“ What do [you]79-edmund think it was , then ? ”[73-eustace] asked [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ [I]79-edmund think [you]79-edmund ’ve seen [Aslan]91-aslan , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ [Aslan]91-aslan ! ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace . “ [I]73-eustace ’ve heard that name mentioned several times since [we]2275-we joined the Dawn Treader . And [I]73-eustace felt — [I]73-eustace do n’t know what — [I]73-eustace hated it . But [I]73-eustace was hating everything then . And by the way , [I]73-eustace ’d like to apologize . [I]73-eustace ’m afraid [I]73-eustace ’ve been pretty beastly . ”[73-eustace]

“ That ’s all right , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ Between [ourselves]2275-we , [you]79-edmund have n’t been as bad as [I]79-edmund was on [my]79-edmund first trip to [Narnia]2-narnia . [You]79-edmund were only an ass , but [I]79-edmund was [a traitor]2276-a traitor . ”[79-edmund]

“ Well , do n’t tell [me]73-eustace about it , then , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace . “ But who is [Aslan]91-aslan ? Do [you]79-edmund know [him]91-aslan ? ”[73-eustace]

“ Well — [he]91-aslan knows [me]79-edmund , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [He]91-aslan is the great Lion , [the son of [the Emperor - beyond - [the - Sea]40-the - sea]39-the emperor - beyond - the - sea , who saved [me]79-edmund and saved [Narnia]2-narnia]2277-the son of the emperor - beyond - the - sea , who saved me and saved narnia . [We]945-they ’ve all seen [him]91-aslan . [Lucy]80-lucy sees [him]91-aslan most often . And it may be [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s country [we]945-they are sailing to]2278-aslan ’s country we are sailing to . ”[79-edmund]

[Neither]944-neither said anything for a while . The last bright star had vanished and though [they]945-they could not see the sunrise because of [the mountains on [their]945-they right]946-the mountains on their right , [they]945-they knew it was going on because the sky above [them]945-they and [the bay]521-the bay before [them]945-they turned the colour of roses . Then [some bird of the parrot kind]948-some bird of the parrot kind screamed in the wood behind [them]945-they , [they]945-they heard movements among the trees , and finally a blast on [Caspian]85-caspian ’s horn . [The camp]917-the camp was astir .

Great was the rejoicing when [Edmund]79-edmund and [the restored Eustace]73-eustace walked into the breakfast circle round [the camp fire]950-the camp fire . And now of course [everyone]251-everyone heard the earlier part of [his]73-eustace story . [People]207-people wondered whether [the other dragon]953-the other dragon had killed [the Lord Octesian]103-the lord octesian several years ago or whether [Octesian]103-the lord octesian [himself]103-the lord octesian had been [the old dragon]954-the old dragon . The jewels with which [Eustace]73-eustace had crammed [his]73-eustace pockets in [the cave]794-the cave had disappeared along with the clothes [he]73-eustace had then been wearing : but [no one]1909-no one , least of all [Eustace]73-eustace [himself]73-eustace , felt any desire to go back to [that valley]957-that valley for more treasure .

In a few days now [the Dawn Treader , remasted , re - painted , and well stored]958-the dawn treader , remasted , re - painted , and well stored , was ready to sail . Before [they]959-they embarked [Caspian]85-caspian caused to be cut on [a smooth cliff facing [the bay]521-the bay]960-a smooth cliff facing the bay the words :

DRAGON ISLAND DISCOVERED BY [CASPIAN X]85-caspian , [KING OF [NARNIA]2-narnia]962-king of narnia , ETC . IN THE FOURTH YEAR OF [HIS]103-the lord octesian REIGN . HERE , AS [WE]963-they SUPPOSE , [THE LORD OCTESIAN]103-the lord octesian HAD [HIS]103-the lord octesian DEATH .

It would be nice , and fairly true , to say that “ from that time forth [Eustace]73-eustace was [a different boy]2279-a different boy ”[103-the lord octesian] . To be strictly accurate , [he]73-eustace began to be [a different boy]2279-a different boy . [He]73-eustace had relapses . There were still many days when [he]73-eustace could be very tiresome . But most of those [I]0-i shall not notice . The cure had begun .

[The Lord Octesian]103-the lord octesian ’s arm ring had a curious fate . [Eustace]73-eustace did not want it and offered it to [Caspian]85-caspian and [Caspian]85-caspian offered it to [Lucy]80-lucy . [She]80-lucy did not care about having it . “ Very well , then , catch as catch can , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian and flung it up in the air . This was when [they]963-they were all standing looking at the inscription . Up went the ring , flashing in the sunlight , and caught , and hung , as neatly as a well - thrown quoit , on a little projection on [the rock]965-the rock . [No one]1909-no one could climb up to get it from below and [no one]1909-no one could climb down to get it from above . And there , for all [I]0-i know , it is hanging still and may hang till [that world]968-that world ends .

[EVERYONE]251-everyone was cheerful as [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader sailed from [Dragon Island]38-dragon island . [They]963-they had fair winds as soon as [they]963-they were out of [the bay]521-the bay and came early next morning to [the unknown land which some of [them]963-they had seen when flying over [the mountains]752-the mountains while [Eustace]73-eustace]971-the unknown land which some of them had seen when flying over the mountains while eustace was still [a dragon]834-a dragon . [It]971-the unknown land which some of them had seen when flying over the mountains while eustace was [a low green island inhabited by nothing but rabbits]974-a low green island inhabited by nothing but rabbits and a few goats , but from the ruins of [stone huts]975-stone huts , and from blackened places where fires had been , [they]963-they judged that [it]971-the unknown land which some of them had seen when flying over the mountains while eustace had been peopled not long before . There were also some bones and broken weapons .

“ [Pirates]2280-pirates ’ work , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Or the dragon ’s , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

The only other thing [they]963-they found there was [a little skin boat]976-a little skin boat , or coracle , on [the sands]977-the sands . It was made of hide stretched over a wicker framework . It was [a tiny boat]978-a tiny boat , barely four feet long , and the paddle which still lay in it was in proportion . [They]963-they thought that either it had been made for [a child]1865-a child or else that [the people of [that country]981-that country]980-the people of that country had been [Dwarfs]90-dwarfs . [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep decided to keep [it]976-a little skin boat , as it was just the right size for [him]89-reepicheep ; so it was taken on board . [They]963-they called [that land]982-that land [Burnt Island]42-burnt island , and sailed away before noon .

For some five days [they]963-they ran before [a south - south - east wind]983-a south - south - east wind , out of sight of [all lands]984-all lands and seeing neither fish nor gull . Then [they]963-they had a day when it rained hard till the afternoon . [Eustace]73-eustace lost two games of chess to [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep and began to get like [[his]73-eustace old and disagreeable self]985-his old and disagreeable self again , and [Edmund]79-edmund said [he]79-edmund wished [they]963-they could have gone to [America]1-america with [Susan]78-susan . Then [Lucy]80-lucy looked out of the stern windows and said :

“ Hello ! [I]80-lucy do believe it ’s stopping . And what ’s that ? ”[80-lucy]

[They]963-they all tumbled up to the poop at this and found that the rain had stopped and [that Drinian , who was on watch]986-that drinian , who was on watch , was also staring hard at something astern . Or rather , at several things . [They]963-they looked a little like smooth rounded rocks , a whole line of them with intervals of about forty feet in between .

“ But [they]963-they ca n’t be rocks , ”[98-drinian] [Drinian]98-drinian was saying , “ because [they]963-they were n’t [there]226-there five minutes ago . ”[98-drinian]

“ And one ’s just disappeared , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ Yes , and there ’s another one coming up , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ And nearer , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ Hang it ! ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ The whole thing is moving this way . ”[85-caspian]

“ And moving a great deal quicker than [we]963-they can sail , [Sire]116-sire , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian . “ It ’ll be up with [us]963-they in a minute . ”[98-drinian]

[They]963-they all held [their]963-they breath , for it is not at all nice to be pursued by an unknown something either on [land]395-land or [sea]1854-sea . But what it turned out to be was far worse than [anyone]1930-anyone had suspected . Suddenly , only about the length of a cricket pitch from [their]963-they port side , an appalling head reared itself out of [the sea]250-the sea . It was all greens and vermilions with purple blotches — except where shell fish clung to it — and shaped rather like a horse ’s , though without ears . It had enormous eyes , eyes made for staring through the dark depths of [the ocean]991-the ocean , and a gaping mouth filled with double rows of sharp fish - like teeth . [It]992-its came up on what [they]963-they first took to be a huge neck , but as more and more of it emerged [everyone]251-everyone knew that this was not [its]992-its neck but [its]992-its body and that at last [they]963-they were seeing what [so many people]994-so many people have foolishly wanted to see — the great Sea Serpent . The folds of its gigantic tail could be seen far away , rising at intervals from the surface . And now its head was towering up higher than the mast .

[Every man]542-every man rushed to [his]542-every man weapon , but there was nothing to be done , the monster was out of reach . “ Shoot ! Shoot ! ”[142-the master bowman] cried [the Master Bowman]142-the master bowman , and [several]996-several obeyed , but the arrows glanced off [the Sea Serpent]43-the sea serpent ’s hide as if it was ironplated . Then , for a dreadful minute , [everyone]251-everyone was still , staring up at its eyes and mouth and wondering where it would pounce .

But it did n’t pounce . [It]43-the sea serpent shot its head forward across [the ship]234-the ship on a level with the yard of the mast . Now its head was just beside the fighting top . Still it stretched and stretched till [its]43-the sea serpent head was over the starboard bulwark . Then down it began to come — not on to [the crowded deck]999-the crowded deck but into [the water]1834-the water , so that [the whole ship]2192-the whole ship was under an arch of serpent . And almost at once that arch began to get smaller : indeed on the starboard the [Sea Serpent]43-the sea serpent was now almost touching [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader ’s side .

[Eustace]73-eustace ( who had really been [trying very hard to behave well , till the rain and the chess]1002-trying very hard to behave well , till the rain and the chess put [him]73-eustace back ) now did the first brave thing [he]73-eustace had ever done . [He]73-eustace was wearing a sword that [Caspian]85-caspian had lent [him]73-eustace . As soon as the serpent ’s body was near enough on the starboard side [he]73-eustace jumped on to the bulwark and began hacking at it with all [his]73-eustace might . It is true that [he]73-eustace accomplished nothing beyond breaking [Caspian]85-caspian ’s second - best sword into bits , but it was a fine thing for [a beginner]1003-a beginner to have done .

[Others]2187-others would have joined [him]73-eustace if at that moment [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep had not called out , “ Do n’t fight ! Push ! ”[89-reepicheep] It was so unusual for [the Mouse]89-reepicheep to advise [anyone]1930-anyone not to fight that , even in that terrible moment , every eye turned to [him]73-eustace . And when [he]73-eustace jumped up on to [the bulwark]1006-the bulwark , forward of the snake , and set [his]73-eustace little furry back against its huge scaly , slimy back , and began pushing as hard as [he]73-eustace could , quite [a number of [people]207-people]1007-a number of people saw what [he]73-eustace meant and rushed to both sides of [the ship]234-the ship to do the same . And when , a moment later , [the Sea Serpent]43-the sea serpent ’s head appeared again , this time on the port side , and this time with its back to [them]1010-they , then [everyone]251-everyone understood .

[The brute]800-the brute had made a loop of itself round [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader and was beginning to draw the loop tight . When it got quite tight — snap!—there would be floating matchwood where [the ship]234-the ship had been and it could pick [them]1010-they out of the water one by one . [Their]1010-they only chance was to push the loop backward till it slid over the stern ; or else ( to put the same thing another way ) to push [the ship]234-the ship forward out of the loop .

[Reepicheep]89-reepicheep alone had , of course , no more chance of doing this than of lifting up a cathedral , but [he]89-reepicheep had nearly killed [himself]89-reepicheep with trying before [others]2187-others shoved [him]89-reepicheep aside . Very soon [the whole ship]2192-the whole ship ’s company except [Lucy]80-lucy and [the Mouse]89-reepicheep ( which was fainting ) was in two long lines along [the two bulwarks]1017-the two bulwarks , [each man]1018-each man ’s chest to the back of [the man in front]1019-the man in front , so that the weight of the whole line was in [the last man]1020-the last man , pushing for [their]1010-they lives . For a few sickening seconds ( which seemed like hours ) nothing appeared to happen . [Joints]144-joints cracked , sweat dropped , breath came in grunts and gasps . Then [they]1010-they felt that [the ship]234-the ship was moving . [They]1010-they saw that the snake - loop was further from the mast than it had been . But [they]1010-they also saw that it was smaller . And now the real danger was at hand . Could [they]1010-they get it over the poop , or was it already too tight ? Yes . It would just fit . It was resting on the poop rails . A dozen or more sprang up on the poop . This was far better . The Sea Serpent ’s body was so low now that [they]1010-they could make a line across the poop and push side by side . [Hope]145-hope rose high till [everyone]251-everyone remembered the high carved stern , the dragon tail , of the Dawn Treader . It would be quite impossible to get the brute over that .

“ An axe , ”[85-caspian] cried [Caspian]85-caspian hoarsely , “ and still shove . ”[85-caspian] [Lucy]80-lucy , who knew where everything was , heard [him]85-caspian where [she]80-lucy was standing on [the main deck]1023-the main deck staring up at the poop . In a few seconds [she]80-lucy had been below , got the axe , and was rushing up the ladder to [the poop]351-the poop . But just as [she]80-lucy reached the top there came a great crashing noise like a tree coming down and [the ship]234-the ship rocked and darted forward . For at that very moment , whether because [the Sea Serpent]43-the sea serpent was being pushed so hard , or because [it]43-the sea serpent foolishly decided to draw the noose tight , the whole of the carved stern broke off and [the ship]234-the ship was free .

[The others]1949-the others were too exhausted to see what [Lucy]80-lucy saw . There , a few yards behind [them]1949-the others , the loop of Sea Serpent ’s body got rapidly smaller and disappeared into a splash . [Lucy]80-lucy always said ( but of course [she]80-lucy was very excited at the moment , and it may have been only imagination ) that [she]80-lucy saw a look of idiotic satisfaction on the creature ’s face . What is certain is that it was a very stupid animal , for instead of pursuing [the ship]234-the ship [it]43-the sea serpent turned its head round and began nosing all along its own body as if it expected to find the wreckage of [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader [there]226-there . But [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader was already well away , running before a fresh breeze , and [the men]2173-the men lay and sat panting and groaning all about [the deck]255-the deck , till presently [they]2173-the men were able to talk about it , and then to laugh about it . And when some rum had been served out [they]2173-the men even raised a cheer ; and [everyone]251-everyone praised the valour of [Eustace]73-eustace ( though it had n’t done any good ) and of [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep .

After this [they]2173-the men sailed for three days more and saw nothing but [sea]1854-sea and sky . On the fourth day the wind changed to the north and the seas began to rise ; by the afternoon it had nearly become a gale . But at the same time [they]2173-the men sighted land on [their]2173-the men port bow .

“ By [your]85-caspian leave , [Sire]1874-sire , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian , “ [we]2173-the men will try to get under the lee of [that country]981-that country by rowing and lie in harbour , maybe till this is over . ”[98-drinian] [Caspian]85-caspian agreed , but a long row against the gale did not bring [them]2173-the men to [the land]500-the land before evening . By the last light of that day [they]2173-the men steered into [a natural harbour]1036-a natural harbour and anchored , but [no one]1909-no one went ashore that night . In the morning [they]2173-the men found [themselves]2173-the men in [the green bay]1038-the green bay of [a rugged , lonely - looking country which sloped up to [a rocky summit]1040-a rocky summit]1039-a rugged , lonely - looking country which sloped up to a rocky summit . From [the windy north beyond that summit clouds]1041-the windy north beyond that summit clouds came streaming rapidly . [They]2173-the men lowered [the boat]1923-the boat and loaded

[her]1923-the boat with any of the water casks which were now empty .

“ Which stream shall [we]2173-the men water at , [Drinian]98-drinian ? ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian as [he]85-caspian took [his]85-caspian seat in the stern - sheets of [the boat]1923-the boat . “ There seem to be two coming down into [the bay]521-the bay . ”[85-caspian]

“ It makes little odds , [Sire]116-sire , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian . “ But [I]98-drinian think it ’s a shorter pull to that on the starboard - the eastern one . ”[98-drinian]

“ Here comes the rain , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ [I]79-edmund should think it does ! ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund , for it was already pelting hard . “ [I]79-edmund say , let ’s go to [the other stream]2285-the other stream . There are trees there and [we]2286-we ’ll have some shelter . ”[79-edmund]

“ Yes , let ’s , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace . “ No point in getting wetter than [we]2286-we need . ”[73-eustace]

But all the time [Drinian]98-drinian was steadily steering to the starboard , like tiresome people in cars who continue at forty miles an hour while [you]1044-you are explaining to [them]1045-they that [they]1045-they are on [the wrong road]1046-the wrong road .

“ [They]1045-they ’re right , [Drinian]98-drinian , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ Why do n’t [you]98-drinian bring [her]2287-her head round and make for [the western stream]2288-the western stream ? ”[85-caspian]

“ As [[your]98-drinian Majesty]1838-your majesty pleases , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian a little shortly . [He]98-drinian had had an anxious day with the weather yesterday , and [he]98-drinian did n’t like advice from [landsmen]702-landsmen . But [he]98-drinian altered course ; and it turned out afterwards that it was a good thing [he]98-drinian did .

By the time [they]1048-they had finished watering , the rain was over and [Caspian]85-caspian , with [Eustace]73-eustace , [the Pevensies]83-the pevensies , and [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , decided to walk up to [the top of [the hill]1050-the hill]1049-the top of the hill and see what could be seen . It was a stiffish climb through coarse grass and heather and [they]1048-they saw [neither man]1051-neither man nor beast , except seagulls . When [they]1048-they reached [the top]1052-the top [they]1048-they saw that [it]1053-it was [a very small island , not more than twenty acres]1054-a very small island , not more than twenty acres ; and from this height [the sea]250-the sea looked larger and more desolate than [it]250-the sea did from the deck , or even the fighting top , of [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader .

“ Crazy , [you]80-lucy know , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace to [Lucy]80-lucy in a low voice , looking at the eastern horizon . “ Sailing on and on into that with no idea what [we]1048-they may get to . ”[73-eustace] But [he]85-caspian only said it out of habit , not really nastily as [he]85-caspian would have done at one time .

It was too cold to stay long on [the ridge]430-the ridge for the wind still blew freshly from [the north]1058-the north .

“ Do n’t let ’s go back the same way , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy as [they]1048-they turned ; “ let ’s go along a bit and come down by [the other stream]2285-the other stream , the one [Drinian]98-drinian wanted to go to . ”[80-lucy]

[Everyone]251-everyone agreed to this and after about fifteen minutes [they]1048-they were at [the source of [the second river]1061-the second river]1060-the source of the second river . It was a more interesting place than [they]1048-they had expected ; [a deep little mountain lake , surrounded by cliffs except for a narrow channel on the seaward side out of which the water flowed]1062-a deep little mountain lake , surrounded by cliffs except for a narrow channel on the seaward side out of which the water flowed . Here at last [they]1048-they were out of the wind , and [all]1063-all sat down in the heather above [the cliff]790-the cliff for a rest .

[All]1063-all sat down , but one ( it was [Edmund]79-edmund ) jumped up again very quickly .

“ [They]2291-they go in for sharp stones on [this island]717-this island , ”[79-edmund] [he]79-edmund said , groping about in the heather . “ Where is the wretched thing ? . . . Ah , now [I]79-edmund ’ve got it . . . Hullo ! It was n’t a stone at all , it ’s a sword - hilt . No , by jove , it ’s a whole sword ; what the rust has left of it . It must have lain here for ages . ”[79-edmund]

“ [Narnian]4-narnian , too , by the look of it , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , as [they]1048-they all crowded round .

“ [I]80-lucy ’m sitting on something too , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ Something hard . ”[80-lucy] It turned out to be the remains of a mail - shirt . By this time [everyone]251-everyone was on hands and knees , feeling in the thick heather in every direction . [Their]1048-they search revealed , one by one , a helmet , a dagger , and a few coins ; not [Calormen]32-calormen crescents but genuine [Narnian “ Lions]146-narnian “ lions ”[146-narnian “ lions] and “ Trees ”[146-narnian “ lions] such as [you]1067-you might see any day in [the market - place of [Beaversdam]46-beaversdam or [Beruna]6-beruna]1068-the market - place of beaversdam or beruna .

“ Looks as if this might be all that ’s left of [one of [[our]1048-they seven lords]2294-our seven lords]2293-one of our seven lords , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Just what [I]85-caspian was thinking , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [I]85-caspian wonder which it was . There ’s nothing on the dagger to show . And [I]85-caspian wonder how [he]2293-one of our seven lords died . ”[85-caspian]

“ And how [we]1048-they are to avenge [him]2293-one of our seven lords , ”[89-reepicheep] added [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep .

[Edmund]79-edmund , [the only one of [the party who had read several detective stories]1070-the party who had read several detective stories]1069-the only one of the party who had read several detective stories , had meanwhile been thinking .

“ Look here , ”[79-edmund] [he]79-edmund said , “ there ’s something very fishy about this . [He]2293-one of our seven lords ca n’t have been killed in a fight . ”[79-edmund]

“ Why not ? ”[85-caspian] asked [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ No bones , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [An enemy]2295-an enemy might take the armour and leave the body . But who ever heard of [a chap who ’d won a fight carrying away the body and leaving the armour]2296-a chap who ’d won a fight carrying away the body and leaving the armour ? ”[79-edmund]

“ Perhaps [he]2293-one of our seven lords was killed by a wild animal , ”[80-lucy] [Lucy]80-lucy suggested .

“ It ’d be a clever animal , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund , “ that would take [a man]1920-a man ’s mail shirt off . ”[79-edmund]

“ Perhaps a dragon ? ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Nothing doing , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace . “ [A dragon]834-a dragon could n’t do it . [I]73-eustace ought to know . ”[73-eustace]

“ Well , let ’s get away from [the place]2268-the place , anyway , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . [She]80-lucy had not felt like sitting down again since [Edmund]79-edmund had raised the question of bones .

“ If [you]80-lucy like , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , getting up . “ [I]85-caspian do n’t think any of this stuff is worth taking away . ”[85-caspian]

[They]1071-they came down and round to [the little opening where [the stream]1073-the stream came out of [the lake]1074-the lake]1072-the little opening where the stream came out of the lake , and stood looking at [the deep water within the circle of cliffs]1075-the deep water within the circle of cliffs . If it had been a hot day , no doubt [some]626-some would have been tempted to bathe and [everyone]251-everyone would have had a drink . Indeed , even as it was , [Eustace]73-eustace was on the very point of stooping down and scooping up some water in [his]73-eustace hands when [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep and [Lucy]80-lucy both at the same moment cried , “ Look , ”[80-lucy] so [he]73-eustace forgot about [his]73-eustace drink and looked .

The bottom of the pool was made of large greyish - blue stones and the water was perfectly clear , and on the bottom lay a life - size figure of [a man]1920-a man , made apparently of gold . It lay face downwards with [its]1920-a man arms stretched out above its head . And it so happened that as [they]1071-they looked at it , the clouds parted and the sun shone out . The golden shape was lit up from end to end . [Lucy]80-lucy thought it was the most beautiful statue [she]80-lucy had ever seen .

“ Well ! ”[85-caspian] whistled [Caspian]85-caspian . “ That was worth coming to see ! [I]85-caspian wonder , can [we]1071-they get it out ? ”[85-caspian]

“ [We]1071-they can dive for it , [Sire]116-sire , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep .

“ No good at all , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ At least , if it ’s really gold — solid gold — it’ll be far too heavy to bring up . And [that pool]2300-that pool ’s twelve or fifteen feet deep if it ’s an inch . Half a moment , though . It ’s a good thing [I]79-edmund ’ve brought a hunting spear with [me]79-edmund . Let ’s see what the depth is like . Hold on to [my]79-edmund hand , [Caspian]85-caspian , while [I]79-edmund lean out over [the water]1834-the water a bit . ”[79-edmund] [Caspian]85-caspian took [his]85-caspian hand and [Edmund]79-edmund , leaning forward , began to lower [his]79-edmund spear into [the water]1834-the water .

Before it was half - way in [Lucy]80-lucy said , “ [I]80-lucy do n’t believe the statue is gold at all . It ’s only the light . [Your]79-edmund spear looks just the same colour . ”[80-lucy]

“ What ’s wrong ? ”[79-edmund] asked several voices at once ; for [Edmund]79-edmund had suddenly let go of the spear .

“ [I]79-edmund could n’t hold it , ”[79-edmund] gasped [Edmund]79-edmund , “ it seemed so heavy . ”[79-edmund]

“ And there it is on the bottom now , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ and [Lucy]80-lucy is right . It looks just the same colour as the statue . ”[85-caspian]

But [Edmund]79-edmund , who appeared to be having some trouble with [his]79-edmund boots — at least [he]79-edmund was bending down and looking at them — straightened [himself]79-edmund all at once and shouted out in the sharp voice which [people]207-people hardly ever disobey :

“ Get back ! Back from [the water]1834-the water . All of [you]207-people . At once ! ! ”[79-edmund]

[They]207-people all did and stared at [him]79-edmund .

“ Look , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund , “ look at the toes of [my]79-edmund boots . ”[79-edmund]

“ They look a bit yellow , ”[73-eustace] began [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ [They]2303-they ’re gold , solid gold , ”[79-edmund] interrupted [Edmund]79-edmund . “ Look at [them]2303-they . Feel them . The leather ’s pulled away from it already . And they ’re as heavy as lead . ”[79-edmund]

“ By [Aslan]91-aslan ! ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [You]79-edmund do n’t mean to say- ? ”[85-caspian]

“ Yes , [I]79-edmund do , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [That water]2304-that water turns things into gold . It turned the spear into gold , that ’s why it got so heavy . And it was just lapping against [my]79-edmund feet ( it ’s a good thing [I]79-edmund was n’t barefoot ) and it turned the toe - caps into gold . And [that poor fellow on the bottom]2305-that poor fellow on the bottom — well , [you]80-lucy see . ”[79-edmund]

“ So it is n’t a statue at all , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy in a low voice .

“ No . The whole thing is plain now . [He]2305-that poor fellow on the bottom was here on a hot day . [He]2305-that poor fellow on the bottom undressed on top of [the cliff]790-the cliff — where [we]2307-we were sitting . The clothes have rotted away or been taken by birds to line nests with ; the armour ’s still there . Then [he]2305-that poor fellow on the bottom dived and — ”[79-edmund]

“ Do n’t , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ What a horrible thing . ”[80-lucy]

“ And what a narrow shave [we]2307-we ’ve had , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Narrow indeed , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . “ [Anyone]1930-anyone ’s finger , [anyone]1930-anyone ’s foot , [anyone]1930-anyone ’s whisker , or [anyone]1930-anyone ’s tail , might have slipped into the water at any moment . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ All the same , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ [we]2307-we may as well test it . ”[85-caspian] [He]85-caspian stooped down and wrenched up a spray of heather . Then , very cautiously , [he]85-caspian knelt beside the pool and dipped it in . It was heather that [he]85-caspian dipped ; what [he]85-caspian drew out was a perfect model of heather made of the purest gold , heavy and soft as lead .

“ [The King who owned [this island]717-this island]2312-the king who owned this island , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian slowly , and [his]85-caspian face flushed as [he]85-caspian spoke , “ would soon be the richest of [all the Kings of [the world]1877-the world]2314-all the kings of the world . “ Who are [you]79-edmund talking to ? ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [I]79-edmund ’m [no subject of yours]2319-no subject of yours . If anything it ’s the other way round . [I]79-edmund am [one of [the four ancient sovereigns of [Narnia]2-narnia]2321-the four ancient sovereigns of narnia]2320-one of the four ancient sovereigns of narnia and [you]2317-you are under allegiance to [the High King]358-the high king [[my]79-edmund brother]2323-my brother . ”[79-edmund]

“ So it has come to that , [King Edmund]79-edmund , has it ? ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , laying [his]85-caspian hand on [his]85-caspian sword - hilt .

“ Oh , stop it , both of [you]2317-you , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ That ’s the worst of doing anything with [boys]2208-boys . [You]2317-you ’re [all such swaggering , bullying idiots]2325-all such swaggering , bullying idiots — oooh ! — ”[80-lucy] [Her]80-lucy voice died away into a gasp . And [everyone else]863-everyone else saw what [she]80-lucy had seen .

Across [the grey hillside]1082-the grey hillside above [them]1083-them — grey , for the heather was not yet in bloom — without noise , and without looking at [them]1083-them , and shining as if [he]1084-he were in bright sunlight though the sun had in fact gone in , passed with slow pace the hugest lion that human eyes have ever seen . In describing the scene [Lucy]80-lucy said afterwards , “ [He]1084-he was the size of an elephant , ”[80-lucy] though at another time [she]80-lucy only said , “ The size of a cart - horse . ”[80-lucy] But it was not the size that mattered . [Nobody]749-nobody dared to ask what it was . [They]749-nobody knew it was [Aslan]91-aslan .

And [nobody]749-nobody ever saw how or where [he]91-aslan went . [They]749-nobody looked at [one another]1087-one another like [people waking from sleep]1088-people waking from sleep .

“ What were [we]749-nobody talking about ? ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ Have [I]85-caspian been making rather an ass of [myself]85-caspian ? ”[85-caspian]

“ [Sire]1874-sire , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ this is [a place with a curse on [it]2327-a place with a curse on it]2327-a place with a curse on it . Let [us]749-nobody get back on board at once .
