“ That strikes [me]85-caspian as a very good name , [Reep]120-reep , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ though now that [I]85-caspian come to think of it , [I]85-caspian do n’t know why . But the weather seems to be settling and [I]85-caspian dare say [Drinian]98-drinian would like to be off . What a lot [we]749-nobody shall have to tell [him]98-drinian . ”[85-caspian]

But in fact [they]1089-they had not much to tell for the memory of the last hour had all become confused .

“ [[Their]1089-they Majesties]2329-their majesties all seemed a bit bewitched when [they]1089-they came aboard , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian to [Rhince]108-rhince some hours later when [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader was once more under sail and [Deathwater Island]49-deathwater island already below the horizon . “ Something happened to [them]1089-they in [that place]2330-that place . The only thing [I]382-the dawn treader could get clear was that [they]1089-they think [they]1089-they ’ve found the body of [one of [these lords [we]749-nobody ’re looking for]2332-these lords we ’re looking for]2331-one of these lords we ’re looking for . ”[382-the dawn treader]

“ [You]108-rhince do n’t say so , [Captain]2061-captain , ”[108-rhince] answered [Rhince]108-rhince . “ Well , that ’s three . Only four more . At this rate [we]749-nobody might be [home]296-home soon after the New Year . And a good thing too . [[My]108-rhince baccy]2335-my baccy ’s running a bit low . Good night , [Sir]2125-sir . ”[108-rhince]

AND now the winds which had so long been from [the north - west]1091-the north - west began to blow from [the west itself]1092-the west itself and every morning when the sun rose out of [the sea]250-the sea the curved prow of [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader stood up right across the middle of the sun . [Some]626-some thought that the sun looked larger than it looked from [Narnia]2-narnia , but [others]2187-others disagreed . And [they]1096-they sailed and sailed before a gentle yet steady breeze and saw neither fish nor gull — nor [ship]339-ship nor [shore]503-shore . And stores began to get low again , and it crept into [their]1096-they hearts that perhaps [they]1096-they might have come to [a sea which went on for ever]1099-a sea which went on for ever . But when the very last day on which [they]1096-they thought [they]1096-they could risk continuing [their]1096-they eastward voyage dawned , it showed , right ahead between [them]1096-they and the sunrise , [a low land]1100-a low land lying like a cloud .

[They]1096-they made harbour in [a wide bay]1101-a wide bay about the middle of the afternoon and landed . It was [a very different country]1102-a very different country from any [they]1096-they had yet seen . For when [they]1096-they had crossed [the sandy beach]1103-the sandy beach [they]1096-they found all silent and empty as if [it]1103-the sandy beach were [an uninhabited land]1104-an uninhabited land , but before [them]1096-they there were level lawns in which the grass was as smooth and short as it used to be in [the grounds of [a great English house]1106-a great english house where [ten gardeners]1107-ten gardeners were kept]1105-the grounds of a great english house where ten gardeners were kept . The trees , of which there were many , all stood well apart from one another , and there were no broken branches and no leaves lying on the ground . [Pigeons]147-pigeons sometimes cooed but there was no other noise .

Presently [they]1096-they came to a long , straight , sanded path with not a weed growing on it and trees on either hand . Far off at the other end of [this avenue]1108-this avenue [they]1096-they now caught sight of [a house]706-a house — very long and grey and quiet - looking in the afternoon sun .

Almost as soon as [they]1096-they entered [this path]1110-this path [Lucy]80-lucy noticed that [she]80-lucy had a little stone in [her]80-lucy shoe . In [that unknown place]1111-that unknown place it might have been wiser for [her]80-lucy to ask [the others]1949-the others to wait while [she]80-lucy took it out . But [she]80-lucy did n’t ; [she]80-lucy just dropped quietly behind and sat down to take off [her]80-lucy shoe . [Her]80-lucy lace had got into a knot .

Before [she]80-lucy had undone the knot [the others]1949-the others were a fair distance ahead . By the time [she]80-lucy had got the stone out and was putting the shoe on again [she]80-lucy could no longer hear [them]1949-the others . But almost at once [she]80-lucy heard something else . It was not coming from the direction of [the house]229-the house .

What [she]80-lucy heard was a thumping . It sounded as if [dozens of strong workmen]1115-dozens of strong workmen were hitting the ground as hard as [they]1115-dozens of strong workmen could with great wooden mallets . And it was very quickly coming nearer . [She]80-lucy was already sitting with [her]80-lucy back to a tree , and as the tree was not one [she]80-lucy could climb , there was really nothing to do but to sit dead still and press [herself]80-lucy against the tree and hope [she]80-lucy would n’t be seen .

Thump , thump , thump . . . and whatever it was must be very close now for [she]80-lucy could feel the ground shaking . But [she]80-lucy could see nothing . [She]80-lucy thought the thing — or things must be just behind [her]80-lucy . But then there came a thump on the path right in front of [her]80-lucy . [She]80-lucy knew it was on [the path]1116-the path not only by the sound but because [she]80-lucy saw the sand scatter as if it had been struck a heavy blow . But [she]80-lucy could see nothing that had struck [it]1117-it . Then all the thumping noises drew together about twenty feet away from [her]80-lucy and suddenly ceased . Then came the Voice .

It was really very dreadful because [she]80-lucy could still see [nobody]749-nobody at all . [The whole of [that park - like country]1120-that park - like country]1119-the whole of that park - like country still looked as quiet and empty as [it]1119-the whole of that park - like country had looked when [they]1121-they first landed . Nevertheless , only a few feet away from [her]80-lucy , a voice spoke . And what it said was :

“ [Mates]1983-mates , now ’s [our]1121-they chance . ”[1122-the first voice]

Instantly a whole chorus of other voices replied , “ Hear [him]2338-him . Hear [him]2338-him . ‘ Now ’s [our]1121-they chance ’ , [he]2338-him said . Well done , [Chief]2339-chief . [You]2339-chief never said a truer word . ”[80-lucy]

“ What [I]1122-the first voice say , ”[1122-the first voice] continued [the first voice]1122-the first voice , “ is , get down to the shore between [them]1121-they and [[their]1121-they boat]2340-their boat , and let [[every mother]1902-every mother ’s son]2342-every mother ’s son look to [his]2342-every mother ’s son weapons . Catch ’em when [they]1121-they try to put to [sea]1854-sea . ”[1122-the first voice]

“ Eh , that ’s the way , ”[1123-all the other voices] shouted [all the other voices]1123-all the other voices . “ [You]2339-chief never made a better plan , [Chief]148-chief . Keep it up , [Chief]148-chief . [You]2339-chief could n’t have a better plan than that . ”[1123-all the other voices]

“ Lively , then , [mates]1983-mates , [lively]2345-lively , ”[1122-the first voice] said [the first voice]1122-the first voice . “ Off [we]1983-mates go .[1122-the first voice]

“ Right again , [Chief]148-chief , ”[1949-the others] said [the others]1949-the others . “ Could n’t have a better order . Just what [we]1983-mates were going to say [ourselves]1983-mates . Off [we]1983-mates go . ”[1949-the others]

Immediately the thumping began again — very loud at first but soon fainter and fainter , till it died out in the direction of [the sea]250-the sea .

[Lucy]80-lucy knew there was no time to sit puzzling as to what these invisible creatures might be . As soon as the thumping noise had died away [she]80-lucy got up and ran along [the path]1116-the path after [the others]1949-the others as quickly as [her]80-lucy legs would carry [her]80-lucy . [They]1949-the others must at all costs be warned .

While this had been happening [the others]1949-the others had reached [the house]229-the house . [It]229-the house was [a low building]1131-a low building — only two stories high made of a beautiful mellow stone , many - windowed , and partially covered with ivy . Everything was so still that [Eustace]73-eustace said , “ [I]73-eustace think [it]229-the house ’s empty , ”[73-eustace] but [Caspian]85-caspian silently pointed to the column of smoke which rose from one chimney .

[They]1949-the others found a wide gateway open and passed through [it]1132-it into [a paved courtyard]1133-a paved courtyard . And it was here that [they]1949-the others had [their]1949-the others first indication that there was something odd about [this island]717-this island . In the middle of [the courtyard]571-the courtyard stood a pump , and beneath the pump a bucket . There was nothing odd about that . But the pump handle was moving up and down , though there seemed to be [no one moving it]1136-no one moving it .

“ There ’s some magic at work [here]1830-here , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Machinery ! ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace . “ [I]73-eustace do believe [we]1949-the others ’ve come to [a civilized country]1965-a civilized country at last . ”[73-eustace]

At that moment [Lucy]80-lucy , hot and breathless , rushed into [the courtyard]571-the courtyard behind [them]1949-the others . In a low voice [she]80-lucy tried to make [them]1949-the others understand what [she]80-lucy had overheard . And when [they]1949-the others had partly understood it even [the bravest of [them]1949-the others]1138-the bravest of them did not look very happy .

“ [Invisible enemies]2348-invisible enemies , ”[85-caspian] muttered [Caspian]85-caspian . “ And cutting [us]1949-the others off from [the boat]1923-the boat . This is an ugly furrow to plough . ”[85-caspian]

“ [You]79-edmund ’ve no idea what sort of creatures [they]1949-the others are , [Lu]80-lucy ? ”[79-edmund] asked [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ How can [I]85-caspian , [Ed]79-edmund , when [I]85-caspian could n’t see [them]1949-the others ? ”[85-caspian]

“ Did [they]1949-the others sound like [humans]842-humans from [their]1949-the others footsteps ? ”[85-caspian]

“ [I]85-caspian did n’t hear any noise of feet — only voices and this frightful thudding and thumping — like a mallet . ”[85-caspian]

“ [I]89-reepicheep wonder , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ do [they]1949-the others become visible when [you]89-reepicheep drive a sword into [them]1949-the others ? ”[89-reepicheep]

“ It looks as if [we]1139-we shall find out , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ But let ’s get out of this gateway . There ’s one of these gentry at that pump listening to all [we]1139-we say . ”[85-caspian]

[They]1139-we came out and went back on to the path where the trees might possibly make them less conspicuous . “ Not that it ’s any good really , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace , “ trying to hide from [people]207-people [you]73-eustace ca n’t see . [They]207-people may be all round [us]1139-we . ”[73-eustace]

“ Now , [Drinian]98-drinian , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ How would it be if [we]1139-we gave up [the boat]1923-the boat for lost , went down to [another part of [the bay]521-the bay]2353-another part of the bay , and signalled to [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader to stand in and take [us]1139-we aboard ? ”[85-caspian]

“ Not depth for [her]382-the dawn treader , [Sire]1874-sire , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ [We]1139-we could swim , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ [Your]1139-we Majesties all , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ hear [me]89-reepicheep . It is folly to think of avoiding [an invisible enemy by any amount of creeping and skulking]2357-an invisible enemy by any amount of creeping and skulking . If [these creatures]2358-these creatures mean to bring [us]1139-we to battle , be sure [they]2358-these creatures will succeed . And whatever comes of it [I]89-reepicheep ’d sooner meet [them]2358-these creatures face to face than be caught by the tail . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ [I]79-edmund really think [Reep]120-reep is in the right this time , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Surely , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , “ if [Rhince]108-rhince and [the others on the Dawn Treader]2359-the others on the dawn treader see [us]1139-we fighting on [the shore]455-the shore [they]2358-these creatures ’ll be able to do something . ”[80-lucy]

“ But [they]2358-these creatures wo n’t see [us]1139-we fighting if [they]2358-these creatures ca n’t see [any enemy]2361-any enemy , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace miserably . “ [They]2358-these creatures ’ll think [we]1139-we ’re just swinging [our]1139-we swords in the air for fun . ”[73-eustace]

There was an uncomfortable pause .

“ Well , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian at last , “ let ’s get on with it . [We]1139-we must go and face [them]2358-these creatures . Shake hands all round — arrow on the string , [Lucy]80-lucy — swords out , [everyone else]863-everyone else — and now for it . Perhaps [they]2358-these creatures ’ll parley . ”[85-caspian]

It was strange to see [the lawns]1140-the lawns and the great trees looking so peaceful as [they]1141-we marched back to [the beach]463-the beach . And when [they]1141-we arrived [there]226-there , and saw [the boat]1923-the boat lying where [they]1141-we had left [her]1145-her , and the smooth sand with [no one to be seen on it]1146-no one to be seen on it , more than one doubted whether [Lucy]80-lucy had not merely imagined all [she]80-lucy had told [them]1141-we . But before [they]1141-we reached [the sand]875-the sand , a voice spoke out of the air .

“ No further , [masters]195-masters , no further now , ”[148-chief] it said . “ [We]1141-we ’ve got to talk with [you]195-masters first . There ’s fifty of [us]1141-we and more here with weapons in [our]1141-we fists . ”[148-chief]

“ Hear [him]2364-he , hear [him]2364-he , ”[1148-the chorus] came [the chorus]1148-the chorus . “ That ’s [[our]1141-we Chief]2365-our chief . [You]195-masters can depend on what [he]2364-he says . [He]2364-he ’s telling [you]195-masters the truth , [he]2364-he is . ”[1148-the chorus]

“ [I]89-reepicheep do not see [these fifty warriors]2366-these fifty warriors , ”[89-reepicheep] observed [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep .

“ That ’s right , that ’s right , ”[148-chief] said [the Chief Voice]148-chief . “ [You]195-masters do n’t see [us]1141-we . And why not ? Because [we]1141-we ’re invisible . ”[148-chief]

“ Keep it up , [Chief]148-chief , keep it up , ”[1149-the other voices] said [the Other Voices]1149-the other voices . “ [You]195-masters ’re talking like a book . [They]1149-the other voices could n’t ask for a better answer than that . ”[1149-the other voices]

“ Be quiet , [Reep]120-reep , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , and then added in a louder voice , “ [You]195-masters [invisible people]2367-invisible people , what do [you]195-masters want with [us]1141-we ? And what have [we]1141-we done to earn [your]195-masters enmity ? ”[85-caspian]

“ [We]1141-we want something that [little girl]2368-little girl can do for [us]1141-we , ”[1150-the chief voice] said [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice . ( [The others]1949-the others explained that this was just what [they]1949-the others would have said [themselves]1949-the others . )

“ [Little girl]2368-little girl ! ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . “ [The lady]2370-the lady is [a queen]688-a queen . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ [We]1141-we do n’t know about [queens]2372-queens , ”[148-chief] said [the Chief Voice]148-chief .

( “ No more [we]1141-we do , no more [we]1141-we do , ”[1949-the others] chimed in [the others]1949-the others . ) “ But [we]1141-we want something [she]2370-the lady can do . ”[148-chief]

“ What is it ? ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ And if it is anything against [[her]2370-the lady Majesty]1952-her majesty ’s honour or safety , ”[89-reepicheep] added [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ [you]80-lucy will wonder to see how many [we]1141-we can kill before [we]1141-we die . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ Well , ”[1150-the chief voice] said [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice . “ It ’s a long story . Suppose [we]1141-we all sit down ? ”[1150-the chief voice] ,

The proposal was warmly approved by [the other voices]1149-the other voices but [the Narnians]87-the narnians remained standing .

“ Well , ”[1150-the chief voice] said [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice . “ It ’s like this . [This island]717-this island has been the property of [a great magician time out of mind]2375-a great magician time out of mind . And [we]1141-we all are — or perhaps in a manner of speaking , [I]1150-the chief voice might say , [we]1141-we were — [[his]2375-a great magician time out of mind servants]2376-his servants . Well , to cut a long story short , [this magician that [I]1150-the chief voice was speaking about]2377-this magician that i was speaking about , [he]2375-a great magician time out of mind told [us]1141-we to do something [we]1141-we did n’t like . And why not ? Because [we]1141-we did n’t want to . Well , then , [this same magician]2378-this same magician [he]2375-a great magician time out of mind fell into a great rage ; for [I]1150-the chief voice ought to tell [you]2379-you [he]2375-a great magician time out of mind owned [the island]763-the island and [he]2375-a great magician time out of mind was n’t used to being crossed . [He]2375-a great magician time out of mind was terribly downright , [you]2379-you know . But let [me]1150-the chief voice see , where am [I]1150-the chief voice ? Oh yes , [this magician]2381-this magician then , [he]2381-this magician goes [upstairs]2382-upstairs ( for [you]2379-you must know [he]2381-this magician kept all [his]2381-this magician magic things up there and [we]1141-we all lived down below ) , [I]1150-the chief voice say [he]2381-this magician goes [upstairs]2382-upstairs and puts a spell on [us]1141-we . An uglifying spell . If [you]2379-you saw [us]1141-we now , which in [my]1150-the chief voice opinion [you]2379-you may thank [your]2379-you stars [you]2379-you ca n’t , [you]2379-you would n’t believe what [we]1141-we looked like before [we]1141-we were uglified . [You]2379-you would n’t really . So there [we]1141-we all were so ugly [we]1141-we could n’t bear to look at [one another]1087-one another . So then what did [we]1141-we do ? Well , [I]1150-the chief voice ’ll tell [you]2379-you what [we]1141-we did . [We]1141-we waited till [we]1141-we thought [this same magician]2378-this same magician would be asleep in the afternoon and [we]1141-we creep [upstairs]2382-upstairs and go to [his]2378-this same magician magic book , as bold as brass , to see if [we]1141-we can do anything about this uglification . But [we]1141-we were all of a sweat and a tremble , so [I]1150-the chief voice wo n’t deceive [you]2379-you . But , believe [me]1150-the chief voice or believe [me]1150-the chief voice not , [I]1150-the chief voice do assure [you]2379-you that [we]1141-we could n’t find any thing in the way of a spell for taking off the ugliness . And what with time getting on and being afraid that [the old gentleman]2387-the old gentleman might wake up any minute — [I]1150-the chief voice was all of a muck sweat , so [I]1150-the chief voice wo n’t deceive [you]2379-you — well , to cut a long story short , whether [we]1141-we did right or whether [we]1141-we did wrong , in the end [we]1141-we see a spell for making [people]207-people invisible . And [we]1141-we thought [we]1141-we ’d rather be invisible than go on being as ugly as all that . And why ? Because [we]1141-we ’d like it better . So [[my]1150-the chief voice little girl , who ’s just about [[your]2379-you little girl]2390-your little girl ’s age]2389-my little girl , who ’s just about your little girl ’s age , and [a sweet child [she]2389-my little girl , who ’s just about your little girl ’s age was before [she]2389-my little girl , who ’s just about your little girl ’s age was uglified]2391-a sweet child she was before she was uglified , though now — but least said soonest mended — [I]1150-the chief voice say , [[my]1150-the chief voice little girl]2392-my little girl [she]2392-my little girl says the spell , for it ’s got to be [a little girl]2393-a little girl or else [the magician]2394-the magician [himself]2394-the magician , if [you]2379-you see [my]1150-the chief voice meaning , for otherwise it wo n’t work . And why not ? Because nothing happens . So [[my]1150-the chief voice [Clipsie]149-clipsie]2395-my clipsie says the spell , for [I]1150-the chief voice ought to have told [you]2379-you [she]149-clipsie reads beautifully , and there [we]2396-we all were as invisible as [you]2379-you could wish to see . And [I]1150-the chief voice do assure [you]2379-you it was a relief not to see [one another]1087-one another ’s faces . At first , anyway . But the long and the short of it is [we]2396-we ’re mortal tired of being invisible . And there ’s another thing . [We]2396-we never reckoned on [this magician]2381-this magician ( the one [I]1150-the chief voice was telling [you]2379-you about before ) going invisible too . But [we]2396-we have n’t ever seen [him]2381-this magician since . So [we]2396-we do n’t know if [he]2381-this magician ’s dead , or gone .away , or whether [he]2381-this magician ’s just sitting upstairs being invisible , and perhaps coming down and being invisible there . And , believe [me]1150-the chief voice , it ’s no manner of use listening because [he]2381-this magician always did go about with [his]2381-this magician bare feet on , making no more noise than a great big cat . And [I]1150-the chief voice ’ll tell [all [you]2114-all you gentlemen gentlemen]2114-all you gentlemen straight , it ’s getting more than what [our]2396-we nerves can stand . ”[1150-the chief voice]

Such was [the Chief Voice]148-chief ’s story , but very much shortened , because [I]0-i have left out what the Other Voices said . Actually [he]148-chief never got out more than six or seven words without being interrupted by [their]1156-their agreements and encouragements , which drove [the Narnians]87-the narnians nearly out of [their]1156-their minds with impatience . When it was over there was a very long silence .

“ But , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy at last , “ what ’s all this got to do with [us]2396-we ? [I]80-lucy do n’t understand . ”[80-lucy]

“ Why , bless [me]1150-the chief voice , if [I]1150-the chief voice have n’t gone and left out the whole point , ”[1150-the chief voice] said [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice .

“ That [you]0-i have , that [you]0-i have , ”[150-the other voices] roared [the Other Voices]150-the other voices with great enthusiasm . “ [No one]1909-no one could n’t have left it out cleaner and better . Keep it up , [Chief]148-chief , keep it up . ”[150-the other voices]

“ Well , [I]1150-the chief voice need n’t go over the whole story again , ”[1150-the chief voice] began [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice .

“ No . Certainly not , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian and [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ Well , then , to put it in a nutshell , ”[1150-the chief voice] said [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice , “ [we]2396-we ’ve been waiting for ever so long for [a nice little girl from foreign parts]2401-a nice little girl from foreign parts , like it might be [you]0-i , [Missie]151-missie — that would go [upstairs]2382-upstairs and go to the magic book and find the spell that takes off the invisibleness , and say it . And [we]2396-we all swore that [the first strangers]2403-the first strangers as landed on [this island]717-this island ( having [a nice little girl]2405-a nice little girl with [them]2403-the first strangers , [I]1150-the chief voice mean , for if [they]2403-the first strangers had n’t it ’d be another matter ) [we]2396-we would n’t let [them]2403-the first strangers go away alive unless [they]2403-the first strangers ’d done the needful for [us]2396-we . And that ’s why , [gentlemen]2117-gentlemen , if [[your]2117-gentlemen little girl]2390-your little girl does n’t come up to scratch , it will be [our]2396-we painful duty to cut all [your]2117-gentlemen throats . Merely in the way of business , as [you]2117-gentlemen might say , and no offence , [I]1150-the chief voice hope . ”[1150-the chief voice]

“ [I]89-reepicheep do n’t see all [your]2117-gentlemen weapons , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . “ Are they invisible too ? ”[89-reepicheep] The words were scarcely out of [his]89-reepicheep mouth before [they]1160-they heard a whizzing sound and next moment a spear had stuck , quivering , in one of the trees behind [them]1160-they .

“ That ’s a spear , that is , ”[1150-the chief voice] said [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice .

“ That it is , [Chief]148-chief , that it is , ”[1949-the others] said [the others]1949-the others . “ [You]148-chief could n’t have put it better . ”[1949-the others]

“ And it came from [my]1150-the chief voice hand , ”[1150-the chief voice] [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice continued . “ [They]1160-they get visible when [they]1160-they leave [us]2396-we . ”[1150-the chief voice]

“ But why do [you]148-chief want [me]80-lucy to do this ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ Why ca n’t [one of [[your]148-chief own people]2409-your own people]2408-one of your own people ? Have n’t [you]148-chief got [any girls]2410-any girls ? ”[1150-the chief voice]

“ [We]2396-we dursen’t , [we]2396-we dursen’t , ”[1164-all the voices] said [all the Voices]1164-all the voices . “ [We]2396-we ’re not going [upstairs]2382-upstairs again . ”[1164-all the voices]

“ In other words , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ [you]148-chief are asking [this lady]2412-this lady to face some danger which [you]148-chief dare n’t ask [[your]148-chief own sisters]2413-your own sisters and [daughters]2414-daughters to face ! ”[85-caspian]

“ That ’s right , that ’s right , ”[1164-all the voices] said [all the Voices]1164-all the voices cheerfully . “ [You]148-chief could n’t have said it better . Eh , [you]148-chief ’ve had some education , [you]148-chief have . [Anyone]1930-anyone can see that . ”[1164-all the voices]

“ Well , of all the outrageous — ”[79-edmund] began [Edmund]79-edmund , but [Lucy]80-lucy interrupted .

“ Would [I]1164-all the voices have to go [upstairs]2382-upstairs at night , or would it do in daylight ? ”[1164-all the voices]

“ Oh , daylight , daylight , to be sure , ”[1150-the chief voice] said [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice . “ Not at night . [No one]1909-no one ’s asking [you]1164-all the voices to do that . Go [upstairs]2382-upstairs in the dark ? Ugh . ”[1150-the chief voice]

“ All right , then , [I]80-lucy ’ll do it , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ No , ”[80-lucy] [she]80-lucy said , turning to [the others]1949-the others , “ do n’t try to stop [me]80-lucy . Ca n’t [you]1949-the others see it ’s no use ? There are dozens of [them]2419-them [there]226-there . [We]2421-we ca n’t fight [them]2419-them . And the other way there is a chance . ”[80-lucy]

“ But [a magician]2422-a magician ! ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ [I]80-lucy know , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ But [he]2422-a magician may n’t be as bad as [they]2419-them make out . Do n’t [you]1164-all the voices get the idea that [these people]2423-these people are not very brave ? ”[80-lucy]

“ [They]2423-these people ’re certainly not very clever , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ Look here , [Lu]80-lucy , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [We]2421-we really ca n’t let [you]80-lucy do a thing like this . Ask [Reep]120-reep , [I]79-edmund ’m sure [he]120-reep ’ll say just the same . ”[79-edmund]

“ But it ’s to save [my]80-lucy own life as well as [yours]2424-yours , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [I]80-lucy do n’t want to be cut to bits with invisible swords any more than [anyone else]1978-anyone else . ”[80-lucy]

“ [[Her]2426-her Majesty]1952-her majesty is in the right , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . “ If [we]2421-we had any assurance of saving [her]2426-her by battle , [our]2421-we duty would be very - plain . It appears to [me]89-reepicheep that [we]2421-we have none . And the service [they]2428-they ask of [her]2426-her is in no way contrary to [[her]2426-her Majesty]1952-her majesty ’s honour , but a noble and heroical act . If [the Queen]2223-the queen ’s heart moves [her]2426-her to risk [the magician]2394-the magician , [I]89-reepicheep will not speak against it . ”[89-reepicheep]

As [no one]1909-no one had ever known [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep to be afraid of anything , [he]89-reepicheep could say this without feeling at all awkward . But [the boys , who had all been afraid]1169-the boys , who had all been afraid quite often , grew very red . None the less , it was such obvious sense that [they]1169-the boys , who had all been afraid had to give in . Loud cheers broke from [the invisible people]1170-the invisible people when [their]1170-the invisible people decision was announced , and [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice ( warmly supported by [all the others]1924-all the others ) invited [the Narnians]87-the narnians to come to supper and spend the night . [Eustace]73-eustace did n’t want to accept , but [Lucy]80-lucy said , “ [I]80-lucy ’m sure [they]1170-the invisible people ’re not treacherous . [They]1170-the invisible people ’re not like that at all , ”[80-lucy] and [the others]1949-the others agreed . And so , accompanied by an enormous noise of thumpings ( which became louder when [they]1170-the invisible people reached [the flagged and echoing courtyard]1174-the flagged and echoing courtyard ) [they]1170-the invisible people all went back to [the house]229-the house .

[THE invisible people]1170-the invisible people feasted [[their]1170-the invisible people guests]1177-their guests royally . It was very funny to see the plates and dishes coming to the table and not to see [anyone]1930-anyone carrying [them]1179-them . It would have been funny even if [they]1170-the invisible people had moved along level with the floor , as [you]1180-you would expect things to do in invisible hands . But [they]1170-the invisible people did n’t . [They]1170-the invisible people progressed up [the long dining - hall]1181-the long dining - hall in a series of bounds or jumps . At the highest point of each jump a dish would be about fifteen feet up in the air ; then it would come down and stop quite suddenly about three feet from the floor . When the dish contained anything like soup or stew the result was rather disastrous .

“ [I]73-eustace ’m beginning to feel very inquisitive about [these people]2423-these people , ”[73-eustace] whispered [Eustace]73-eustace to [Edmund]79-edmund . “ Do [you]79-edmund think [they]2423-these people ’re human at all ? More like huge grasshoppers or giant frogs , [I]73-eustace should say . ”[73-eustace]

“ It does look like it , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ But do n’t put the idea of the grasshoppers into [Lucy]80-lucy ’s head . [She]80-lucy ’s not too keen on insects ; especially big ones . ”[79-edmund]

The meal would have been pleasanter if it had not been so exceedingly messy , and also if the conversation had not consisted entirely of agreements . [The invisible people]1170-the invisible people agreed about everything . Indeed most of [their]1170-the invisible people remarks were the sort it would not be easy to disagree with : “ What [I]1170-the invisible people always say is , when [a chap]2433-a chap ’s hungry , [he]2433-a chap likes some victuals , ”[1170-the invisible people] or “ Getting dark now ; always does at night , ”[1170-the invisible people] or even “ Ah , [you]1170-the invisible people ’ve come over [the water]1834-the water . Powerful wet stuff , ai n’t it ? ”[1170-the invisible people] And [Lucy]80-lucy could not help looking at the dark yawning entrance to the foot of the staircase — [she]80-lucy could see it from where [she]80-lucy sat — and wondering what [she]80-lucy would find when [she]80-lucy went up [those stairs]1183-those stairs next morning . But it was a good meal otherwise , with mushroom soup and boiled chickens and hot boiled ham and gooseberries , redcurrants , curds , cream , milk , and mead . [The others]1949-the others liked the mead but [Eustace]73-eustace was sorry afterwards that [he]73-eustace had drunk any .

When [Lucy]80-lucy woke up next morning it was like waking up on the day of an examination or a day when [you]1185-you are going to [the dentist]1186-the dentist . It was a lovely morning with bees buzzing in and out of [her]80-lucy open window and the lawn outside looking very like somewhere in [England]50-england . [She]80-lucy got up and dressed and tried to talk and eat ordinarily at breakfast . Then , after being instructed by [the Chief Voice]1150-the chief voice about what [she]80-lucy was to do [upstairs]2382-upstairs , [she]80-lucy bid goodbye to [the others]1949-the others , said nothing , walked to the bottom of the stairs , and began going up [them]1183-those stairs without once looking back .

It was quite light , that was one good thing . There was , indeed , a window straight ahead of [her]80-lucy at the top of [the first flight]1190-the first flight . As long as [she]80-lucy was 9n that flight [she]80-lucy could hear the tick - tock - tick - tock of a grandfather clock in [the hall below]1191-the hall below . Then [she]80-lucy came to [the landing]1192-the landing and had to turn to [her]80-lucy left up [the next flight]1193-the next flight ; after that [she]80-lucy could n’t hear the clock any more .

Now [she]80-lucy had come to the top of [the stairs]1194-the stairs . [Lucy]80-lucy looked and saw [a long , wide passage]1195-a long , wide passage with a large window at the far end . Apparently [the passage]1196-the passage ran the whole length of [the house]229-the house . [It]1196-the passage was carved and panelled and carpeted and very many doors opened off [it]1196-the passage on each side . [She]80-lucy stood still and could n’t hear the squeak of a mouse , or the buzzing of a fly , or the swaying of a curtain , or anything — except the beating of [her]80-lucy own heart .

“ The last doorway on the left , ”[80-lucy] [she]80-lucy said to [herself]80-lucy . It did seem a bit hard that it should be the last . To reach [it]1196-the passage [she]80-lucy would have to walk past [room]1198-room after [room]1198-room . And in [any room]1200-any room there might be [the magician]2394-the magician — asleep , or awake , or invisible , or even dead . But it would n’t do to think about that . [She]80-lucy set out on [her]80-lucy journey . The carpet was so thick that [her]80-lucy feet made no noise .

“ There ’s nothing whatever to be afraid of yet , ”[80-lucy] [Lucy]80-lucy told [herself]80-lucy . And certainly it was [a quiet , sunlit passage]1202-a quiet , sunlit passage ; perhaps a bit too quiet . It would have been nicer if there had not been strange signs painted in scarlet on the doors twisty , complicated things which obviously had a meaning and it might n’t be a very nice meaning either . It would have been nicer still if there were n’t those masks hanging on the wall . Not that they were exactly ugly — or not so very ugly — but the empty eye - holes did look queer , and if [you]1203-you let [yourself]1203-you [you]1203-you would soon start imagining that the masks were doing things as soon as [your]1203-you back was turned to them .

After about the sixth door [she]80-lucy got [her]80-lucy first real fright . For one second [she]80-lucy felt almost certain that a wicked little bearded face had popped out of the wall and made a grimace at [her]80-lucy . [She]80-lucy forced [herself]80-lucy to stop and look at it . And it was not a face at all . It was a little mirror just the size and shape of [her]80-lucy own face , with hair on the top of it and a beard hanging down from it , so that when [you]1203-you looked in the mirror [your]1203-you own face fitted into the hair and beard and it looked as if they belonged to [you]1203-you . “ [I]80-lucy just caught [my]80-lucy own reflection with the tail of [my]80-lucy eye as [I]80-lucy went past , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy to [herself]80-lucy . “ That was all it was . It ’s quite harmless . ”[80-lucy] But [she]80-lucy did n’t like the look of [her]80-lucy own face with that hair and beard , and went on . ( [I]0-i do n’t know what the Bearded Glass was for because [I]0-i am not [a magician]2422-a magician . )

Before [she]80-lucy reached the last door on the left , [Lucy]80-lucy was beginning to wonder whether [the corridor]1205-the corridor had grown longer since [she]80-lucy began [her]80-lucy journey and whether this was part of the magic of [the house]229-the house . But [she]80-lucy got to [it]1207-it at last . And the door was open .

It was [a large room with three big windows and [it]1207-it was lined from floor to ceiling with books ; more books than [Lucy]80-lucy had ever seen before , tiny little books , fat and dumpy books , and books bigger than any church Bible [you]1209-you have ever seen]1208-a large room with three big windows and it was lined from floor to ceiling with books ; more books than lucy had ever seen before , tiny little books , fat and dumpy books , and books bigger than any church bible you have ever seen , all bound in leather and smelling old and learned and magical . But [she]80-lucy knew from [her]80-lucy instructions that [she]80-lucy need not bother about any of these . For the Book , the Magic Book , was lying on a reading - desk in the very middle of [the room]237-the room . [She]80-lucy saw [she]80-lucy would have to read it standing ( and anyway there were no chairs ) and also that [she]80-lucy would have to stand with [her]80-lucy back to the door while [she]80-lucy read it . So at once [she]80-lucy turned to shut the door .

It would n’t shut .

[Some people]284-some people may disagree with [Lucy]80-lucy about this , but [I]0-i think [she]80-lucy was quite right . [She]80-lucy said [she]80-lucy would n’t have minded if [she]80-lucy could have shut the door , but that it was unpleasant to have to stand in a place like that with an open doorway right behind [your]1209-you back . [I]0-i should have felt just the same . But there was nothing else to be done .

One thing that worried [her]80-lucy a good deal was the size of the Book . [The Chief Voice]148-chief had not been able to give [her]80-lucy any idea whereabouts in the Book the spell for making things visible came . [He]148-chief even seemed rather surprised at [her]80-lucy asking . [He]148-chief expected [her]80-lucy to begin at the beginning and go on till [she]80-lucy came to it ; obviously [he]148-chief had never thought that there was any other way of finding a place in a book . “ But it might take [me]80-lucy days and weeks ! ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , looking at the huge volume , “ and [I]80-lucy feel already as if [I]80-lucy ’d been in [this place]1944-this place for hours . ”[80-lucy]

[She]80-lucy went up to the desk and laid [her]80-lucy hand on the book ; [her]80-lucy fingers tingled when [she]80-lucy touched it as if it were full of electricity . [She]80-lucy tried to open it but could n’t at first ; this , however , was only because it was fastened by two leaden clasps , and when [she]80-lucy had undone these it opened easily enough . And what a book it was !

It was written , not printed ; written in a clear , even hand , with thick downstrokes and thin upstrokes , very large , easier than print , and so beautiful that [Lucy]80-lucy stared at it for a whole minute and forgot about reading it . The paper was crisp and smooth and a nice smell came from it ; and in the margins , and round the big coloured capital letters at the beginning of each spell , there were pictures .

There was no title page or title ; the spells began straight away , and at first there was nothing very important in them . They were cures for warts ( by washing [your]1212-your hands in moonlight in a silver basin ) and toothache and cramp , and a spell for taking a swarm of bees . The picture of [the man with toothache]1213-the man with toothache was so lifelike that it would have set [your]1212-your own teeth aching if [you]1212-your looked at it too long , and the golden bees which were dotted all round the fourth spell looked for a moment as if they were really flying .

[Lucy]80-lucy could hardly tear [herself]80-lucy away from that first page , but when [she]80-lucy turned over , the next was just as interesting . “ But [I]80-lucy must get on , ”[80-lucy] [she]80-lucy told [herself]80-lucy . And on [she]80-lucy went for about thirty pages which , if [she]80-lucy could have remembered them , would have taught [her]80-lucy how to find buried treasure , how to remember things forgotten , how to forget things [you]1212-your wanted to forget , how to tell whether [anyone]1930-anyone was speaking the truth , how to call up ( or prevent ) wind , fog , snow , sleet or rain , how to produce enchanted sleeps and how to give [a man]1920-a man an ass ’s head ( as [they]1216-they did to [poor Bottom]152-poor bottom ) . And the longer [she]80-lucy read the more wonderful and more real the pictures became .

Then [she]80-lucy came to a page which was such a blaze of pictures that [one]256-one hardly noticed the writing . Hardly — but [she]80-lucy did notice the first words . They were , An infallible spell to make beautiful [her]1218-her that uttereth it beyond [the lot of [mortals]1220-mortals]1219-the lot of mortals . [Lucy]80-lucy peered at the pictures with [her]80-lucy face close to the page , and though they had seemed crowded and muddlesome before , [she]80-lucy found [she]80-lucy could now see them quite clearly . The first was a picture of [a girl]1945-a girl standing at a reading - desk reading in a huge book . And [the girl]1222-the girl was dressed exactly like [Lucy]80-lucy . In the next picture [Lucy]80-lucy ( for [the girl in the picture]1223-the girl in the picture was [Lucy]80-lucy [herself]80-lucy ) was standing up with [her]1223-the girl in the picture mouth open and a rather terrible expression on [her]1223-the girl in the picture face , chanting or reciting something . In the third picture the beauty beyond [the lot of mortals]1219-the lot of mortals had come to [her]80-lucy . It was strange , considering how small the pictures had looked at first , that [the Lucy in the picture]1225-the lucy in the picture now seemed quite as big as [the real Lucy]1226-the real lucy ; and [they]1227-they looked into [each other]1228-each other ’s eyes and [the real Lucy]1226-the real lucy looked away after a few minutes because [she]80-lucy was dazzled by the beauty of [the other Lucy]80-lucy ; though [she]80-lucy could still see a sort of likeness to [herself]80-lucy in that beautiful face . And now the pictures came crowding on [her]80-lucy thick and fast . [She]80-lucy saw [herself]80-lucy throned on high at a great tournament in [Calormen]32-calormen and [all the Kings of [the world]1877-the world]2314-all the kings of the world fought because of [her]80-lucy beauty . After that it turned from tournaments to real wars , and all [Narnia]2-narnia and [Archenland]34-archenland , [Telmar]51-telmar and [Calormen]32-calormen , [Galma]11-galma and [Terebinthia]12-terebinthia , were laid waste with the fury of [the kings]1232-the kings and [dukes]922-dukes and [great lords who fought for [her]80-lucy favour]1234-great lords who fought for her favour . Then it changed and [Lucy]80-lucy , still beautiful beyond [the lot of mortals]1219-the lot of mortals , was back in [England]50-england . And [Susan]78-susan ( who had always been [the beauty of [the family]217-the family]1236-the beauty of the family ) came [home]296-home from [America]1-america . [The Susan]78-susan in the picture looked exactly like the real [Susan]78-susan only plainer and with a nasty expression . And [Susan]78-susan was jealous of the dazzling beauty of [Lucy]80-lucy , but that did n’t matter a bit because [no one]1909-no one cared anything about [Susan]78-susan now .

“ [I]80-lucy will say the spell , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [I]80-lucy do n’t care . [I]80-lucy will . ”[80-lucy]

[She]80-lucy said [I]0-i do n’t care because [she]80-lucy had a strong feeling that [she]80-lucy must n’t .

But when [she]80-lucy looked back at the opening words of the spell , there in the middle of the writing , where [she]80-lucy felt quite sure there had been no picture before , [she]80-lucy found the great face of a lion , of The Lion , Aslan [himself]1240-his , staring into [hers]80-lucy . It was painted such a bright gold that it seemed to be coming towards [her]80-lucy out of the page ; and indeed [she]80-lucy never was quite sure afterwards that it had n’t really moved a little . At any rate [she]80-lucy knew the expression on [his]1240-his face quite well . [He]1240-his was growling and [you]1241-you could see most of [his]1240-his teeth . [She]80-lucy became horribly afraid and turned over the page at once .

A little later [she]80-lucy came to a spell which would let [you]1241-you know what [[your]1241-you friends]1242-your friends thought about [you]1241-you . Now [Lucy]80-lucy had wanted very badly to try the other spell , the one that made [you]1241-you beautiful beyond the lot of [mortals]1220-mortals . So [she]80-lucy felt that to make up for not having said it , [she]80-lucy really would say this one . And all in a hurry , for fear [her]80-lucy mind would change , [she]80-lucy said the words ( nothing will induce [me]0-i to tell [you]1241-you what they were ) . Then [she]80-lucy waited for something to happen .

As nothing happened [she]80-lucy began looking at the pictures . And all at once [she]80-lucy saw the very last thing [she]80-lucy expected — a picture of [a third - class carriage in a train]1244-a third - class carriage in a train , with [two schoolgirls]1245-two schoolgirls sitting in it . “ Well , [you]1241-you jolly well wo n’t have the chance any other term ! ”[80-lucy] shouted [Lucy]80-lucy . “ Two - faced little beast . ”[80-lucy] But the sound of [her]80-lucy own voice at once reminded [her]80-lucy that [she]80-lucy was talking to a picture and that the real [Marjorie]153-marjorie was far away in [another world]1247-another world .

“ Well , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy to [herself]80-lucy , “ [I]80-lucy did think better of [her]80-lucy than that . On the next page [she]80-lucy came to a spell “ for the refreshment of the spirit ’ . The pictures were fewer here but very beautiful . And what [Lucy]80-lucy found [herself]80-lucy reading was more like a story than a spell . It went on for three pages and before [she]80-lucy had read to the bottom of the page [she]80-lucy had forgotten that [she]80-lucy was reading at all . [She]80-lucy was living in the story as if it were real , and all the pictures were real too . When [she]80-lucy had got to the third page and come to the end , [she]80-lucy said , “[80-lucy] That is the loveliest story [I]0-i ’ve ever read or ever shall read in [my]0-i whole life . Oh , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could have gone on reading it for ten years . At least [I]0-i ’ll read it over again . ”[0-i]

But here part of the magic of the Book came into play . [You]1248-you could n’t turn back . The right - hand pages , the ones ahead , could be turned ; the left - hand pages could not .

“ Oh , what a shame ! ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [I]80-lucy did so want to read it again . Well , at least [I]80-lucy must remember it . Let ’s see . . . it was about . . . about . . . oh dear , it ’s all fading away again .[80-lucy]

And even this last page is going blank . This is a very queer book . How can [I]0-i have forgotten ? It was about a cup and a sword and a tree and [a green hill]1249-a green hill , [I]0-i know that much . But [I]0-i ca n’t remember and what shall [I]0-i do ? ”[0-i]

And [she]80-lucy never could remember ; and ever since that day what [Lucy]80-lucy means by a good story is a story which reminds [her]80-lucy of the forgotten story in the Magician ’s Book .

[She]80-lucy turned on and found to [her]80-lucy surprise a page with no pictures at all ; but the first words were A Spell to make hidden things visible . [She]80-lucy read it through to make sure of all the hard words and then said it out loud . And [she]80-lucy knew at once that it was working because as [she]80-lucy spoke the colours came into the capital letters at the top of the page and the pictures began appearing in the margins . It was like when [you]1248-you hold to the fire something written in Invisible Ink and the writing gradually shows up ; only instead of the dingy colour of lemon juice ( which is the easiest Invisible Ink ) this was all gold and blue and scarlet . They were odd pictures and contained many figures that [Lucy]80-lucy did not much like the look of . And then [she]80-lucy thought , “ [I]80-lucy suppose [I]80-lucy ’ve made everything visible , and not only [the Thumpers]155-the thumpers . At that moment [she]80-lucy heard soft , heavy footfalls coming along [the corridor]1205-the corridor behind [her]80-lucy ; and of course [she]80-lucy remembered what [she]80-lucy had been told about [the Magician]2394-the magician walking in [his]2394-the magician bare feet and making no more noise than a cat . It is always better to turn round than to have anything creeping up behind [your]1248-you back . [Lucy]80-lucy did so .

Then [her]80-lucy face lit up till , for a moment ( but of course [she]80-lucy did n’t know it ) , [she]80-lucy looked almost as beautiful as [that other Lucy in the picture]1252-that other lucy in the picture , and [she]80-lucy ran forward with a little cry of delight and with [her]80-lucy arms stretched out . “ It ’s lovely , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , and so it was ; an omelette , piping hot , cold lamb and green peas , a strawberry ice , lemonsquash to drink with the meal and a cup of chocolate to follow .
