There was nothing alarming about [him]2394-the magician , and [Lucy]80-lucy and [he]2394-the magician were soon chatting away like [old friends]1266-old friends .

“ When will the spell work ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy . “ Will [the Duffers]2467-the duffers be visible again at once ? ”[80-lucy]

“ Oh yes , [they]2467-the duffers ’re visible now . But [they]2467-the duffers ’re probably all asleep still ; [they]2467-the duffers always take a rest in the middle of the day . ”[2394-the magician]

“ And now that [they]2467-the duffers ’re visible , are [you]2394-the magician going to let [them]2467-the duffers off being ugly ? Will [you]2394-the magician make [them]2467-the duffers as [they]2467-the duffers were before ? ”[80-lucy]

“ Well , that ’s rather a delicate question , ”[2394-the magician] said [the Magician]2394-the magician . “ [You]80-lucy see , it ’s only [they]2467-the duffers who think [they]2467-the duffers were so nice to look at before . [They]2467-the duffers say [they]2467-the duffers ’ve been uglified , but that is n’t what [I]2394-the magician called it . [Many people]2468-many people might say the change was for the better . ”[2394-the magician]

“ Are [they]2467-the duffers awfully conceited ? ”[80-lucy]

“ [They]2467-the duffers are . Or at least [the Chief Duffer]2469-the chief duffer is , and [he]2469-the chief duffer ’s taught all the rest to be . [They]2467-the duffers always believe every word [he]2469-the chief duffer says . ”[2394-the magician]

“ [We]2470-we ’d noticed that , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ Yes — we’d get on better without [him]2469-the chief duffer , in a way . Of course [I]2394-the magician could turn [him]2469-the chief duffer into something else , or even put a spell on [him]2469-the chief duffer which would make [them]2467-the duffers not believe a word [he]2469-the chief duffer said . But [I]2394-the magician do n’t like to do that . It ’s better for [them]2467-the duffers to admire [him]2469-the chief duffer than to admire [nobody]749-nobody . ”[2394-the magician]

“ Do n’t [they]2467-the duffers admire [you]2394-the magician ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ Oh , not [me]2394-the magician , ”[2394-the magician] said [the Magician]2394-the magician . “ [They]2467-the duffers would n’t admire [me]2394-the magician . ”[2394-the magician]

“ What was it [you]2394-the magician uglified [them]2467-the duffers for — [I]2394-the magician mean , what [they]2467-the duffers call uglified ? ”[2394-the magician]

“ Well , [they]2467-the duffers would n’t do what [they]2467-the duffers were told . [Their]2467-the duffers work is to mind [the garden]2472-the garden and raise food — not for [me]2394-the magician , as [they]2467-the duffers imagine , but for [themselves]2467-the duffers . [They]2467-the duffers would n’t do it at all if [I]2394-the magician did n’t make [them]2467-the duffers . And of course for [a garden]2265-a garden [you]2474-you want water . There is [a beautiful spring about half a mile away up [the hill]1050-the hill]2475-a beautiful spring about half a mile away up the hill . And from that spring there flows a stream which comes right past [the garden]2472-the garden . All [I]2394-the magician asked [them]2467-the duffers to do was to take [their]2467-the duffers water from [the stream]1073-the stream instead of trudging up to the spring with [their]2467-the duffers buckets two or three times a day and tiring [themselves]2467-the duffers out besides spilling half of it on the way back . But [they]2467-the duffers would n’t see it . In the end [they]2467-the duffers refused point blank . ”[2394-the magician]

“ Are [they]2467-the duffers as stupid as all that ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy .

[The Magician]2394-the magician sighed . “ [You]2474-you would n’t believe the troubles [I]2394-the magician ’ve had with [them]2467-the duffers . A few months ago [they]2467-the duffers were all for washing up the plates and knives before dinner : [they]2467-the duffers said it saved time afterwards . [I]2394-the magician ’ve caught [them]2467-the duffers planting boiled potatoes to save cooking them when they were dug up . One day the cat got into [the dairy]2479-the dairy and [twenty of [them]2467-the duffers]2480-twenty of them were at work moving all the milk out ; [no one]1909-no one thought of moving the cat . But [I]2394-the magician see [you]2474-you ’ve finished . Let ’s go and look at [the Duffers]160-the duffers now [they]160-the duffers can be looked at . ”[2394-the magician]

[They]1270-they went into [another room]1271-another room which was full of polished instruments hard to understand — such as Astrolabes , [Orreries]161-orreries , Chronoscopes , Poesimeters , Choriambuses and [Theodolinds]162-theodolinds — and here , when [they]1270-they had come to the window , [the Magician]2394-the magician said , “ There . There are [your]2474-you Duffers . ”[2394-the magician]

“ [I]80-lucy do n’t see [anybody]2482-anybody , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ And what are those mushroom things ? ”[80-lucy]

The things [she]2394-the magician pointed at were dotted all over the level grass . They were certainly very like mushrooms , but far too big — the stalks about three feet high and the umbrellas about the same length from edge to edge . When [she]80-lucy looked carefully [she]80-lucy noticed too that the stalks joined the umbrellas not in the middle but at one side which gave an unbalanced look to [them]1270-they . And there was something — a sort of little bundle — lying on the grass at the foot of each stalk . In fact the longer [she]80-lucy gazed at them the less like mushrooms [they]1270-they appeared . The umbrella part was not really round as [she]80-lucy had thought at first . It was longer than it was broad , and it widened at one end . There were a great many of them , fifty or more .

The clock struck three .

Instantly a most extraordinary thing happened . [Each of the “ mushrooms ”]2483-each of the “ mushrooms ”[2483-each of the “ mushrooms ”] suddenly turned upside - down . The little bundles which had lain at the bottom of the stalks were heads and bodies . The stalks themselves were legs . But not two legs to each body . Each body had a single thick leg right under it ( not to one side like the leg of [a one - legged man]1273-a one - legged man ) and at the end of it , a single enormous foot - a broadtoed foot with the toes curling up a little so that it looked rather like a small canoe . [She]80-lucy saw in a moment why [they]1270-they had looked like mushrooms . [They]1270-they had been lying flat on [their]1270-they backs each with its single leg straight up in the air and its enormous foot spread out above it . [She]80-lucy learned afterwards that this was [their]1270-they ordinary way of resting ; for the foot kept off both rain and sun and for a Monopod to lie under [its]1274-its own foot is almost as good as being in [a tent]1275-a tent .

“ Oh , [the funnies]2484-the funnies , [the funnies]2484-the funnies , ”[80-lucy] cried [Lucy]80-lucy , bursting into laughter . “ Did [you]2394-the magician make [them]1270-they like that ? ”[80-lucy]

“ Yes , yes . [I]2394-the magician made [the Duffers]2467-the duffers into Monopods , ”[2394-the magician] said [the Magician]2394-the magician . [He]2394-the magician too was laughing till the tears ran down [his]2394-the magician cheeks . “ But watch , ”[2394-the magician] [he]2394-the magician added .

It was worth watching . Of course [these little one - footed men]1277-these little one - footed men could n’t walk or run as [we]1278-we do . [They]1277-these little one - footed men got about by jumping , like fleas or frogs . And what jumps [they]1277-these little one - footed men made ! as if each big foot were a mass of springs . And with what a bounce [they]1270-they came down ; that was what made the thumping noise which had so puzzled [Lucy]80-lucy yesterday . For now [they]1270-they were jumping in all directions and calling out to [one another]1087-one another , “ Hey , [lads]2487-lads ! [We]1270-they ’re visible again . ”[1270-they]

“ Visible [we]1270-they are , ”[1280-the chief monopod] said one in a tasselled red cap who was obviously [the Chief Monopod]1280-the chief monopod . “ And what [I]1280-the chief monopod say is , when [chaps]2488-chaps are visible , why , [they]2488-chaps can see [one another]1087-one another . ”[1280-the chief monopod]

“ Ah , there it is , there it is , [Chief]148-chief , ”[1924-all the others] cried [all the others]1924-all the others . “ There ’s the point . [No one]1909-no one ’s got a clearer head than [you]148-chief . [You]148-chief could n’t have made it plainer . ”[1924-all the others]

“ [She]2491-she caught [the old man]1264-the old man napping , [that little girl]2493-that little girl did , ”[1280-the chief monopod] said [the Chief Monopod]1280-the chief monopod . “ [We]1270-they ’ve beaten [him]1264-the old man this time . ”[1280-the chief monopod]

“ Just what [we]1270-they were , going to say [ourselves]1270-they , ”[1148-the chorus] chimed [the chorus]1148-the chorus . “ [You]148-chief ’re going stronger than ever today , [Chief]148-chief . Keep it up , keep it up . ”[1148-the chorus]

“ But do [they]2488-chaps dare to talk about [you]148-chief like that ? ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [They]2488-chaps seemed to be so afraid of [you]148-chief yesterday . Do n’t [they]2488-chaps know [you]148-chief might be listening ? ”[80-lucy]

“ That ’s one of the funny things about [the Duffers]160-the duffers , ”[2394-the magician] said [the Magician]2394-the magician . “ One minute [they]2488-chaps talk as if [I]2394-the magician ran everything and overheard everything and was extremely dangerous . The next moment [they]2488-chaps think [they]2488-chaps can take [me]2394-the magician in by tricks that [a baby]2494-a baby would see through — bless [them]2488-chaps ! ”[2394-the magician]

“ Will [they]2488-chaps have to be turned back into [their]2488-chaps proper shapes ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy . “ Oh , [I]80-lucy do hope it would n’t be unkind to leave [them]2488-chaps as [they]2488-chaps are . Do [they]2488-chaps really mind very much ? [They]2488-chaps seem pretty happy . [I]80-lucy say — look at that jump . What were [they]2488-chaps like before ? ”[80-lucy]

“ [Common little dwarfs]2495-common little dwarfs , ”[2394-the magician] said [he]2394-the magician . “ Nothing like so nice as the sort [you]80-lucy have in [Narnia]2-narnia . ”[2394-the magician]

“ It would be a pity to change [them]2488-chaps back , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [They]2488-chaps ’re so funny : and [they]2488-chaps ’re rather nice . Do [you]80-lucy think it would make any difference if [I]80-lucy told [them]2488-chaps that ? ”[80-lucy]

“ [I]2394-the magician ’m sure it would — if [you]80-lucy could get it into [their]2488-chaps heads . ”[2394-the magician]

“ Will [you]80-lucy come with [me]80-lucy and try ? ”[80-lucy]

“ No , no . [You]80-lucy ’ll get on far better without [me]2394-the magician . ”[2394-the magician]

“ Thanks awfully for the lunch , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy and turned quickly away . [She]80-lucy ran down the stairs which [she]80-lucy had come up so nervously that morning and cannoned into [Edmund]79-edmund at the bottom . [All the others]1924-all the others were there with [him]79-edmund waiting , and [Lucy]80-lucy ’s conscience smote [her]80-lucy when [she]80-lucy saw [their]1924-all the others anxious faces and realized how long [she]80-lucy had forgotten [them]1924-all the others .

“ It ’s all right , ”[80-lucy] [she]80-lucy shouted . “ Everything ’s all right . [The Magician]163-the magician ’s a brick — and [I]80-lucy ’ve seen [Him]79-edmund — [Aslan]91-aslan . ”[80-lucy]

After that [she]80-lucy went from [them]1924-all the others like the wind and out into [the garden]2472-the garden . Here [the earth]1287-the earth was shaking with the jumps and the air ringing with the shouts of [the Monopods]164-the monopods . [Both]1288-both were redoubled when [they]1924-all the others caught sight of [her]80-lucy .

“ Here [she]80-lucy comes , here [she]80-lucy comes , ”[1924-all the others] [they]1924-all the others cried . “ Three cheers for [the little girl]2496-the little girl . Ah ! [She]80-lucy put it across [the old gentleman]2387-the old gentleman properly , [she]80-lucy did . ”[1924-all the others]

“ And [we]2498-we ’re extremely regrettable , ”[1280-the chief monopod] said [the Chief Monopod]1280-the chief monopod , “ that [we]2498-we ca n’t give [you]2499-you the pleasure of seeing [us]2498-we as [we]2498-we were before [we]2498-we were uglified , for [you]2499-you would n’t believe the difference , and that ’s the truth , for there ’s no denying [we]2498-we ’re mortal ugly now , so [we]2498-we wo n’t deceive [you]2499-you . ”[1280-the chief monopod]

“ Eh , that [we]2498-we are , [Chief]2339-chief , that [we]2498-we are , ”[1949-the others] echoed [the others]1949-the others , bouncing like so many toy balloons . “ [You]2339-chief ’ve said it , [you]2339-chief ’ve said it . ”[1949-the others]

“ But [I]80-lucy do n’t think [you]2339-chief are at all , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , shouting to make [herself]80-lucy heard . “ [I]80-lucy think [you]2339-chief look very nice . ”[80-lucy]

“ Hear [her]2501-she , hear [her]2501-she , ”[164-the monopods] said [the Monopods]164-the monopods . “ True for [you]2499-you , [Missie]151-missie . Very nice [we]2498-we look . [You]2499-you could n’t find [a handsomer lot]2502-a handsomer lot . ”[164-the monopods] [They]1949-the others said this without any surprise and did not seem to notice that [they]1949-the others had changed [their]1949-the others minds .

“ [She]2501-she ’s a - saying , ”[1280-the chief monopod] remarked [the Chief Monopod]1280-the chief monopod , “ as how [we]2498-we looked very nice before [we]2498-we were uglified . ”[1280-the chief monopod]

“ True for [you]2339-chief , [Chief]148-chief , true for [you]2339-chief , ”[1949-the others] chanted [the others]1949-the others . “ That ’s what [she]2501-she says . [We]2498-we heard [her]2501-she [ourselves]2498-we . ”[1949-the others]

“ [I]80-lucy did not , ”[80-lucy] bawled [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [I]80-lucy said [you]2339-chief ’re very nice now . ”[80-lucy]

“ So [she]2501-she did , so [she]2501-she did , ”[165-the chief monopod] said [the Chief Monopod]165-the chief monopod , “ said [we]2498-we were very nice then . ”[165-the chief monopod]

“ Hear ’em both , hear ’em both , ”[164-the monopods] said [the Monopods]164-the monopods . “ There ’s a pair for [you]2339-chief . Always right . [They]164-the monopods could n’t have put it better . ”[164-the monopods]

“ But [we]2498-we ’re saying just the opposite , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , stamping [her]80-lucy foot with impatience .

“ So [you]2339-chief are , to be sure , so [you]2339-chief are , ”[164-the monopods] said [the Monopods]164-the monopods . “ Nothing like an opposite . Keep it up , both of [you]2339-chief . ”[164-the monopods]

“ [You]164-the monopods ’re enough to drive [anyone]1930-anyone mad , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , and gave it up . But [the Monopods]164-the monopods seemed perfectly contented , and [she]80-lucy decided that on the whole the conversation had been a success .

And before [everyone]251-everyone went to bed that evening something else happened which made [them]251-everyone even more satisfied with [their]251-everyone one - legged condition . [Caspian]85-caspian and [all the Narnians]1294-all the narnians went back as soon as possible to [the shore]455-the shore to give [their]251-everyone news to [Rhince]108-rhince and the others on board the Dawn Treader , who were by now very anxious . And , of course , [the Monopods]164-the monopods went with [them]251-everyone , bouncing like footballs and agreeing with [one another]1087-one another in loud voices till [Eustace]73-eustace said , “ [I]73-eustace wish [the Magician]2394-the magician would make [them]164-the monopods inaudible instead of invisible . ”[73-eustace] ( [He]73-eustace was soon sorry [he]73-eustace had spoken because then [he]73-eustace had to explain that an inaudible thing is something [you]1297-you ca n’t hear , and though [he]73-eustace took a lot of trouble [he]73-eustace never felt sure that [the Monopods]164-the monopods had really understood , and what especially annoyed [him]73-eustace was that [they]164-the monopods said in the end , “ Eh , [he]2394-the magician ca n’t put things the way [[our]164-the monopods Chief]2365-our chief does . But [you]1297-you ’ll learn , [young man]2506-young man . Hark to [him]2394-the magician . [He]2394-the magician ’ll show [you]1297-you how to say things . There ’s a speaker for [you]1297-you ! ”[164-the monopods] ) When [they]164-the monopods reached [the bay]521-the bay , [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep had a brilliant idea . [He]89-reepicheep had [his]89-reepicheep little coracle lowered and paddled [himself]89-reepicheep about in it till [the Monopods]164-the monopods were thoroughly interested . [He]89-reepicheep then stood up in it and said , “ [Worthy and intelligent Monopods]2507-worthy and intelligent monopods , [you]1297-you do not need [boats]2508-boats . Each of [you]1297-you has a foot that will do instead . Just jump as lightly as [you]1297-you can on the water and see what happens . ”[89-reepicheep]

[The Chief Monopod]165-the chief monopod hung back and warned [the others]1949-the others that [they]1949-the others ’d find the water powerful wet , but [one or two of [the younger ones]1301-the younger ones]1300-one or two of the younger ones tried it almost at once ; and then [a few others]611-a few others followed [their]164-the monopods example , and at last [the whole lot]1303-the whole lot did the same . It worked perfectly . The huge single foot of a Monopod acted as [a natural raft or boat]1304-a natural raft or boat , and when [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep had taught [them]1949-the others how to cut rude paddles for [themselves]1949-the others , [they]1949-the others all paddled about [the bay]521-the bay and round [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader , looking for [all the world]1307-all the world like a fleet of little canoes with [a fat dwarf standing up in the extreme stern of each]1308-a fat dwarf standing up in the extreme stern of each . And [they]1949-the others had races , and bottles of wine were lowered down to [them]1949-the others from [the ship]234-the ship as prizes , and [the sailors]275-the sailors stood leaning over [the ship]234-the ship ’s sides and laughed till [their]275-the sailors own sides ached .

[The Duffers]160-the duffers were also very pleased with [their]160-the duffers new name of [Monopods]164-the monopods , which seemed to [them]160-the duffers a magnificent name though [they]160-the duffers never got it right . “ That ’s what [we]160-the duffers are , ”[160-the duffers] [they]160-the duffers bellowed , “ [Moneypuds]166-moneypuds , [Pomonods]167-pomonods , [Poddymons]2509-poddymons . Just what it was on the tips of [our]160-the duffers tongues to call [ourselves]160-the duffers . ”[160-the duffers] But [they]160-the duffers soon got it mixed up with [their]160-the duffers old name of [Duffers]160-the duffers and finally settled down to calling [themselves]160-the duffers [the Dufflepuds]1312-the dufflepuds ; and that is what [they]160-the duffers will probably be called for centuries .

That evening all [the Narnians]87-the narnians dined [upstairs]2382-upstairs with [the Magician]2394-the magician , and [Lucy]80-lucy noticed how different [the whole top floor]1315-the whole top floor looked now that [she]80-lucy was no longer afraid of it . The mysterious signs on the doors were still mysterious but now looked as if they had kind and cheerful meanings , and even the bearded mirror now seemed funny rather than frightening . At dinner [everyone]251-everyone had by magic what [everyone]251-everyone liked best to eat and drink , and after dinner [the Magician]2394-the magician did a very useful and beautiful piece of magic . [He]2394-the magician laid two blank sheets of parchment on the table and asked [Drinian]98-drinian to give [him]2394-the magician an exact account of [their]160-the duffers voyage up to date : and as [Drinian]98-drinian spoke , everything [he]98-drinian described came out on the parchment in fine clear lines till at last each sheet was a splendid map of [the Eastern Ocean]52-the eastern ocean , showing [Galma]11-galma , [Terebinthia]12-terebinthia , [the Seven Isles]1319-the seven isles , [the Lone Islands]1908-the lone islands , [Dragon Island]38-dragon island , [Burnt Island]42-burnt island , [Deathwater]48-deathwater , and [the land of the Duffers itself]1321-the land of the duffers itself , all exactly the right sizes and in the right positions . They were the first maps ever made of [those seas]1322-those seas and better than any that have been made since without magic . For on these , though [the towns]1323-the towns and [mountains]1324-mountains looked at first just as they would on an ordinary map , when [the Magician]2394-the magician lent [them]160-the duffers a magnifying glass [you]1326-you saw that they were perfect little pictures of the real things , so that [you]1326-you could see [the very castle]1327-the very castle and [slave market]1328-slave market and [streets in Narrowhaven]1329-streets in narrowhaven , all very clear though very distant , like things seen through the wrong end of a telescope . The only drawback was that the coastline of [most of [the islands]480-the islands]1330-most of the islands was incomplete , for the map showed only what [Drinianhad]168-drinianhad seen with [his]168-drinianhad own eyes . When [they]1332-they were finished [the . Magician]1333-the . magician kept one [himself]2394-the magician and presented the other to [Caspian]85-caspian : it still hangs in [[his]2394-the magician Chamber of Instruments at [Cair Paravel]28-cair paravel]1334-his chamber of instruments at cair paravel . But [the Magician]163-the magician could tell [them]1332-they nothing about seas or [lands further east]1335-lands further east . [He]2394-the magician did , however , tell [them]1332-they that about seven years before [a Narnian ship]1827-a narnian ship had put in at [[his]2394-the magician waters]1337-his waters and that [she]1827-a narnian ship had on board [the lords Revilian , [Argoz]128-argoz , [Mavramorn]102-the lord mavramorn and [Rhoop]105-rhoop]1338-the lords revilian , argoz , mavramorn and rhoop : so [they]1332-they judged that [the golden man [they]1332-they had seen lying in [Deathwater]48-deathwater]1339-the golden man they had seen lying in deathwater must be [the Lord Restimar]104-the lord restimar .

Next day , [the Magician]2394-the magician magically mended the stern of [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader where [it]109-the dawn treader had been damaged by [the Sear Serpent]55-the sear serpent and loaded [her]1827-a narnian ship with useful gifts . There was a most friendly parting , and when [she]1827-a narnian ship sailed , two hours after noon , [all the Dufflepuds]1341-all the dufflepuds paddled out with [her]1827-a narnian ship to [the harbour mouth]1342-the harbour mouth , and cheered until [she]1827-a narnian ship was out of sound of [their]1332-they cheering .

AFTER this adventure [they]1332-they sailed on [south and a little east]1343-south and a little east for twelve days with a gentle wind , the skies being mostly clear and the air warm , and saw no bird or fish , except that once there were whales spouting a long way to starboard . [Lucy]80-lucy and [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep played a good deal of chess at this time . Then on the thirteenth day , [Edmund]79-edmund , from the fighting top , sighted what looked like a great dark mountain rising out of [the sea]250-the sea on [their]1332-they port bow .

[They]1332-they altered course and made for [this land]2316-this land , mostly by oar , for the wind would not serve [them]1332-they to sail north - east . When evening fell [they]1332-they were still a long way from [it]2316-this land and rowed all night . Next morning the weather was fair but a flat calm . The dark mass lay ahead , much nearer and larger , but still very dim , so that some thought it was still a long way off and [others]2187-others thought [they]1332-they were running into a mist .

About nine that morning , very suddenly , it was so close that [they]1332-they could see that it was not [land]395-land at all , nor even , in an ordinary sense , a mist . It was a Darkness . It is rather hard to describe , but [you]1348-you will see what it was like if [you]1348-you imagine [yourself]1348-you looking into the mouth of [a railway tunnel]1349-a railway tunnel — [a tunnel]1350-a tunnel either so long or so twisty that [you]1348-you can not see the light at the far end . And [you]1348-you know what it would be like . For a few feet [you]1348-you would see the rails and sleepers and gravel in broad daylight ; then there would come a place where [they]1332-they were in twilight ; and then , pretty suddenly , but of course without a sharp dividing line , [they]1332-they would vanish altogether into smooth , solid blackness . It was just so here . For a few feet in front of [their]1332-they bows [they]1332-they could see the swell of the bright greenish - blue water . Beyond that , [they]1332-they could see the water looking pale and grey as it would look late in the evening . But beyond that again , utter blackness as if [they]1332-they had come to the edge of moonless and starless night .

[Caspian]85-caspian shouted to [the boatswain]341-the boatswain to keep [her]341-the boatswain back , and all except [the rowers]319-the rowers rushed forward and gazed from the bows . But there was nothing to be seen by gazing . Behind [them]1332-they was [the sea]250-the sea and the sun , before [them]1332-they the Darkness .

“ Do [we]1332-they go into this ? ”[85-caspian] asked [Caspian]85-caspian at length .

“ Not by [my]98-drinian advice , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ [The Captain]1889-the captain ’s right , ”[1354-several sailors] said [several sailors]1354-several sailors .

“ [I]79-edmund almost think [he]1889-the captain is , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund .

[Lucy]80-lucy and [Eustace]73-eustace did n’t speak but [they]1332-they felt very glad inside at the turn things seemed to be taking . But all at once the clear voice of [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep broke in upon the silence .

“ And why not ? ”[89-reepicheep] [he]89-reepicheep said . “ Will [someone]2007-someone explain to [me]89-reepicheep why not . ”[89-reepicheep]

[No one]1909-no one was anxious to explain , so [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep continued :

“ If [I]89-reepicheep were addressing [peasants]2512-peasants or [slaves]315-slaves , ”[89-reepicheep] [he]89-reepicheep said , “ [I]89-reepicheep might suppose that this suggestion proceeded from cowardice . But [I]89-reepicheep hope it will never be told in [Narnia]2-narnia that [a company of noble and royal persons in the flower of [their]2514-a company of noble and royal persons in the flower of their age age]2514-a company of noble and royal persons in the flower of their age turned tail because [they]2514-a company of noble and royal persons in the flower of their age were afraid of the dark . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ But what manner of use would it be ploughing through that blackness ? ”[98-drinian] asked [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ Use ? ”[89-reepicheep] replied [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . “ Use , [Captain]2061-captain ? If by use [you]2061-captain mean filling [our]2516-we bellies or [our]2516-we purses , [I]89-reepicheep confess it will be no use at all . So far as [I]89-reepicheep know [we]2516-we did not set sail to look for things useful but to seek honour and adventure . And here is as great an adventure as ever [I]89-reepicheep heard of , and here , if [we]2516-we turn back , no tittle impeachment of all [our]2516-we honours . ”[89-reepicheep]

[Several of [the sailors]275-the sailors]1356-several of the sailors said things under [their]1356-several of the sailors breath that sounded like “ Honour be blowed ”[1356-several of the sailors] , but [Caspian]85-caspian said :

“ Oh , bother [you]2061-captain , [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . [I]85-caspian almost wish [we]2516-we ’d left [you]2061-captain at [home]296-home . All right ! If [you]2061-captain put it that way , [I]85-caspian suppose [we]2516-we shall have to go on . Unless [Lucy]80-lucy would rather not ? ”[85-caspian]

[Lucy]80-lucy felt that [she]80-lucy would very much rather not , but what [she]80-lucy said out loud was , “ [I]80-lucy ’m game . ”[80-lucy]

“ [[Your]2061-captain Majesty]1838-your majesty will at least order lights ? ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ By all means , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ See to it , [Captain]2061-captain . ”[85-caspian]

So the three lanterns , at the stern , and the prow and the masthead , were all lit , and [Drinian]98-drinian ordered two torches amidships . Pale and feeble [they]1358-they looked in the sunshine . Then all [the men]2173-the men except [some who were left below at the oars]1360-some who were left below at the oars were ordered on deck and fully armed and posted in [their]1360-some who were left below at the oars battle stations with swords drawn . [Lucy]80-lucy and [two archers]1361-two archers were posted on the fighting top with bows bent and arrows on the string . [Rynelf]86-rynelf was in the bows with [his]1362-his line ready to take soundings . [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , [Edmund]79-edmund , [Eustace]73-eustace and [Caspian]85-caspian , glittering in mail , were with [him]1362-his . [Drinian]98-drinian took the tiller .

“ And now , in [Aslan]91-aslan ’s name , forward ! ”[85-caspian] cried [Caspian]85-caspian . “ A slow , steady stroke . And let [every man]542-every man be silent and keep [his]542-every man ears open for orders . ”[85-caspian]

With a creak and a groan [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader started to creep forward as [the men]2173-the men began to row . [Lucy]80-lucy , up in the fighting top , had a wonderful view of the exact moment at which [they]2173-the men entered the darkness . The bows had already disappeared before the sunlight had left the stern . [She]80-lucy saw it go . At one minute the gilded stern , [the blue sea]1365-the blue sea , and the sky , were all in broad daylight : next minute [the sea]250-the sea and sky had vanished , the stern lantern — which had been hardly noticeable before — was the only thing to show where [the ship]234-the ship ended . In front of the lantern [she]80-lucy could see the black shape of [Drinian]98-drinian crouching at the tiller . Down below [her]80-lucy the two torches made visible two small patches of deck and gleamed on swords and helmets , and forward there was another island of light on [the forecastle]336-the forecastle . Apart from that , [the fighting top]1369-the fighting top , lit by the masthead light which was only just above [her]80-lucy , seemed to be a little lighted world of its own floating in lonely darkness . And the lights themselves , as always happens with lights when [you]1370-you have to have them at the wrong time of day , looked lurid and unnatural . [She]80-lucy also noticed that [she]80-lucy was very cold .

How long this voyage into the darkness lasted , [nobody]749-nobody knew . Except for the creak of the rowlocks and the splash of the oars there was nothing to show that [they]2173-the men were moving at all . [Edmund]79-edmund , peering from the bows , could see nothing except the reflection of the lantern in [the water before [him]79-edmund]1372-the water before him . It looked a greasy sort of reflection , and the ripple made by [their]2173-the men advancing prow appeared to be heavy , small , and lifeless . As time went on [everyone except the rowers]1373-everyone except the rowers began to shiver with cold .

Suddenly , from somewhere — [no one]1909-no one ’s sense of direction was very clear by now — there came a cry , either of some inhuman voice or else a voice of one in such extremity of terror that [he]79-edmund had almost lost [his]79-edmund humanity .

[Caspian]85-caspian was still trying to speak — [his]85-caspian mouth was too dry — when the shrill voice of [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , which sounded louder than usual in that silence , was heard .

“ Who calls ? ”[2007-someone] it piped . “ If [you]1370-you are [a foe]2521-a foe [we]2522-we do not fear [you]1370-you , and if [you]1370-you are [a friend]2523-a friend [[your]1370-you enemies]2524-your enemies shall be taught the fear of [us]2522-we . ”[2007-someone]

“ [Mercy]169-mercy ! ”[89-reepicheep] cried the voice . “ [Mercy]169-mercy ! Even if [you]1370-you are only one more dream , have merry . Take [me]89-reepicheep on board . Take [me]89-reepicheep , even if [you]1370-you strike [me]89-reepicheep dead . But in the name of all mercies do not fade away and leave [me]89-reepicheep in [this horrible land]2525-this horrible land . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ Where are [you]85-caspian ? ”[85-caspian] shouted [Caspian]85-caspian . “ Come aboard and welcome . ”[85-caspian]

There came another cry , whether of joy or terror , and then [they]1375-they knew that [someone]2007-someone was swimming towards [them]1375-they .

“ Stand by to heave [him]1382-the stranger on board up , [men]694-men , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Aye , aye , [[your]79-edmund Majesty]1838-your majesty , ”[275-the sailors] said [the sailors]275-the sailors . Several crowded to [the port bulwark]1378-the port bulwark with ropes and [one , leaning far out over the side]1379-one , leaning far out over the side , held the torch . A wild , white face appeared in the blackness of [the water]1834-the water , and then , after some scrambling and pulling , [a dozen friendly hands]1381-a dozen friendly hands had heaved [the stranger on board]1382-the stranger on board .

[Edmund]79-edmund thought [he]79-edmund had never seen [a wilder - looking man]1383-a wilder - looking man . Though [he]1383-a wilder - looking man did not otherwise look very old , [his]1383-a wilder - looking man hair was an untidy mop of white , [his]1383-a wilder - looking man face was thin and drawn , and , for clothing , only a few wet rags hung about [him]1383-a wilder - looking man . But what [one]256-one mainly noticed were [his]1383-a wilder - looking man eyes , which were so widely opened that [he]1383-a wilder - looking man seemed to have no eyelids at all , and stared as if in an agony of pure fear . The moment [his]1383-a wilder - looking man feet reached [the deck]255-the deck [he]1383-a wilder - looking man said :

“ Fly ! Fly ! About with [[your]261-the stranger ship]2528-your ship and fly ! Row , row , row for [your]261-the stranger lives away from [this accursed shore]2529-this accursed shore . ”[1383-a wilder - looking man]

“ Compose [yourself]89-reepicheep , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ and tell [us]2530-we what the danger is . [We]2530-we are not used to flying . ”[89-reepicheep]

[The stranger]261-the stranger started horribly at the voice of [the Mouse]89-reepicheep , which [he]261-the stranger had not noticed before .

“ Nevertheless [you]89-reepicheep will fly from here , ”[261-the stranger] [he]261-the stranger gasped . “ This is [the Island where Dreams come true]2531-the island where dreams come true . ”[261-the stranger]

“ That ’s [the island [I]274-one of the sailors ’ve been looking for this long time]2532-the island i ’ve been looking for this long time , ”[274-one of the sailors] said [one of [the sailors]275-the sailors]274-one of the sailors . “ [I]274-one of the sailors reckoned [I]274-one of the sailors ’d find [I]274-one of the sailors was married to [Nancy]154-anne featherstone if [we]2530-we landed [here]1830-here . ”[274-one of the sailors]

“ And [I]1389-another ’d find [Tom]170-tom alive again , ”[1389-another] said [another]1389-another .

“ [Fools]2534-fools ! ”[438-the man] said [the man]438-the man , stamping [his]438-the man foot with rage . “ That is the sort of talk that brought [me]438-the man here , and [I]438-the man ’d better have been drowned or never born . Do [you]2535-you hear what [I]438-the man say ? This is where dreams — dreams , do [you]2535-you understand , come to life , come real . Not daydreams : dreams . ”[438-the man]

There was about half a minute ’s silence and then , with a great clatter of armour , [the whole crew]1391-the whole crew were tumbling down the main hatch as quick as [they]1391-the whole crew could and flinging [themselves]1391-the whole crew on the oars to row as [they]1391-the whole crew had never rowed before ; and [Drinian]98-drinian was swinging round the tiller , and [the boatswain]341-the boatswain was giving out the quickest stroke that had ever been heard at [sea]1854-sea . For it had taken [everyone just that halfminute]1394-everyone just that halfminute to remember certain dreams [they]1394-everyone just that halfminute had had — dreams that make [you]1395-you afraid of going to sleep again — and to realize what it would mean to land on [a country where dreams come true]1396-a country where dreams come true .

Only [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep remained unmoved .

“ [[Your]1395-you Majesty]1838-your majesty , [[your]1395-you Majesty]1838-your majesty , ”[89-reepicheep] [he]89-reepicheep said , “ are [you]1395-you going to tolerate this mutiny , [this poltroonery]2538-this poltroonery ? This is a panic , this is a rout . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ Row , row , ”[85-caspian] bellowed [Caspian]85-caspian . “ Pull for all [our]2539-our lives . Is [her]80-lucy head right , [Drinian]98-drinian ? [You]98-drinian can say what [you]98-drinian like , [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . There are some things [no man]2540-no man can face . ”[85-caspian]

“ It is , then , [my]89-reepicheep good fortune not to be [a man]1920-a man , ”[89-reepicheep] replied [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep with a very stiff bow .

[Lucy]80-lucy from up aloft had heard it all . In an instant that one of [her]80-lucy own dreams which [she]80-lucy had tried hardest to forget came back to [her]80-lucy as vividly as if [she]80-lucy had only just woken from it . So that was what was behind [them]1397-them , on [the island]763-the island , in the darkness ! For a second [she]80-lucy wanted to go down to [the deck]255-the deck and be with [Edmund]79-edmund and [Caspian]85-caspian . But what was the use ? If dreams began coming true , [Edmund]79-edmund and [Caspian]85-caspian [themselves]1397-them might turn into something horrible just as [she]80-lucy reached [them]1397-them . [She]80-lucy gripped the rail of the fighting top and tried to steady [herself]80-lucy . [They]1397-them were rowing back to the light as hard as [they]1397-them could : it would be all right in a few seconds . But oh , if only it could be all right now !

Though the rowing made a good deal of noise it did not quite conceal the total silence which surrounded [the ship]234-the ship .

[Everyone]251-everyone knew it would be better not to listen , not to strain [his]251-everyone ears for any sound from the darkness . But [no one]1909-no one could help listening . And soon [everyone]251-everyone was hearing things . [Each one]1404-each one heard something different .

“ Do [you]86-rynelf hear a noise like . . . like a huge pair of scissors opening and shutting .. . over there ? ”[73-eustace] [Eustace]73-eustace asked [Rynelf]86-rynelf .

“ Hush ! ”[86-rynelf] said [Rynelf]86-rynelf . “ [I]86-rynelf can hear [them]1397-them crawling up the sides of [the ship]234-the ship . ”[86-rynelf]

“ It ’s just going to settle on the mast , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Ugh ! ”[1405-a sailor] said [a sailor]1405-a sailor . “ There are the gongs beginning . [I]1405-a sailor knew they would . ”[1405-a sailor]

[Caspian]85-caspian , trying not to look at anything ( especially not to keep looking behind [him]85-caspian ) , went aft to [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ [Drinian]98-drinian , ”[85-caspian] [he]85-caspian said in a very low voice . “ How long did [we]2543-we take rowing in?—I mean rowing to where [we]2543-we picked up . [the stranger]261-the stranger . ”[85-caspian]

“ Five minutes , perhaps , ”[98-drinian] whispered [Drinian]98-drinian . “ Why ? ”[98-drinian]

“ Because [we]2543-we ’ve been more than that already trying to get out . ”[85-caspian]

[Drinian]98-drinian ’s hand shook on the tiller and a line of cold sweat ran down [his]98-drinian face . The same idea was occurring to [everyone on board]390-everyone on board . “ [We]2543-we shall never get out , never get ’ out , ”[319-the rowers] moaned [the rowers]319-the rowers . “ [He]98-drinian ’s steering [us]2543-we wrong . [We]2543-we ’re going round and round in circles . [We]2543-we shall never get out . ”[319-the rowers] [The stranger , who had been lying in a huddled heap on the deck]1408-the stranger , who had been lying in a huddled heap on the deck , sat up and burst out into a horrible screaming laugh .

“ Never get out ! ”[1408-the stranger , who had been lying in a huddled heap on the deck] [he]1408-the stranger , who had been lying in a huddled heap on the deck yelled . “ That ’s it . Of course . [We]2543-we shall never get out . What [a fool]247-a fool [I]1408-the stranger , who had been lying in a huddled heap on the deck was to have thought [they]2546-they would let [me]1408-the stranger , who had been lying in a huddled heap on the deck go as easily as that . No , no , [we]2543-we shall never get out . ”[1408-the stranger , who had been lying in a huddled heap on the deck]

[Lucy]80-lucy leant [her]80-lucy head on the edge of the fighting top and whispered , “ [Aslan]91-aslan , [Aslan]91-aslan , if ever [you]91-aslan loved [us]2543-we at all , send [us]2543-we help now . ”[80-lucy] The darkness did not grow any less , but [she]80-lucy began to feel a little — a very , very little — better . “ After all , nothing has really happened to [us]2543-we yet , ”[80-lucy] [she]80-lucy thought .

“ Look ! ”[86-rynelf] cried [Rynelf]86-rynelf ’s voice hoarsely from the bows . There was a tiny speck of light ahead , and while [they]1409-they watched a broad beam of light fell from it upon [the ship]234-the ship . It did not alter the surrounding darkness , but [the whole ship]2192-the whole ship was lit up as if by searchlight . [Caspian]85-caspian blinked , stared round , saw the faces of [[his]85-caspian companions]443-his companions all with wild , fixed expressions . [Everyone]251-everyone was staring in the same direction : behind [everyone]251-everyone lay [his]85-caspian black , sharply - edged shadow .

[Lucy]80-lucy looked along the beam and presently saw something in it . At first it looked like a cross , then it looked like an aeroplane , then it looked like a kite , and at last with a whirring of wings it was right overhead and was an albatross . It circled three times round the mast and then perched for an instant on the crest of the gilded dragon at the prow . It called out in a strong sweet voice what seemed to be words though [no one]1909-no one understood them . After that it spread its wings , rose , and began to fly slowly ahead , bearing a little to starboard . [Drinian]98-drinian steered after [it]234-the ship not doubting that it offered good guidance . But [no one]1909-no one except [Lucy]80-lucy knew that as it circled the mast it had whispered to [her]80-lucy , “ Courage , dear heart , ”[91-aslan] and the voice , [she]80-lucy felt sure , was [Aslan]91-aslan ’s , and with the voice a delicious smell breathed in [her]80-lucy face .

In a few moments the darkness turned into a greyness ahead , and then , almost before [they]1409-they dared to begin hoping , [they]1409-they had shot out into the sunlight and were in [the warm , blue world]1417-the warm , blue world again . And all at once [everybody]1418-everybody realized that there was nothing to be afraid of and never had been . [They]1418-everybody blinked [their]1418-everybody eyes and looked about [them]1418-everybody . The brightness of [the ship]234-the ship herself astonished [them]1418-everybody : [they]1418-everybody had half expected to find that the darkness would cling to the white and the green and the gold in the form of some grime or scum . And then [first one]1420-first one , and then another , began laughing .

“ [I]86-rynelf reckon [we]1409-they ’ve made pretty good fools of [ourselves]1409-they , ”[86-rynelf] said [Rynelf]86-rynelf .

[Lucy]80-lucy lost no time in coming down to [the deck]255-the deck , where [she]80-lucy found [the others all gathered round [the newcomer]1423-the newcomer]1422-the others all gathered round the newcomer . For a long time [he]1423-the newcomer was too happy to speak , and could only gaze at [the sea]250-the sea and the sun and feel the bulwarks and the ropes , as if to make sure [he]1423-the newcomer was really awake , while tears rolled down [his]1423-the newcomer cheeks .

“ Thank [you]80-lucy , ”[1423-the newcomer] [he]1423-the newcomer said at last . “ [You]80-lucy have saved [me]1423-the newcomer from . . . but [I]1423-the newcomer wo n’t talk of that . And now let [me]1423-the newcomer know who [you]80-lucy are . [I]1423-the newcomer am [a Telmarine of [Narnia]2-narnia]2547-a telmarine of narnia , and when [I]1423-the newcomer was worth anything [men]694-men called [me]1423-the newcomer [the Lord Rhoop]105-rhoop . ”[1423-the newcomer]

“ And [I]85-caspian , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ am [Caspian]85-caspian , [King of [Narnia]2-narnia]962-king of narnia , and [I]85-caspian sail to find [you]80-lucy and [[your]80-lucy companions who were [[my]85-caspian father]1867-my father ’s friends]2550-your companions who were my father ’s friends . ”[85-caspian]

[Lord Rhoop]105-rhoop fell on [his]105-rhoop knees and kissed [the King]305-the king ’s hand . “ [Sire]116-sire , ”[85-caspian] [he]85-caspian said , “ [you]80-lucy are [the man in all [the world]1877-the world [I]85-caspian most wished to see]2552-the man in all the world i most wished to see . Grant [me]85-caspian a boon . ”[85-caspian]

“ What is it ? ”[85-caspian] asked [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Never to bring [me]85-caspian back [there]226-there , ”[85-caspian] [he]85-caspian said . [He]85-caspian pointed astern . [They]1426-they all looked . But [they]1426-they saw only bright blue sea and bright blue sky . [The Dark Island]56-the dark island and the darkness had vanished for ever .

“ Why ! ”[105-rhoop] cried [Lord Rhoop]105-rhoop . “ [You]80-lucy have destroyed it ! ”[105-rhoop]

“ [I]80-lucy do n’t think it was [us]1426-they , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ Sire , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian , “ this wind is fair for [the southeast]2555-the southeast . Shall [I]98-drinian have [[our]1426-they poor fellows]2556-our poor fellows up and set sail ? And after that , [every man who can be spared]2557-every man who can be spared , to [his]2557-every man who can be spared hammock . ”[98-drinian]

“ Yes , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ and let there be grog all round . Heigh - ho , [I]85-caspian feel [I]85-caspian could sleep the clock round [myself]85-caspian . ”[85-caspian]

So all afternoon with great joy [they]1426-they sailed south - east with a fair wind . But [nobody]749-nobody noticed when the albatross had disappeared .

THE wind never failed but it grew gentler every day till at length the waves were little more than ripples , and [the ship]234-the ship glided on hour after hour almost as if [they]1426-they were sailing on [a lake]1429-a lake . And every night [they]1426-they saw that there rose in the east new constellations which [no one]1909-no one had ever seen in [Narnia]2-narnia and perhaps , as [Lucy]80-lucy thought with a mixture of joy and fear , [no living eye]1431-no living eye had seen at all . Those new stars were big and bright and the nights were warm . [Most of [them]1426-they]1432-most of them slept on [deck]334-deck and talked far into the night or hung over [the ship]234-the ship ’s side watching the luminous dance of the foam thrown up by [their]1426-they bows .

On an evening of startling beauty , when the sunset behind [them]1426-they was so crimson and purple and widely spread that the very sky itself seemed to have grown larger , [they]1426-they came in sight of land on [their]1426-they starboard bow . It came slowly nearer and the light behind [them]1426-they made it look as if [the capes and headlands of [this new country]1436-this new country]1435-the capes and headlands of this new country were all on fire . But presently [they]1426-they were sailing along [its]1436-this new country coast and [[its]1436-this new country western cape]1437-its western cape now rose up astern of [them]1426-they , black against the red sky and sharp as if it was cut out of cardboard , and then [they]1426-they could see better what [this country]756-this country was like . [It]756-this country had [no mountains]1439-no mountains but many gentle hills with slopes like pillows . An attractive smell came from it — what [Lucy]80-lucy called “ a dim , purple kind of smell ”[80-lucy] , which [Edmund]79-edmund said ( and [Rhince]108-rhince thought ) was rot , but [Caspian]85-caspian said , “ [I]85-caspian know what [you]80-lucy mean . ”[85-caspian]

[They]1426-they sailed on a good way , past point after point , hoping to find [a nice deep harbour]1440-a nice deep harbour , but had to content [themselves]1426-they in the end with [a wide and shallow bay]1441-a wide and shallow bay . Though it had seemed calm out at [sea]1854-sea there was of course surf breaking on the sand and [they]1426-they could not bring [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader as far in as [they]1426-they would have liked . [They]1426-they dropped anchor a good way from [the beach]463-the beach and had a wet and tumbling landing in [the boat]1923-the boat . [The Lord Rhoop]105-rhoop remained on board [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader . [He]105-rhoop wished to see [no more islands]1446-no more islands . All the time that [they]1426-they remained in [this country]756-this country the sound of [the long breakers]1448-the long breakers was in [their]1426-they ears .

[Two men]707-two men were left to guard [the boat]1923-the boat and [Caspian]85-caspian led [the others]1949-the others inland , but not far because it was too late for exploring and the light would soon go . But there was no need to go far to find an adventure . [The level valley which lay at the head of [the bay]521-the bay]1452-the level valley which lay at the head of the bay showed no road or track or other sign of habitation . Underfoot was tine springy turf dotted here and there with a low bushy growth which [Edmund]79-edmund and [Lucy]80-lucy took for heather . [Eustace]73-eustace , who was really rather good at botany ; said it was n’t , and [he]73-eustace was probably right ; but it was something of very much the same kind .

When [they]1426-they had gone less than a bowshot from [the shore]455-the shore , [Drinian]98-drinian said , “ Look ! What ’s that ? ”[98-drinian] and [everyone]251-everyone stopped .

“ Are they great trees ? ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Towers , l think , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ It might be giants , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund in a lower voice .

“ The way to find out is to go right iv among them , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , drawing [his]89-reepicheep sword and pattering off ahead of [everyone else]863-everyone else .

“ [I]80-lucy think it ’s [a ruin]2558-a ruin , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy when [they]1426-they had got a good deal nearer , and [her]80-lucy guess was the best so far . What [they]1426-they now saw was a wide oblong space flagged with smooth stones and surrounded by grey pillars but unroofed . And from end to end of [it]1457-it ran a long table laid with a rich crimson cloth that came down nearly to the pavement . At either side of [it]1457-it were many chairs of stone richly carved and with silken cushions upon the seats . But on the table itself there was set out such a banquet as had never been seen , not even when [Peter the High King]77-peter kept [[his]77-peter court at [Cair Paravel]28-cair paravel]1458-his court at cair paravel . There were turkeys and geese and peacocks , there were boars ’ heads and sides of venison , there were pies shaped like [ships under full sail]1459-ships under full sail or like dragons and elephants , there were ice puddings and bright lobsters and gleaming salmon , there were nuts and grapes , pineapples and peaches , pomegranates and melons and tomatoes . There were flagons of gold and silver and curiouslywrought glass ; and the smell of the fruit and the wine blew towards [them]1426-they like a promise of all happiness .

“ [I]80-lucy say ! ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

[They]1426-they came nearer and nearer , all very quietly .

“ But where are [the guests]2559-the guests ? ”[73-eustace] asked [Eustace]73-eustace .

“ [We]1426-they can provide that , [Sir]2125-sir , ”[108-rhince] said [Rhince]108-rhince .

“ Look ! ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund sharply . [They]1426-they were actually within the pillars now and standing on [the pavement]1460-the pavement . [Everyone]251-everyone looked where [Edmund]79-edmund had pointed . The chairs were not all empty . At the head of the table and in the two places beside [it]1457-it there was something — or possibly three somethings .

“ What are those ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy in a whisper . “ It looks like three beavers sitting on the table . ”[80-lucy]

[Reepicheep]89-reepicheep ran forward , jumped on a chair and thence on to the table , and ran along it , threading [his]89-reepicheep way as nimbly as [a dancer between jewelled cups and pyramids of fruit and — ivory salt - cellars]1462-a dancer between jewelled cups and pyramids of fruit and — ivory salt - cellars . [Everyone]251-everyone now came close and saw that what sat in those three chairs was [three men]1464-three men , though hard to recognize as [men]694-men till [you]1466-you looked closely . [Their]1464-three men hair , which was grey , had grown over [their]1464-three men eyes till it almost concealed [their]1464-three men , faces , and [their]1464-three men beards had grown over the table , climbing pound and entwining plates and goblets as brambles ; entwine a fence , until , all mixed in one great mat of hair , [they]1464-three men flowed over the edge and down to the floor . And from [their]1464-three men heads the hair hung over the backs of [their]1464-three men chairs so that they were wholly hidden . In fact [the three men]1467-the three men were ; nearly all hair .

“ [I]98-drinian beseech [[your]89-reepicheep Majesty]1838-your majesty — ”[98-drinian] began [Drinian]98-drinian .

As [the crew]704-the crew marched off to [the shore]455-the shore in the gathering dusk [none of [the five watchers]1478-the five watchers]1477-none of the five watchers , except perhaps [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , could avoid a cold feeling in the stomach .

[They]1478-the five watchers took some time choosing [their]1478-the five watchers seats at the perilous table . Probably [everyone]251-everyone had the same reason but [no one]1909-no one said it out loud . For it was really a rather nasty choice . [One]256-one could hardly bear to sit all night next to those three terrible hairy objects which , if not dead , were certainly not alive in the ordinary sense . On the other hand , to sit at the far end , so that [you]1482-you would see them less and less as the night grew darker , and would n’t know if [they]1483-they were moving , and perhaps would n’t see [them]1483-they at all by about two o’clock no , it was not to be thought of . So [they]1478-the five watchers sauntered round and round the table saying , “ What about here ? ”[1478-the five watchers] and “ Or perhaps a bit further on , ”[1478-the five watchers] or , “ Why not on this side ? ”[1478-the five watchers] till at last [they]1478-the five watchers settled down somewhere about the middle but nearer to the sleepers than to the other end . It was about ten by now and almost dark . Those strange new constellations burned in the east . [Lucy]80-lucy would have liked it better if [they]1478-the five watchers had been [the Leopard]172-the leopard and [the Ship]234-the ship and [other old friends of the Narnian sky]1485-other old friends of the narnian sky .

[They]1478-the five watchers wrapped [themselves]1478-the five watchers in [their]1478-the five watchers sea cloaks and sat still and waited . At first there was some attempt at talk but it did n’t come to much . And [they]1478-the five watchers sat and sat . And all the time [they]1478-the five watchers heard the waves breaking on [the beach]463-the beach .

After hours that seemed like ages there came a moment when [they]1478-the five watchers all knew [they]1478-the five watchers had been dozing a moment before but were all suddenly wide awake . The stars were all in quite different positions from those [they]1478-the five watchers had last noticed . The sky was very black except for the faintest possible greyness in the east . [They]1478-the five watchers were cold , though thirsty , and stiff . And [none of [them]1478-the five watchers]1870-none of them spoke because now at last something was happening .

Before [them]1478-the five watchers , beyond the pillars , there was [the slope of [a low hill]1489-a low hill]1488-the slope of a low hill . And now a door opened in [the hillside]1490-the hillside , and light appeared in the doorway , and a figure came out , and the door shut behind it . [The figure]1491-the figure carried a light , and this light was really all that [they]1478-the five watchers could see distinctly . It came slowly nearer and nearer till at last it stood right at the table opposite to [them]1478-the five watchers . Now [they]1478-the five watchers could see that it was [a tall girl]1492-a tall girl , dressed in a single long garment of clear blue which left [her]1492-a tall girl arms bare . [She]1492-a tall girl was bareheaded and [her]1492-a tall girl yellow hair hung down [her]1492-a tall girl back . And when [they]1478-the five watchers looked at [her]1492-a tall girl [they]1478-the five watchers thought [they]1478-the five watchers had never before known what beauty meant .

The light which [she]1492-a tall girl had been carrying was a tall candle in a silver candlestick which [she]1492-a tall girl now set upon the table . If there had been any wind off [the sea]250-the sea earlier in the night it must have died down by now , for the flame of the candle burned as straight and still as if it were in [a room with the windows shut and the curtains drawn]1494-a room with the windows shut and the curtains drawn . Gold and silver on the table shone in its light .

[Lucy]80-lucy now noticed something lying lengthwise on the table which had escaped [her]80-lucy attention before . It was a knife of stone , sharp as steel , a cruel - looking , ancient looking thing .

[No one]1909-no one had yet spoken a word . Then — Reepicheep first , and [Caspian]85-caspian next — [they]1478-the five watchers all rose to [their]1478-the five watchers feet , because [they]1478-the five watchers felt that [she]1492-a tall girl was [a great lady]1496-a great lady .

“ Travellers who have come from far to [Aslan]91-aslan ’s table , ”[1222-the girl] said [the girl]1222-the girl . “ Why do [you]85-caspian not eat and drink ? ”[1222-the girl]

“ Then , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ in the name of [Aslan]91-aslan , show [me]85-caspian how to set about that work at once . ”[85-caspian]

“ [[My]1222-the girl father]1867-my father will teach [you]251-everyone that , ”[1222-the girl] said [the girl]1222-the girl .

“ [[Your]251-everyone father]2619-your father ! ”[251-everyone] said [everyone]251-everyone . “ Who is [he]1517-an old man ? And where ? ”[251-everyone]

“ Look , ”[1222-the girl] said [the girl]1222-the girl , turning round and pointing at the door in [the hillside]1490-the hillside . [They]1514-they could see it more easily now , for while [they]1514-they had been talking the stars had grown fainter and great gaps of white light were appearing in the greyness of the eastern sky .

Slowly the door opened again and out there came a figure as tall and straight as [the girl]1222-the girl ’s but not so slender . It carried no light but light seemed to come from [it]1516-it . As it came nearer , [Lucy]80-lucy saw that it was like [an old man]1517-an old man . [His]1517-an old man silver beard came down to [his]1517-an old man bare feet in front and [his]1517-an old man saver hair hung down to [his]1517-an old man heels behind and [his]1517-an old man robe appeared to be made from the fleece of silver sheep . [He]1517-an old man looked so mild and grave that once more all [the travellers]1518-the travellers rose to [their]1518-the travellers feet and stood in silence .

But [the old man]1264-the old man came on without speaking to [the travellers]1518-the travellers and stood on the other side of the table opposite to [[his]1264-the old man daughter]1896-his daughter . Then [both of [them]1522-both of them]1522-both of them held up [their]1522-both of them arms before [them]1522-both of them and turned to face [the east]1879-the east . In that position the began to sing . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could write down the song , but [one who was present]1524-one who was present could remember it . [Lucy]80-lucy said afterwards that it was high , almost shrill , but very beautiful , cold kind of song , an early morning kind of song . And [they]1522-both of them sang , the grey clouds lifted from the eastern sky a the white patches grew bigger and bigger till it was white , and [the sea]250-the sea began to shine like silver . And long afterwards ( but [those two]1526-those two sang all the time ) [the east]1879-the east began to turn red and at last , unclouded , the sun came up out [the sea]250-the sea and its long level ray shot down the length of the table on the gold and silver sand on [the Stone Knife]1529-the stone knife .

Once or twice before , [the Narnians]87-the narnians had wondered whether the sun at its rising did not look bigger in [these seas]1530-these seas than it had looked at [home]296-home . This time [they]1522-both of them we certain . There was no mistaking it . And the brightness its ray on the dew and on the table was far beyond an . morning brightness [they]1522-both of them had ever seen . And as [Edmu]174-edmu said afterwards , “ Though lots of things happened on that trip which sound more exciting , that moment was really the most exciting . ”[174-edmu] For now [they]1522-both of them knew that [they]1522-both of them had truly come to the beginning of [the End of [the World]58-the world]2151-the end of the world .

Then something seemed to be flying at [them]1522-both of them out of the very centre of the rising sun : but of course [one]256-one could n’t look steadily in that direction to make sure . But presently the air became full of voices — voices which took up same song that [the Lady]2370-the lady and [[her]2370-the lady Father]1535-her father were singing , but in far wilder tones and in a language which [no one]1909-no one knew And soon after that [the owners of these voices]1537-the owners of these voices could be seen . [They]1538-they were birds , large and white , and [they]1538-they came hundreds and thousands and alighted on everything ; the grass , and the pavement , on the table , on [your]1539-your shoulders , [your]1539-your hands , and [your]1539-your head , till it looked as heavy snow had fallen . For , like snow , [they]1538-they not only make everything white but blurred and blunted all shapes . But [Lucy]80-lucy , looking out from between the wings of the birds that covered [her]80-lucy , saw one bird fly to the Old Man with something in its beak that looked like a little fruit , unless it was a little live coal , which it might have been , for it was too bright to look at . And the bird laid it in [the Old Man]175-the old man ’s mouth .

Then the birds stopped [their]1538-they singing and appeared to be very busy about the table . When [they]1538-they rose from it again everything on the table that could be eaten or drunk had disappeared . [These birds]1540-these birds rose from [their]1540-these birds meal in [their]1540-these birds thousands and hundreds and carried away all the things that could not be eaten or drunk , such as bones , rinds , and shells , and took [their]1540-these birds flight back to the rising sun . But now , because [they]1540-these birds were not singing , the whir of [their]1540-these birds wings seemed to set the whole air a - tremble . And there was the table pecked clean and empty , and [the three old Lords of [Narnia]2-narnia]1541-the three old lords of narnia still fast asleep .

Now at last [the Old Man]1264-the old man turned to [the travellers]1518-the travellers and bade [them]1518-the travellers welcome .

“ [Sir]2125-sir , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ will [you]2125-sir tell [us]1518-the travellers how to undo the enchantment which holds [these three Narnian Lords]2621-these three narnian lords asleep . ”[85-caspian]

“ [I]175-the old man will gladly tell [you]2125-sir that , [[my]175-the old man son]2622-my son , ”[175-the old man] said [the Old Man]175-the old man . “ To break this enchantment [you]2125-sir must sail to [the World ’s End]59-the world ’s end , or as near as [you]2125-sir can come to it , and [you]2125-sir must come back having left at least one of [[your]2125-sir company]2623-your company behind . ”[175-the old man]

“ And what must happen to [that one]2624-that one ? ”[89-reepicheep] asked [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep .

“ [He]2624-that one must go on into [the utter east]2625-the utter east and never return into [the world]1877-the world . ”[175-the old man]

“ That is [my]89-reepicheep heart ’s desire , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep .

“ [I]1264-the old man saw them long ago , ”[1264-the old man] said [the Old Man]1264-the old man , “ but it was from a great height . [I]1264-the old man can not tell [you]2125-sir such things as [sailor]2631-sailor need to know . ”[1264-the old man]

“ Do [you]1264-the old man mean [you]1264-the old man were flying in the air ? ”[73-eustace] [Eustace]73-eustace blurted out .

“ [I]1264-the old man was a long way above the air , [[my]1264-the old man son]2622-my son , ”[1264-the old man] replied [the Old Man]1264-the old man . “ [I]1264-the old man am [Ramandu]176-ramandu . “ [Golly]177-golly , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund under [his]79-edmund breath . “ [He]1264-the old man ’s a retired star . ”[79-edmund]

“ Are n’t [you]1264-the old man a star any longer ? ”[80-lucy] asked [Lucy]80-lucy .

“ [I]176-ramandu am a star at rest , [[my]176-ramandu daughter]2634-my daughter , ”[176-ramandu] answered [Ramandu]176-ramandu

“ When [I]1264-the old man set for the last time , decrepit and old beyond all that [you]2125-sir can reckon , [I]1264-the old man was carried to [this island]717-this island . [I]1264-the old man am not so old now as [I]1264-the old man was then . “ In [[our]2638-we world]281-our world , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace , “ a star is a huge ball of flaming gas . ”[73-eustace]

“ Even in [[your]2125-sir world]2641-your world , [[my]1264-the old man son]2622-my son , that is not what a star is but only what it is made of . [Caspian]85-caspian told [Ramandu]176-ramandu the story of [Rhoop]105-rhoop .

“ [[My]305-the king lord]1993-my lord , ”[305-the king] said [the King]305-the king to [Drinian]98-drinian , “ pray send [two men]707-two men back to [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader with a message to [the Lord Rhoop]105-rhoop . When this had been done , [Caspian]85-caspian told [the rest]1856-the rest to sit down and laid the whole situation before [them]1856-the rest . “ What some of [us]2672-we have been wanting to ask for a long time , [[your]305-the king Majesty]1838-your majesty , is how [we]2672-we ’re ever to get [home]296-home when [we]2672-we do turn , whether [we]2672-we turn here or somewhere else . “ That ’s [landsman]2676-landsman ’s talk , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian . “ There ’s always a prevailing west wind in [these seas]1530-these seas all through the late summer , and it always changes after the New Year . [We]2672-we ’ll have plenty of wind for sailing westward ; more than [we]2672-we shall like from all accounts . ”[98-drinian]

“ That ’s true , [Master]2678-master , ”[1556-an old sailor] said [an old sailor]1556-an old sailor who was [a Galmian by birth]1557-a galmian by birth . “ [You]2678-master get some ugly weather rolling up from the east in January and February . [Some of [the sailors]275-the sailors]1559-some of the sailors cheered at this but [some]626-some said that that was all very well .

At this point [Caspian]85-caspian jumped to [his]85-caspian feet . “ [Friends]841-friends , ”[85-caspian] [he]85-caspian said , “ [I]85-caspian think [you]841-friends have not quite understood [our]2706-our purpose .
