There was rather a sheepish silence and then [the crew]704-the crew made [their]704-the crew bows and moved away , one in this direction and one in that , but mostly in little knots or bunches , talking .

“ And now for [the Lord Rhoop]105-rhoop , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

But turning to the head of the table [he]85-caspian saw that [Rhoop]105-rhoop was already there . [He]105-rhoop had arrived , silent and unnoticed , while the discussion was going on , and was seated beside [the Lord Argoz]128-argoz . [The daughter of [Ramandu]176-ramandu]1566-the daughter of ramandu stood beside [him]105-rhoop as if [she]1566-the daughter of ramandu had just helped [him]105-rhoop into [his]105-rhoop chair ; [Ramandu]176-ramandu stood behind [him]105-rhoop and laid both [his]176-ramandu hands on [Rhoop]105-rhoop ’s grey head . Even in daylight a faint silver light came from the hands of the star . There was a smile on [Rhoop]105-rhoop ’s haggard face . [He]105-rhoop held out one of [his]105-rhoop hands to [Lucy]80-lucy and the other to [Caspian]85-caspian . For a moment it looked as if [he]105-rhoop were going to say something . Then [his]105-rhoop smile brightened as if [he]105-rhoop were feeling ) some delicious sensation , a long sigh of contentment came from [his]105-rhoop lips , [his]105-rhoop head fell forward , and [he]105-rhoop slept .

“ [Poor Rhoop]181-poor rhoop , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [I]80-lucy am glad . [He]105-rhoop must have had terrible times . ”[80-lucy]

“ Do n’t let ’s even think of it , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace .

[Meanwhile Caspian]85-caspian ’s speech , helped perhaps by some magic of [the island]763-the island , was having just the effect [he]105-rhoop intended . [A good many who had been anxious enough to get out of the voyage]1568-a good many who had been anxious enough to get out of the voyage felt quite differently about being left out of it . And of course whenever [any one sailor]1569-any one sailor announced that [he]1569-any one sailor had made up [his]1569-any one sailor mind to ask for permission to sail , [the ones who had n’t]1570-the ones who had n’t said this felt that [they]1570-the ones who had n’t were getting fewer and more uncomfortable . So that before the half - hour was nearly over [several people]1571-several people were positively “ sucking up ”[1571-several people] to [Drinian]98-drinian and [Rhince]108-rhince ( at least that was what [they]1571-several people called it at [[my]0-i school]1572-my school ) to get a good report . And soon there were only three left who did n’t want to go , and those three were trying very hard to persuade [others]2187-others to stay with [them]1574-them . And very shortly after that there was only one left . And in [they]1575-they end [he]105-rhoop began to be afraid of being left behind all on [his]105-rhoop own and changed [his]105-rhoop mind .

At the end of the half - hour [they]1575-they all came trooping back to [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s Table]2605-aslan ’s table and stood at one end while [Drinian]98-drinian and [Rhince]108-rhince went and sat down with [Caspian]85-caspian and made [their]1575-they report ; and [Caspian]85-caspian accepted all [the man]438-the man but [that one who ’d had changed [his]105-rhoop mind at the last moment]1578-that one who ’d had changed his mind at the last moment . [His]105-rhoop name was [Pittencream]182-pittencream and [he]105-rhoop stayed on [the Island of the Star]1579-the island of the star all the time [the others]1949-the others were away looking for [the World ’s End]59-the world ’s end , and [he]105-rhoop very much wished [he]105-rhoop had gone with [them]1949-the others . [He]105-rhoop was n’t [the sort of man who could enjoy talking to [Ramandu]176-ramandu and [[Ramandu]176-ramandu ’s daughter]1582-ramandu ’s daughter ( nor [they]1575-they to [him]105-rhoop]1581-the sort of man who could enjoy talking to ramandu and ramandu ’s daughter ( nor they to him ) , and it rained a good deal , and though there was a wonderful feast on the Table every night , [he]105-rhoop did n’t very much enjoy it . [He]105-rhoop said it gave [him]105-rhoop the creeps sitting there alone ( and in the rain as likely as not ) with [those four Lords asleep at the end of the Table]1583-those four lords asleep at the end of the table . And when [the others]1949-the others returned [he]105-rhoop felt so out of things that [he]105-rhoop deserted on the voyage home at [the Lone Islands]7-the lone islands , and went and lived in [Calormen]32-calormen , where [he]105-rhoop told wonderful stories about [his]105-rhoop adventures at [the End of [the World]58-the world]2151-the end of the world , until at last [he]105-rhoop came to believe [them]1575-they [himself]105-rhoop . So [you]1586-you may say , in a sense , that [he]105-rhoop lived happily ever after . But [he]105-rhoop could never bear mice .

That night [they]1587-they all ate and drank together at the great table between the pillars where the feast was magically renewed : and next morning [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader set sail once more just when the great birds had come and gone again .

“ [Lady]2604-lady , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ [I]85-caspian hope to speak with [you]2604-lady again when [I]85-caspian have broken the enchantments . ”[85-caspian] And [[Ramandu]176-ramandu ’s daughter]1582-ramandu ’s daughter looked at [him]85-caspian and smiled .

VERY soon after [they]1587-they had left [Ramandu ’s country]176-ramandu [they]1587-they began to feel that [they]1587-they had already sailed beyond [the world]1877-the world . All was different . For one thing [they]1587-they all found that [they]1587-they were needing less sleep . [One]256-one did not want to go to bed . nor to eat much , nor even to talk except in low voices . Another thing was the light . There was too much of it . The sun when it came up each morning looked twice , if not ; three times , its usual size . And every morning ( which gave [Lucy]80-lucy the strangest feeling of all ) the huge white birds , singing [their]1592-their song with human voices in a language [no one]1909-no one knew , streamed overhead and vanished astern on [their]1592-their way to [their]1592-their breakfast at [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s Table]2605-aslan ’s table . A little later [they]1592-their came flying back and vanished into [the east]1879-the east .

“ How beautifully clear [the water]1834-the water is ! ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy to [herself]80-lucy , as [she]80-lucy leaned over the port side early in the afternoon of the second day .

And it was . The first thing that [she]80-lucy noticed was a little black object , about the size of a shoe , travelling along at the same speed as [the ship]234-the ship . For a moment [she]80-lucy thought it was something floating on the surface . But then there came floating past a bit of stale bread which [the cook]343-the cook had just thrown out of [the galley]1850-the galley . And the bit of bread looked as if it were going to collide with the black thing , but it did n’t . It passed above it , and [Lucy]80-lucy now saw that the black thing could not be on the surface . Then the black thing suddenly got very much bigger and flicked back to normal size a moment later .

Now [Lucy]80-lucy knew [she]80-lucy had seen something just like that happen somewhere else — if only [she]80-lucy could remember where . [She]80-lucy held [her]80-lucy hand to [her]80-lucy head and screwed up [her]80-lucy face and put out [her]80-lucy tongue in the effort to remember . At last [she]80-lucy did . Of course ! It was like what [you]1599-you saw from [a train]1600-a train on a bright sunny day . [You]1599-you saw the black shadow of [[your]1599-you own coach]1601-your own coach running along [the fields]517-the fields at the same pace as [the train]1603-the train . Then [you]1599-you went into a cutting ; and immediately the same shadow flicked close up to [you]1599-you and got big , racing : long the grass of [the cutting - bank]1604-the cutting - bank . Then [you]1599-you came out of [the cutting]1605-the cutting and — Pick!—once more the black shadow had gone back to its normal size and was running along [the fields]517-the fields .

“ It ’s [our]2726-our shadow!—the shadow of [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [Our]2726-our shadow running along on [the bottom of [the sea]250-the sea]2728-the bottom of the sea . That time when it got bigger it went over [a hill]2730-a hill . But in that case the water must be clearer than [I]80-lucy thought ! Good gracious , [I]80-lucy must [he]2731-he seeing [the bottom of [the sea]250-the sea]2728-the bottom of the sea ; fathoms and fathoms down . ”[80-lucy]

As soon as [she]80-lucy had said this [she]80-lucy realized that the great silvery expanse which [she]80-lucy had been seeing ( without noticing ) for some time was really the sand on [the sea - bed]1607-the sea - bed and that ail sorts of darker or brighter patches were not lights and shadows on the surface but real things on the bottom . At present , for instance , [they]1608-they were passing over a mass of soft purply green with a broad , winding strip of pale grey in the middle of it But now that [she]80-lucy knew it was on the bottom [she]80-lucy saw it much better . [She]80-lucy could see that bits of the dark stuff were much higher than other bits and were waving gently . “ Just like trees in a wind , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ And do believe that ’s what they are . It ’s [a submarine forest]2734-a submarine forest . ”[80-lucy]

[They]1608-they passed on above it and presently the pale streak was joined by another pale streak . “ If [I]80-lucy was down there , ”[80-lucy] thought [Lucy]80-lucy , “ that streak would be just like a road through [the wood]758-the wood . And that place where it joins the other Would be a crossroads . Oh , [I]80-lucy do wish [I]80-lucy was . Hallo ! [the forest]2736-the forest is coming to an end . And [I]80-lucy do believe the streak really was [a road]2737-a road ! [I]80-lucy can still see it going on across the open sand . It ’s a different colour . And it ’s marked out with something at the edges — dotted lines . Perhaps they are stones . And now it ’s getting wider . ”[80-lucy]

But it was not really getting wider , it was getting nearer . [She]80-lucy realized this because of the way in which the shadow of [the ship]234-the ship came rushing up towards [her]80-lucy . And [the road]1610-the road [she]80-lucy felt sure it was [a road]2737-a road now — began to go in zigzags . Obviously it was climbing up [a steep hill]1612-a steep hill . And when [she]80-lucy held [her]80-lucy head sideways and looked back , what [she]80-lucy saw was very like what [you]1613-you see when [you]1613-you look down [a winding road]1614-a winding road from [the top of [a hill]2730-a hill]1615-the top of a hill . [She]80-lucy could even see the shafts of sunlight falling through the deep water on to [the wooded valley]1617-the wooded valley — and , in the extreme distance , everything melting away into a dim greenness . But some places — the sunny ones , [she]80-lucy thought — were ultramarine blue .

[She]80-lucy could not , however , spend much time looking back ; what was coming into view in the forward direction was too exciting . [The road]1610-the road had apparently now reached the top of [the hill]1050-the hill and ran straight forward . Little specks were moving to and fro on it . And now something most wonderful , fortunately in full sunlight — or as full as it can be when it falls through fathoms of water — flashed into sight . It was knobbly and jagged and of a pearly , or perhaps an ivory , colour . [She]80-lucy was so nearly straight above it that at first [she]80-lucy could hardly make out what it was . But everything became plain when [she]80-lucy noticed its shadow . The sunlight was falling across [Lucy]80-lucy ’s shoulders , so the shadow of the thing lay stretched out on the sand behind [it]1610-the road . And by its shape [she]80-lucy saw clearly that it was a shadow of towers and pinnacles , minarets and domes .

“ Why!—it ’s [a city]2738-a city or [a huge castle]2739-a huge castle , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy to [herself]80-lucy “ But [I]80-lucy wonder why [they]1620-they ’ve built [it]1610-the road on top of [a high mountain]2740-a high mountain ? ”[80-lucy]

Long afterwards when [she]80-lucy was back in [England]50-england and talked all these adventures over with [Edmund]79-edmund , [they]1620-they thought of a reason and [I]0-i am pretty sure it is the true one . In [the sea]250-the sea , the deeper [you]1622-you go , the darker and colder it gets , and it is down there , in the dark and cold , that dangerous things live — the squid and [the Sea Serpent]43-the sea serpent and [the Kraken]1623-the kraken . [The valleys]1624-the valleys are [the wild , unfriendly places]1625-the wild , unfriendly places . [The sea - people]1626-the sea - people feel about [[their]1626-the sea - people valleys]1627-their valleys as [we]1628-we do about mountains , and feel about [[their]1626-the sea - people mountains]1629-their mountains as [we]1628-we feel about [valleys]1630-valleys . It is on [the heights]1631-the heights ( or , as [we]1628-we would say , “ in [the shallows ”]2741-the shallows ”[1628-we] ) that there is warmth and peace . [The reckless hunters and brave knights of [the sea]250-the sea]1632-the reckless hunters and brave knights of the sea go down into [the depths]1634-the depths on quests and adventures , but return home to [the heights]1631-the heights for rest and peace , courtesy and council , the sports , the dances and the songs .

[They]1626-the sea - people had passed [the city]1900-the city and [the sea - bed]1607-the sea - bed was still rising . [It]1607-the sea - bed was only a few hundred feet below [the ship]234-the ship now . [The road]1610-the road had disappeared . [They]1626-the sea - people were sailing above [an open park - like country]1640-an open park - like country , dotted with little groves of brightlycoloured vegetation . And then — [Lucy]80-lucy nearly squealed aloud with excitement - [she]80-lucy had seen [People]207-people .

There were between fifteen and twenty of [them]207-people , and all mounted on sea - horses — not the tiny little sea - horses which [you]1642-you may have seen in museums but horses rather bigger than [themselves]207-people . [They]207-people must be [noble and lordly people]1643-noble and lordly people , [Lucy]80-lucy thought , for [she]80-lucy could catch the gleam of gold on some of [their]207-people foreheads and streamers of emerald — or orange - coloured stuff fluttered from [their]207-people shoulders in the current . Then :

“ Oh , bother these fish ! ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , for a whole shoal of small fat fish , swimming quite close to the surface , had come between [her]80-lucy and [the Sea People]183-the sea people . But though this spoiled [her]80-lucy view it led to the most interesting thing of all .

Suddenly a fierce little fish of a kind [she]80-lucy had never seen before came darting up from below , snapped , grabbed , and sank rapidly with one of the fat fish in its mouth . And [all the Sea People]1644-all the sea people were sitting on [their]1644-all the sea people horses staring up at what had happened . [They]1644-all the sea people seemed to be talking and laughing . And before the hunting fish had got back to [them]1644-all the sea people with its prey , another of the same kind came up from [the Sea People]183-the sea people . And [Lucy]80-lucy was almost certain that [one big Sea Man who sat on [his]1645-one big sea man who sat on his sea - horse in the middle of the party sea - horse in the middle of the party]1645-one big sea man who sat on his sea - horse in the middle of the party had sent [it]1646-it or released [it]1646-it ; as if [he]1645-one big sea man who sat on his sea - horse in the middle of the party had been holdng it back till then in [his]1645-one big sea man who sat on his sea - horse in the middle of the party hand or on [his]1645-one big sea man who sat on his sea - horse in the middle of the party wrist .

“ Why , [I]80-lucy do declare , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , “ it ’s [a hunting party]2742-a hunting party . Or more like [a hawking party]2743-a hawking party . Yes , that ’s it . [They]1644-all the sea people ride out with these little fierce fish on [their]1644-all the sea people wrists just as [we]2744-we used to ride out with falcons on [our]2744-we wrists when [we]2744-we were [Kings]277-kings and [Queens]2372-queens at [Cair Paravel]28-cair paravel long ago . And then [they]1644-all the sea people fly them — or [I]80-lucy suppose [I]80-lucy should say swim [them]1644-all the sea people — at the others . ”[80-lucy]

[She]80-lucy stopped suddenly because the scene was changing . [The Sea People]1647-the sea people had noticed the Dawn Treader . The shoal of fish hard scattered in every direction : [the People]1961-the people [themselves]1961-the people were coming up to find out the meaning of this big , black thing which had come between [them]1961-the people and the sun . And now [they]1961-the people were so close to the surface that if [they]1961-the people had been in air , instead of water , [Lucy]80-lucy could have spoken to [them]1961-the people . There were [men]694-men and [women]1650-women both . [All]1063-all wore coronets of some kind and [many]621-many had chains of pearls . [They]1063-all wore no other clothes . [Their]1063-all bodies were the colour of old ivory , [their]1063-all hair dark purple . [The King in the centre]1653-the king in the centre ( [no one]1909-no one could mistake [him]1653-the king in the centre for anything but [the King]305-the king ) looked proudly and fiercely into [Lucy]80-lucy ’s face and shook a spear in [his]1653-the king in the centre hand . [[His]1653-the king in the centre knights]1656-his knights did the same . The faces of [the ladies]1657-the ladies were filled with astonishment . [Lucy]80-lucy felt sure [they]1961-the people had never seen [a ship]232-a ship or [a human]1659-a human before — and how should [they]1961-the people , in [seas beyond [the world]1877-the world ’s end where [no ship]1662-no ship ever came]1660-seas beyond the world ’s end where no ship ever came ?

“ What are [you]80-lucy staring at , [Lu]80-lucy ? ”[1663-a voice close beside her] said [a voice close beside [her]80-lucy]1663-a voice close beside her .

[Lucy]80-lucy had been so absorbed in what [she]80-lucy was seeing that [she]80-lucy started at the sound , and when [she]80-lucy turned [she]80-lucy found that [her]80-lucy arm had gone “ dead ”[98-drinian] from leaning so long on the rail in one position . [Drinian]98-drinian and [Edmund]79-edmund were beside [her]80-lucy .

“ Look , ”[80-lucy] [she]80-lucy said .

[They]1961-the people both looked , but almost at once [Drinian]98-drinian said in a low voice :

“ Turn round at once , [[your]80-lucy Majesties]1839-your majesties — that ’s right , with [our]1961-the people backs to [the sea]250-the sea . And do n’t look as if [we]1961-the people were talking about anything important . ”[98-drinian]

“ Why , what ’s the matter ? ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy as [she]80-lucy obeyed .

“ It ’ll never do for [the sailors]275-the sailors to see all that , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian . “ [We]1961-the people ’ll have [men]694-men falling in love with [a seawoman]2751-a seawoman , or falling in love with [the under - sea country]2752-the under - sea country itself , and jumping overboard . [I]98-drinian ’ve heard of that kind of thing happening before in [strange seas]2753-strange seas . It ’s always unlucky to see [these people]2423-these people . ”[98-drinian]

“ But [we]1961-the people used to know [them]2423-these people , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ In the old days at [Cair Paravel]28-cair paravel when [[my]80-lucy brother]2323-my brother [Peter]77-peter was [High King]2756-high king . [They]2423-these people came to the surface and sang at [our]1961-the people coronation . ”[80-lucy]

“ [I]79-edmund think that must have been a different kind , [Lu]80-lucy , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ [They]2423-these people could live in the air as well as under water . [I]79-edmund rather think these ca n’t . By the look of [them]2423-these people [they]2423-these people ’d have surfaced and started attacking [us]1961-the people long ago if [they]2423-these people could . [They]2423-these people seem very fierce . ”[79-edmund]

“ At any rate , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian , but at that moment two sounds were heard . One was a plop . [The other was a voice from the fighting top]1664-the other was a voice from the fighting top shouting , “ Man overboard ! ”[1664-the other was a voice from the fighting top] Then [everyone]251-everyone was busy . [Some of [the sailors]275-the sailors]1559-some of the sailors hurried aloft to take in the sail : [others]2187-others hurried below to get to the oars ; and [Rhince , who was on duty on the poop]1669-rhince , who was on duty on the poop , began to put the helm hard over so as to come round and back to [the man who had gone overboard]1670-the man who had gone overboard . But by now [everyone]251-everyone knew that it was n’t strictly [a man]1920-a man . It was [Reepicheep]180-reepicheep .

“ [Drat]184-drat that mouse ! ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian . “ It ’s more trouble than [all the rest of [the ship]234-the ship ’s company]2757-all the rest of the ship ’s company put together . If there is any scrape to be got into , in it will get ! [It]234-the ship ought to be put in irons — keel - hauled — marooned — have its whiskers cut off . Can [anyone]1930-anyone see [the little blighter]2760-the little blighter ? ”[98-drinian]

All this did n’t mean that [Drinian]98-drinian really disliked [Reepicheep]180-reepicheep . On the contrary [he]98-drinian liked [him]180-reepicheep very much and was therefore frightened about [him]180-reepicheep , and being frightened put [him]180-reepicheep in a bad temper — just as [[your]1673-your mother]1674-your mother is much angrier with [you]1673-your for running out into [the road]1610-the road in front of [a car]1676-a car than [a stranger]1677-a stranger would be . [No one]1909-no one , of course , was afraid of [Reepicheep]180-reepicheep ’s drowning , for [he]180-reepicheep was [an excellent swimmer]1679-an excellent swimmer ; but [the three who knew what was going on below the water]1680-the three who knew what was going on below the water were afraid of those long , cruel spears in the hands of [the Sea People]1647-the sea people .

In a few minutes [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader had come round and [everyone]251-everyone could see the black blob in the water which was [Reepicheep]180-reepicheep . [He]180-reepicheep was chattering with the greatest excitement but as [his]180-reepicheep mouth kept on getting filled with water [nobody]749-nobody could understand what [he]180-reepicheep was saying .

“ [He]180-reepicheep ’ll blurt the whole thing out if [we]275-the sailors do n’t shut [him]180-reepicheep up , ”[98-drinian] cried [Drinian]98-drinian . To prevent this [he]98-drinian rushed to the side and lowered a rope [himself]98-drinian , shouting to [the sailors]275-the sailors , “ All right , all right . Back to [[your]275-the sailors places]2761-your places . [I]98-drinian hope [I]98-drinian can heave a mouse up without help . ”[98-drinian] And as [Reepicheep]180-reepicheep began climbing up the rope not very nimbly because [his]180-reepicheep wet fur made [him]180-reepicheep heavy — [Drinian]98-drinian leaned over and whispered to [him]180-reepicheep ,

“ Do n’t tell . Not a word . ”[98-drinian]

But when [the dripping Mouse]89-reepicheep had reached the deck it turned out not to be at all interested in [the Sea People]183-the sea people .

“ [Sweet]185-sweet ! ”[89-reepicheep] [he]89-reepicheep cheeped . “ Sweet , sweet ! ”[89-reepicheep]

“ What are [you]98-drinian talking about ? ”[98-drinian] asked [Drinian]98-drinian crossly . “ And [you]98-drinian need n’t shake [yourself]98-drinian all over [me]98-drinian , either . ”[98-drinian]

“ [I]89-reepicheep tell [you]98-drinian the water ’s sweet , ”[89-reepicheep] said [the Mouse]89-reepicheep . “ Sweet , fresh . It is n’t salt . ”[89-reepicheep]

For a moment [no one]1909-no one quite took in the importance of this . But then [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep once more repeated the old prophecy :

“ Where the waves grow sweet , Doubt not , [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , There is [the utter East]2625-the utter east . ”[89-reepicheep]

Then at last [everyone]251-everyone understood .

“ Let [me]98-drinian have a bucket , [Rynelf]86-rynelf , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian .

It was handed [him]98-drinian and [he]98-drinian lowered it and up it came again . The water shone in it like glass .

“ Perhaps [[your]85-caspian Majesty]1838-your majesty would like to taste it first , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian to [Caspian]85-caspian .

[The King]305-the king took the bucket in both hands , raised it to [his]305-the king lips , sipped , then drank deeply and raised [his]305-the king head . [His]305-the king face was changed . Not only [his]305-the king eyes but everything about [him]305-the king seemed to be brighter .

“ Yes , ”[305-the king] [he]305-the king said , “ it is sweet . That ’s real water , that . [I]305-the king ’m not sure that it is n’t going to kill [me]305-the king . But it is the death [I]305-the king would have chosen — if [I]305-the king ’d known about it till now . ”[305-the king]

“ What do [you]89-reepicheep mean ? ”[79-edmund] asked [Edmund]79-edmund .

“ It — it ’s like light more than anything else , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ That is what it is , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep . “ Drinkable light . [We]2764-we must be very near [the end of [the world]1877-the world]2151-the end of the world now . ”[89-reepicheep]

There was a moment ’s silence and then [Lucy]80-lucy knelt down on [the deck]255-the deck and drank from the bucket .

“ It ’s the loveliest thing [I]80-lucy have ever tasted , ”[80-lucy] [she]80-lucy said with a kind of gasp . “ But oh — it ’s strong . [We]2764-we sha n’t need to eat anything now . ”[80-lucy]

And one by one [everybody on board]1690-everybody on board drank . And for a long time [they]1690-everybody on board were all silent . [They]1690-everybody on board felt almost too well and strong to bear it ; and presently [they]1690-everybody on board began to notice another result . As [I]0-i have said before , there had been too much light ever since [they]1690-everybody on board left [the island of [Ramandu]176-ramandu]1691-the island of ramandu — the sun too large ( though not too hot ) , [the sea]250-the sea too bright , the air too shining . Now , the light grew no less — if anything , it increased — but [they]1690-everybody on board could bear it . [They]1690-everybody on board could look straight up at the sun without blinking . [They]1690-everybody on board could see more light than [they]1690-everybody on board had ever seen before . And [the deck]255-the deck and the sail and [their]1690-everybody on board own faces and bodies became brighter and brighter and every rope shone . And next morning , when the sun rose , now five or six times its old size , [they]1690-everybody on board stared hard into it and could see the very feathers of the birds that came flying from it .

Hardly a word was spoken on board all that day , till about dinner - time ( [no one]1909-no one wanted any dinner , the water was enough for [them]1690-everybody on board ) [Drinian]98-drinian said :

“ [I]98-drinian ca n’t understand this . There is not a breath of wind . The sail hangs dead . [The sea]250-the sea is as flat as [a pond]2768-a pond . And yet [we]1690-everybody on board drive on as fast as if there were a gale behind [us]1690-everybody on board . ”[98-drinian]

“ [I]85-caspian ’ve been thinking that , too , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [We]1690-everybody on board must be caught in some strong current . ”[85-caspian]

“ H’m , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ That ’s not so nice if [the World]1877-the world really has an edge and [we]1690-everybody on board ’re getting near it . ”[79-edmund]

“ [You]85-caspian mean , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ that [we]1690-everybody on board might be just well , poured over it ? ”[85-caspian]

“ Yes , yes , ”[89-reepicheep] cried [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , clapping [his]89-reepicheep paws together . “ That ’s how [I]89-reepicheep ’ve always imagined it — [the World]1877-the world like a great round table and [the waters of [all the oceans]2772-all the oceans]2771-the waters of all the oceans endlessly pouring over the edge . [The ship]234-the ship will tip up stand on [her]234-the ship head — for one moment [we]1690-everybody on board shall see over the edge — and then , down , down , the rush , the speed — ”[89-reepicheep]

“ And what do [you]98-drinian think will be waiting for [us]1690-everybody on board at the bottom , eh ? ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s country]1882-aslan ’s country perhaps , ”[89-reepicheep] said [the Mouse]89-reepicheep , its eyes shining . “ Or perhaps there is n’t any bottom . Perhaps it goes down for ever and ever . But whatever it is , wo n’t it be worth anything just to have looked for one moment beyond the edge of [the world]1877-the world . ”[89-reepicheep]

“ But look — here , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace , “ this is all rot . [The world]1877-the world ’s round — [I]73-eustace mean , round like a ball , not like a table . ”[73-eustace]

“ [Our]1690-everybody on board world is , ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ But is this ? ”[79-edmund]

“ Do [you]98-drinian mean to say , ”[85-caspian] asked [Caspian]85-caspian , “ that [you]98-drinian three come from [a round world]2777-a round world ( round like a ball ) and [you]98-drinian ’ve never told [me]85-caspian ! It ’s really too bad of [you]98-drinian . Because [we]1690-everybody on board have fairy - tales in which there are [round worlds]2778-round worlds and [I]85-caspian always loved them . If only [I]85-caspian had the chance ! It must be exciting to live on a thing like a ball . Have [you]98-drinian ever been to the parts where [people]207-people walk about upside - down ? ”[85-caspian]

[Edmund]79-edmund shook [his]79-edmund head . “ And it is n’t like that , ”[79-edmund] [he]79-edmund added . “ There ’s nothing particularly exciting about [a round world]2777-a round world when [you]98-drinian ’re there .[79-edmund]

[REEPICHEEP]89-reepicheep was [the only person on board]1695-the only person on board besides [Drinian]98-drinian and [the two Pevensies who had noticed [the Sea People]183-the sea people]1696-the two pevensies who had noticed the sea people . [He]89-reepicheep had dived in at once when [he]89-reepicheep saw [the Sea King]1697-the sea king shaking [his]1697-the sea king spear , for [he]89-reepicheep regarded this as a sort of threat or challenge and wanted to have the matter out there and then . As things turned out [they]1698-they need hardly have bothered , for by this time [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader was gliding over [a part of [the sea]250-the sea which seemed to be uninhabited]1699-a part of the sea which seemed to be uninhabited . [No one]1909-no one except [Lucy]80-lucy saw anything more of [the People]1961-the people , and even [she]80-lucy had only one short glimpse . All morning on the following day [they]1698-they sailed in fairly shallow water and the bottom was weedy . Just before midday [Lucy]80-lucy saw a large shoal of fishes grazing on the weed . [They]1698-they were all eating steadily and all moving in the same direction . “ Just like a flock of sheep , ”[80-lucy] thought [Lucy]80-lucy . Suddenly [she]80-lucy saw [a little Sea Girl of about [her]1703-a little sea girl of about her own age in the middle of them own age in the middle of [them]1698-they]1703-a little sea girl of about her own age in the middle of them — [a quiet , lonely - looking girl with a sort of crook in [her]1703-a little sea girl of about her own age in the middle of them hand]1704-a quiet , lonely - looking girl with a sort of crook in her hand . [Lucy]80-lucy felt sure that [this girl]1705-this girl must be [a shepherdess]1706-a shepherdess — or perhaps [a fish - herdess]1707-a fish - herdess and that the shoal was really a flock at pasture . Both the fishes and [the girl]1222-the girl were quite close to the surface . And just as [the girl]1222-the girl , gliding in the shallow water , and [Lucy]80-lucy , leaning over the bulwark , came opposite to [one another]1087-one another , [the girl]1222-the girl looked up and stared straight into [Lucy]80-lucy ’s face . [Neither]944-neither could speak to [the other]471-the other and in a moment [the Sea Girl]1714-the sea girl dropped astern . But [Lucy]80-lucy will never forget [her]1714-the sea girl face . It did not look frightened or angry like those of [the other Sea People]1715-the other sea people . [Lucy]80-lucy had liked [that girl]1716-that girl and [she]80-lucy felt certain [the girl]1222-the girl had liked [her]1716-that girl . In that one moment [they]1718-they had somehow become [friends]841-friends . There does not seem to be much chance of [their]1718-they meeting again in [that world]968-that world or any other . But if ever [they]1718-they do [they]1718-they will rush together with [their]1718-they hands held out .

After that for many days , without wind in [her]1714-the sea girl shrouds or foam at [her]1714-the sea girl bows , across [a waveless sea]1721-a waveless sea , [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader glided smoothly east . Every day and every hour the light became more brilliant and still [they]1718-they could bear it . [No one]1909-no one ate or slept and [no one]1909-no one wanted to , but [they]1718-they drew buckets of dazzling water from [the sea]250-the sea , stronger than wine and somehow wetter , more liquid , than ordinary water , and pledged [one another]1087-one another silently in deep draughts of it . And [one or two of [the sailors who had been [oldish men when the voyage began]1729-oldish men when the voyage began]1728-the sailors who had been oldish men when the voyage began]1727-one or two of the sailors who had been oldish men when the voyage began now grew younger every day . [Everyone on board]390-everyone on board was filled with joy and excitement , but not an excitement that made [one]256-one talk . The further [they]1718-they sailed the less [they]1718-they spoke , and then almost in a whisper . The stillness of [that last sea]1732-that last sea laid hold on [them]1718-they .

“ [[My]85-caspian Lord]1993-my lord , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian to [Drinian]98-drinian one day , “ what do [you]98-drinian see ahead ? ”[85-caspian]

“ [Sire]1874-sire , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian , “ [I]98-drinian see whiteness . All along the horizon from north to south , as far as [my]98-drinian eyes can reach . ”[98-drinian]

“ That is what [I]85-caspian see too , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian , “ and [I]85-caspian can not imagine what it is . ”[85-caspian]

“ If [we]1733-they were in higher latitudes , [[your]1874-sire Majesty]1838-your majesty , ”[98-drinian] said [Drinian]98-drinian , “ [I]98-drinian would say it was ice . But it ca n’t be that ; not here . All the same , [we]1733-they ’d better get [men]694-men to the oars and hold [the ship]234-the ship back against the current . Whatever the stuff is , [we]1733-they do n’t want to crash into it at this speed ! ”[98-drinian]

[They]1733-they did as [Drinian]98-drinian said , and so continued to go slower and slower . The whiteness did not get any less mysterious as [they]1733-they — approached [it]1734-it . If it was [land]395-land [it]1734-it must be [a very strange land]1736-a very strange land , for [it]1734-it seemed just as smooth as [the water]1834-the water and on the same level with [it]1834-the water . When [they]1733-they got very close to [it]1734-it [Drinian]98-drinian put the helm hard over and turned the [Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader south so that [she]109-the dawn treader was broadside on to the current and rowed a little way southward along [the edge of [the whiteness]1739-the whiteness]1738-the edge of the whiteness . In so doing [they]1733-they accidentally made the important discovery that the current was only about forty feet wide and the rest of [the sea]250-the sea as still as [a pond]2768-a pond . This was good news for [the crew]704-the crew , who had already begun to think that the return journey to [[Ramandu]176-ramandu ’s land]1743-ramandu ’s land , rowing against stream all the way , would be pretty poor sport . ( It also explained why [the shepherd girl]1744-the shepherd girl had dropped so quickly astern . [She]1744-the shepherd girl was not in the current . If [she]1744-the shepherd girl had been [she]1744-the shepherd girl would have been moving east at the same speed as [the ship]234-the ship . )

And still [no one]1909-no one could make out what the white stuff was . Then [the boat]1923-the boat was lowered and [it]1923-the boat put off to investigate . [Those who remained on the Dawn Treader]1748-those who remained on the dawn treader could see that [the boat]1923-the boat pushed right in amidst the whiteness . Then [they]1748-those who remained on the dawn treader could hear the voices of the party in [the boat]1923-the boat clear across the still water ) talking in a shrill and surprised way . Then there was a pause while [Rynelf]86-rynelf in the bows of [the boat]1923-the boat took a sounding ; and when , after that , [the boat]1923-the boat came rowing back there seemed to be plenty of the white stuff inside [her]1923-the boat . [Everyone]251-everyone crowded to the side to hear the news .

“ Lilies , [[your]2787-your Majesty]1838-your majesty ! ”[86-rynelf] shouted [Rynelf]86-rynelf , standing up in the bows .

“ What did [you]86-rynelf say ? ”[85-caspian] asked [Caspian]85-caspian .

“ Blooming lilies , [[your]2787-your Majesty]1838-your majesty , ”[86-rynelf] said [Rynelf]86-rynelf . “ Same as in [a pool]2790-a pool or in [a garden]2265-a garden at [home]296-home . ”[86-rynelf]

“ Look ! ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , who was in the stern of [the boat]1923-the boat . [She]80-lucy held up [her]80-lucy wet arms full of white petals and broad flat leaves .

“ What ’s the depth , [Rynelf]86-rynelf ? ”[98-drinian] asked [Drinian]98-drinian .

“ That ’s the funny thing , [Captain]2061-captain , ”[86-rynelf] said [Rynelf]86-rynelf . “ [It]2794-it ’s still deep . Three and a half fathoms clear . ”[86-rynelf]

“ [They]1755-they ca n’t be real lilies — not what [we]1756-they call lilies , ”[73-eustace] said [Eustace]73-eustace .

Probably [they]1755-they were not , but [they]1755-they were very like [them]1755-they . And when , after some consultation , [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader turned back into the current and began to glide eastward through [the Lily Lake]66-the lily lake or [the Silver Sea]67-the silver sea ( [they]1756-they tried both these names but it was [the Silver Sea]67-the silver sea that stuck and is now on [Caspian]85-caspian ’s map ) the strangest part of [their]1756-they travels began . Very soon [the open sea which [they]1756-they were leaving]1757-the open sea which they were leaving was only a thin rim of blue on the western horizon . Whiteness , shot with faintest colour of gold , spread round [them]1756-they on every side , except just astern where [their]1756-they passage had thrust the lilies apart and left an open lane of water that shone like dark green glass . To look at , [this last sea]1758-this last sea was very like [the Arctic]68-the arctic ; and if [their]1756-they eyes had not by now grown as strong as eagles ’ the sun on all that whiteness — especially at early morning when the sun was hugest would have been unbearable . And every evening the same whiteness made the daylight last longer . There seemed no end to the lilies . Day after day from all those miles and leagues of flowers there rose a smell which [Lucy]80-lucy found it very hard to describe ; sweet — yes , but not at all sleepy or overpowering , a fresh , wild , lonely smell that seemed to get into [your]1759-you brain and make [you]1759-you feel that [you]1759-you could go up mountains at a run or wrestle with an elephant . [She]80-lucy and [Caspian]85-caspian said to [one another]1087-one another , “ [I]80-lucy feel that [I]80-lucy ca n’t stand much more of this , yet [I]80-lucy do n’t want it to stop . ”[80-lucy]

[They]1756-they took soundings very often but it was only several days later that [the water]1834-the water became shallower . After that it went on getting shallower . There came a day when [they]1756-they had to row out of the current and feel [their]1756-they way forward at a snail ’s pace , rowing . And soon it was clear that [the Dawn Treader]382-the dawn treader could sail no further east . Indeed it was only by very clever handling that [they]1756-they saved [her]382-the dawn treader from grounding .

“ Lower [the boat]1923-the boat , ”[85-caspian] cried [Caspian]85-caspian , “ and then call [the men]2173-the men aft . [I]85-caspian must speak to [them]2173-the men . ”[85-caspian]

“ Talking beasts , yes , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian . “ [I]85-caspian said nothing about beasts that never stop talking . ”[85-caspian] And [he]85-caspian flung down the ladder in a temper and went into [the cabin]287-the cabin , slamming the door .

But when [the others]1949-the others rejoined [him]85-caspian a little later [they]1949-the others found [him]85-caspian changed ; [he]85-caspian was white and there were tears in [his]85-caspian eyes .

“ It ’s no good , ”[85-caspian] [he]85-caspian said . “ [I]85-caspian might as well have behaved decently for all the good [I]85-caspian did with [my]85-caspian temper and swagger . [Aslan]91-aslan has spoken to [me]85-caspian . No — [I]85-caspian do n’t mean [he]91-aslan was actually [here]1830-here . [He]91-aslan would n’t fit into [the cabin]287-the cabin , for one thing . But that gold lion ’s head on the wall came to life and spoke to [me]85-caspian . It was terrible [his]91-aslan eyes . Not that [he]91-aslan was at all rough with [me]85-caspian — only a bit stern at first . But it was terrible all the same . And [he]91-aslan said — [he]91-aslan said — oh , [I]85-caspian ca n’t bear it . The worst thing [he]91-aslan could have said . [You]80-lucy ’re to go on — [Reep]120-reep and [Edmund]79-edmund , and [Lucy]80-lucy , and [Eustace]73-eustace ; and [I]85-caspian ’m to go back . Alone . And at once . And what is the good of anything ? ”[85-caspian]

“ [Caspian]85-caspian , [dear]2838-dear , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy . “ [You]85-caspian knew [we]1771-they ’d have to go back to [[our]1771-they own world]2839-our own world sooner or later . ”[80-lucy]

“ Yes , ”[85-caspian] said [Caspian]85-caspian with a sob , “ but this is sooner . ”[85-caspian]

“ [You]85-caspian ’ll feel better when [you]85-caspian get back to [Ramandu ’s Island]70-ramandu ’s island , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

[He]85-caspian cheered up a little later on , but it was a grievous parting oo both sides and [I]0-i will not dwell on it . About two o’clock in the afternoon , well victualled and watered ( though [they]1771-they thought [they]1771-they would need neither food nor drink ) and with [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep ’s coracle on board , [the boat]1923-the boat pulled away from [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader to row through the endless carpet of lilies . [The Dawn Trader]191-the dawn trader flew all [her]191-the dawn trader flags and hung out [her]191-the dawn trader shields to honour [their]1771-they departure . Tall and big and homelike [she]191-the dawn trader looked from [their]1771-they low position with the lilies all round [them]1771-they . And before [she]191-the dawn trader was out of sight [they]1771-they saw [her]191-the dawn trader turn and begin rowing slowly westward . Yet though [Lucy]80-lucy shed a few tears , [she]80-lucy could not feel it as much as [you]1773-you might have expected . The light , the silence , the tingling smell of [the Silver Sea]67-the silver sea , even ( in some odd way ) the loneliness itself , were too exciting .

There was no need to row , for the current drifted [them]1771-they steadily to the east . [None of [them]1771-they]1870-none of them slept or ate . All that night and all next day [they]1771-they glided eastward , and when the third day dawned — with a brightness [you]1773-you or [I]0-i could not bear even if [we]1775-we had dark glasses on — [they]1771-they saw a wonder ahead . It was as if a wall stood up between [them]1771-they and the sky , a greenish - grey , trembling , shimmering wall . Then up came the sun , and at its first rising [they]1771-they saw it through the wall and it turned into wonderful rainbow colours . Then [they]1771-they knew that the wall was really a long , tall wave — a wave endlessly fixed in one place as [you]1773-you may often see at the edge of a waterfall . It seemed to be about thirty feet high , and the current was gliding [them]1771-they swiftly towards it . [You]1773-you might have supposed [they]1771-they would have thought of [their]1771-they danger . [They]1771-they did n’t . [I]0-i do n’t think [anyone]1930-anyone could have in [their]1771-they position . For now [they]1771-they saw something not only behind the wave but behind the sun . [They]1771-they could not have seen even the sun if [their]1771-they eyes had not been strengthened by [the water of [the Last Sea]71-the last sea]1777-the water of the last sea . But now [they]1771-they could look at the rising sun and see it clearly and see things beyond it . What [they]1771-they saw — eastward , beyond the sun — was [a range of mountains]1778-a range of mountains . It was so high that either [they]1771-they never saw the top of it or [they]1771-they forgot it . [None of [them]1771-they]1870-none of them remembers seeing any sky in that direction . And [the mountains]752-the mountains must really have been outside [the world]1877-the world . For any mountains even a quarter of a twentieth of that height ought to have had ice and snow on them . But these were warm and green and full , of forests and waterfalls however high [you]1782-you looked . And suddenly there came a breeze from the east , tossing the top of the wave into foamy shapes and ruffling the smooth water all round [them]1771-they . It lasted only a second or so but what it brought [them]1771-they in that second [none of [those three children]1784-those three children]1783-none of those three children will ever forget . It brought both a smell and a sound , a musical sound [Edmund]79-edmund and [Eustace]73-eustace would never talk about it afterwards . [Lucy]80-lucy could only say , “ It would break [your]0-i heart . ”[80-lucy] “ Why , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , “ was it so sad : “[0-i] “ Sad ! ! No , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy .

[No one in [that boat]1786-that boat]1785-no one in that boat doubted chat [they]1771-they were seeing beyond [the End of [the World]58-the world]2151-the end of the world into [Aslan ’s country]1882-aslan ’s country .

At that moment , with a crunch , [the boat]1923-the boat ran aground . The water was too shallow now for it . “ This , ”[89-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep , “ is where [I]89-reepicheep go on alone . ”[89-reepicheep]

[They]1771-they did not even try to stop [dim]1790-dim , for everything now felt as if it had been fated or had happened before . [They]1771-they helped [him]89-reepicheep to lower [his]89-reepicheep little coracle . Then [he]89-reepicheep took off [his]89-reepicheep sword ( “ [I]89-reepicheep shall need it no more , ”[89-reepicheep] [he]89-reepicheep said ) and flung it far away across [the Idled sea]1791-the idled sea . Where it fell it stood upright with the hilt above the surface . Then [he]89-reepicheep bade [them]1771-they goodbye trying to be sad for [their]1771-they sakes but [he]89-reepicheep was quivering with happiness . [Lucy]80-lucy , for the first and last time , did what [she]80-lucy had always wanted to do , taking [him]89-reepicheep in [her]80-lucy arms and caressing [him]89-reepicheep . Then hastily [he]89-reepicheep got into [his]89-reepicheep coracle and took [his]89-reepicheep paddle , and the current caught it and away [he]89-reepicheep went , very black against the lilies . But no lilies grew on the wave ; it was a smooth green slope . The coracle went more and more quickly , and beautifully it rushed up the wave ’s side . For one split second [they]1771-they saw its shape and [Reepicheep]89-reepicheep ’s on the very top . Then it vanished , and since that moment [no one]1909-no one can truly claim to have seen [Reepicheep the Mouse]89-reepicheep . But [my]0-i belief is that [he]89-reepicheep came safe to [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s country]1882-aslan ’s country and is alive [there]226-there to this day .

As the sun rose the sight of [those mountains outside [the world]1877-the world]1795-those mountains outside the world faded away . The wave remained but there was only blue sky behind [it]1797-it .

[The children]481-the children got out of [the boat]1923-the boat and waded — not towards the wave but southward with the wall of water on [their]481-the children left . [They]481-the children could not have told [you]1800-you why [they]481-the children did this ; it was [their]481-the children fate . And though [they]481-the children had felt — and been very grown - up on [the Dawn Treader]109-the dawn treader , [they]481-the children now felt just the opposite and held hands as [they]481-the children waded through the lilies . [They]481-the children never felt tired . The water was warm and all the time it got shallower . At last [they]481-the children were on [dry sand]1801-dry sand , and then on grass — a huge plain of very fine short grass , almost level with [the Silver Sea]67-the silver sea and spreading in every direction without so much as a molehill .

And of course , as it always does in a perfectly flat place without trees , it looked as if the sky came down to meet the grass in front of [them]481-the children . But as [they]481-the children went on [they]481-the children got the strangest impression that here at last the sky did really come down and join [the earth]1287-the earth — a blue wall , very bright , but real and solid : more like glass than anything else . And soon [they]481-the children were quite sure of it . [It]1803-it was very near now .

But between [them]481-the children and the foot of the sky there was something so white on the green grass that even with [their]481-the children eagles ’ eyes [they]481-the children could hardly look at it . [They]481-the children came on and saw that it was [a Lamb]1804-a lamb .

“ Come and have breakfast , ”[192-the lamb] said [the Lamb]192-the lamb in [its]192-the lamb sweet milky voice .

Then [they]481-the children noticed for the first time that there was a fire lit on the grass and fish roasting on it . [They]481-the children sat down and ate the fish , hungry now for the first time for many days . And it was the most delicious food [they]481-the children had ever tasted .

“ Please , [Lamb]192-the lamb , ”[80-lucy] said [Lucy]80-lucy , “ is this the way to [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s country]1882-aslan ’s country ? ”[80-lucy]

“ Not for [you]80-lucy , ”[1805-the lamb] said [the Lamb]1805-the lamb . “ For [you]80-lucy the door into [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s country]1882-aslan ’s country is from [[your]80-lucy own world]2842-your own world . ”[1805-the lamb]

“ What ! ”[79-edmund] said [Edmund]79-edmund . “ Is there a way into [[Aslan]91-aslan ’s country]1882-aslan ’s country from [[our]2844-our world]281-our world too ? ”[79-edmund]

“ There is a way into [[my]192-the lamb country]2846-my country from [all the worlds]2847-all the worlds , ”[192-the lamb] said [the Lamb]192-the lamb ; but as [he]192-the lamb spoke [his]192-the lamb snowy white flushed into tawny gold and [his]192-the lamb size changed and [he]192-the lamb was [Aslan]91-aslan [himself]192-the lamb , towering above [them]1806-them and scattering light from [his]192-the lamb mane .

“ [Dearest]2852-dearest , ”[91-aslan] said [Aslan]91-aslan very gently , “ [you]2852-dearest and [[your]2852-dearest brother]2853-your brother will never come balk to [Narnia]2-narnia . ”[91-aslan]

Come , [I]91-aslan am opening the door in the sky . ”[91-aslan] Then all in one moment there was a rending of the blue wall ( like a curtain being torn ) and a terrible white light from beyond the sky , and the feel of [Aslan]91-aslan ’s mane and a [Lion]156-the lion ’s kiss on [their]1807-their foreheads and then — the bark bedroom in [[Aunt Alberta]76-alberta ’s home in [Cambridge]19-cambridge]1808-aunt alberta ’s home in cambridge .
